loans.name: Veronica Del Carmen

texts.es:
Verónica, vive con su esposo, no tienen hijos, ella es comerciante de queso y ropa, este negocio lo tiene en el mercado municipal desde hace 5 años, tiene buena ubicación para atender a la clientela.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de blusas, camisas, faldas, y queso al por mayor, esta inversión le ayudara para mejorar el negocio, fortaleciéndolo para obtener mejores ventas.
El objetivo de Verónica es tener un mejor negocio, con la mercadería necesaria para abastecer la demanda, dándole una mayor seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Verónica lives with her husband and they have no children.  She is a merchant and sells cheese and clothing.  Her 5-year-old business is set up in the municipal market and well-located to attend to customers.

She is requesting a loan to buy blouses, shirts, skirts and cheese, wholesale.  This investment will help her improve and strengthen her business so she can increase sales.

Verónica's goal is to have a better business and enough merchandise to meet demand, which will give her a more stable economy.

loans.use: To buy blouses, shirts, skirts and cheese.

loans.name: Roger Antonio

texts.es: Roger Antonio tiene 35 años de edad, se dedica a un taller de costura ya tiene varios años de experiencia en el negocio, este taller lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación muchas de las empresas lo buscan por la calidad de servicio que brinda. Roger Antonio está solicitando financiamiento para comprar telas, hilos entre otras cosas que necesita para la elaboración de la prendas.
texts.en: Roger Antonio, 35, is a tailor with many years of experience.  His shop is located in his house and many companies seek him out because of the quality of his service.  Roger Antonio is requesting a loan to buy fabrics, thread and other items he needs to make clothing.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, thread and other items.

loans.name: Matalena

texts.en: Matalena is a 50-year-old woman who is married with six children. She runs a business clothing in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. Matalena has requested a loan to buy more secondhand clothes and etc. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy cloths, sewing machine, and needles

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en: Financial constraints alongside the want for a better life and good quality education for her 5 children are only a few but valuable factors that encouraged our Naheed  to start her business selling animals by taking a loan from Kashf Foundation.  Naheed  is 49 years old.  She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a Murabaha loan of PKR 40000  to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales

loans.name: Elman

texts.en:
He started his business as a taxi driver. In spite of the fact that he is taxi driver he is interested in the sale of genuine leather  goods. He borrowed  the loan $300 in order to repair his car. Then he decided to apply for a loan $600 in order to start his new business. In the beginning his business he drove some small retail trade. He has been engaged in this business  for 10 years. He likes both businesses and he can not leave one of these businesses. He borrowed the loan amount of $1000 for the extensive repairs of his car. 
He needs $1800 to change the car with the lorry in order to transport  of the  genuine leather  goods from the regions  and to improve the sale of the genuine leather  goods. Elman is married, has 3 children. This 59-year-old businessmen is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Agdam. He and his family settled in the building of Sevinj  nursery school in Khirdalan town.

loans.use: To buy the lorry

loans.name: Dunia Guadalupe

texts.en: I buy and sell new and used clothing since having more options causes my customers to buy more. I need capital to be able to stock my inventory and increase my income so that I can help and support my children and keep them in schools that will give them a good education.

loans.use: Purchase of new clothing to sell: jeans, tee-shirts, skirts, etc.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en: Mr. Raphael N., a 46 year old dynamic client of LAPO. He is married with four children and has proved his worth of experience in his line of business. He is maintaining his repayment schedule with LAPO without fail. He needs this money ($500) to keep his business booming.

loans.use: To buy more gas cookers for sale

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Mrs. Hong S. (on the left with the blue shirt) is 26 years old  and sells mangos to the people in her community. She can generate about $2 per day in profit, while her husband makes on average around $3.30 a day by plowing other people's rice paddies, using his own tractor. This loan will be used to repair their house in order to keep it from leaking during the rainy season.

loans.use: To repair their house which often leaks during the rainy season.

loans.name: Damián

texts.es:
Damián lives with his wife and children in the city of Pucallpa. With his wife, who is his friend and partner, he sells vegetables at the "La Hoyada" market. His wife started the sale of these products on a small table 12 years ago and diligently they have taken advantage of the mornings to satisfy the customers´ needs of vegetables for the preparation of delicious lunches. Don Damián is also a construction worker and his extra income contributes to the household economy and the education of the children. Thanks to their dedication they are succeeding in improving even if they do not have a stable sales stand they are not giving up, on the contrary they stay focused on their goal.

Damián needs $400 to obtain one of the conditioned sales booths at the market and his plan is to repay the loan in 6 months. Remember that with your support Damian´s family will be able to improve their life quality.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer

Damián es padre de familia, vive con su esposa e hijos en la ciudad de Pucallpa, realiza en compañía de su esposa, amiga y socia la venta de verduras en el mercado “La Hoyada”.Su esposa tuvo la iniciativa, empezó con la venta estos productos en una pequeña mesa hace 12 años y diligentemente todos los días aprovechan la mañana para satisfacer los pedidos de sus clientes que llegan presurosos para encontrar lo necesario para preparar sus apetitosos almuerzos; Damián paralelo a la venta de verduras es maestro albañil y esta actividad le genera ingresos adicionales que ayudan a la economía familiar y a la educación de sus hijos. Gracias a la dedicación e ímpetu están logrando salir adelante a pesar de no contar con un puesto laboral estable jamás se rindieron por el contrario siempre se mantuvieron firmes en sus propósitos.Damián necesita 400 dólares para obtener un puesto de ventas acondicionado en el mercado y les extiende su compromiso de devolver este dinero en un lapso 6 meses. Recuerda que con tu ayuda la familia de Damián podrá incrementar su calidad de vida

loans.use: La Compra de más productos permitirá la obtención de un espacio acondicionado  para el negocio de Damián.

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en: Mrs. R. Sopheak was married in 2006 and has one daughter. A relative taught her how to weave in 2001 and she started silk production in the same year. She and her husband live with her parents.Her husband is a bricklayer, a skilled painter and an artist. He also owns a horse and cart which he uses to transport local people around the area. Neither husband nor wife finished primary school This is the first time R. Sopheak has requested a loan from MAXIMA, for the amount of $200. She intends to use this loan to purchase additional silk materials and sewing thread in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase silk material and sewing thread for selecting and preparing silk on the loom

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
Martha Lorena M. is a single woman with 4 children, who have been her greatest motivation to begin a business. While stabilizing her own business, she can give her family a good future and help them improve their standard of living.

Before beginning her business, she dedicated herself to helping her parents’ business for months. Once she began her own business, she started in a market, and then moved up to the Market Terminal and obtained a fixed stand with a better structure.

Currently, the infrastructure of her business does not meet the need to protect her products from the sun and rain, taking into account that they are perishable products and they require more care and hygiene. However, her project is to buy merchandise in order to supply her business with more and, at the same time, invest her earnings in infrastructure so she may gain a better presence at the market which will attract more customers.

Martha Lorena started her business with savings in the initial amount of CS 1,000.00 (Cordobas). She has worked with CEPRODEL for two years granting her 33 credits, which have helped her grow her finances and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha Lorena M. es una mujer soltera con 4 hijos, los cuales han sido su mayor animación para emprender en un negocio y asi darle un buen futuro a su familia al igual que estabilizar su propio negocio ayudandole a mejorar su nivel de vida.

Antes de dar inicio a su negocio ella se dedicaba ayudando al negocio de sus padres por meses. Al dar inicio a su propio negocio empezó en mercado, luego pasó al Mercado la Terminal logrando tener su puesto fijo mejorando asi la estructura del mismo .

Actualmente la infraestructura de su negocio no cubre con las necesidad de proteger sus productos del sol y la lluvia, tomando en cuenta que son productos perecederos y requieren de un mayor cuidado e higiene. Pero su proyecto es comprar la mercaderia para surtir mas su negocio y al mismo tiempo con las ganancias invertir en infraestructura para una mejor presencia en el mercado y atraer mayor clientela

Martha Lorena dio inicio a su negocio con ahorros con un monto inicial de CS 1,000.00 (Córdobas). Ha trabajado con CEPRODEL desee hace dos años, otorgandole 33 créditos, los cuales le han ayudado a crecer sus finanzas y mejoramiento del mismo negocio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Mrs. Patience O. sells clothes and also sews clothes for people living in her community. She is married with 9 children, and she is 50 years old and a LAPO member. She is asking for the loan of $525 to buy more clothes for sale and also to expand her business. She learned her business for 12 months and has been in it since 1985.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Ol

texts.en: Mrs. Ol C., 30, works as a grocery vendor normally earning on average $5 a day of profit. Her husband Mr. Vong Vy, 29, works as a farmer and he generally earns around $2 a day. This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase more groceries to sell in large amounts. At the same time, they will use this money to renovate their house, too.

loans.use: Ol hopes to use this loan to purchase more groceries to sell in large amounts.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 30 year old Rehema N.. She is married with five children, between the ages of 2 and 14. She has two other dependents, who live with her because they are her younger sisters.

In 2000, Rehema established a fruit and vegetable stall business. Working seven days a week from 9 to 12 hours a day and assisted by her children, she earns about $75.00 a month from this business. Rehema now requires a new loan to purchase additional stock in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $30.00. In the future, Rehema also plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock.

When you walk down the streets of Dar, you are greeted at almost every corner by a stall or wheelbarrow full of mangoes, pineapples, bananas or sugarcane. Rehema is one such seller of this luscious fruit and she thanks you for the support she needs to continue and expand.

loans.use: To purchase fruit and vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Socorro Felicidad's Group

texts.es:
Felicidad, Socorro and Eduarda have belonged to the Community Bank “Nueva Era” for 8, 7, and 3 years respectively.

Felicidad is married, 68 years old and has two daughters. She has a store where she sells groceries, vegetables and clothes, located in the district of Quinua, one hour from the city of Ayacucho. Socorro is married, 35 years old and has two daughters. Socorro sells clothes on credit to friends and relatives. She also sells cosmetics through catalogues.

Eduarda is married, 45 years old and has three children. Eduarda goes to the Huanta market where she buys small animals, selling them in the district of Quinua. She also makes clay crafts. Felicidad, Socorro and Eduarda need loans of 1000 soles, 1000 soles and 300 soles respectively, money for the purchase of rice, sugar, milk, oil, snacks, creams, perfume, clothes and guinea pig. The dreams of Felicidad, Socorro and Eduarda are that their businesses prosper, they have stable jobs and their children are professionals.

Translated from Spanish] by Helen C. Smith, Kiva Volunteer.

Felicidad, Socorro y Eduarda pertenecen al Banco Comunal Nueva Era hace 8, 7, 3 años respectivamente.

Felicidad es casada, tiene 68 años y 2 hijas, Felicidad tiene una bodega donD. venD., abarrotes, verduras, ropa, esta ubicado en el distrito D. Quinua que esta a 1 hora D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Por otro lado Socorro es casada, tiene 35 años y 2 hijas, Felicidad venD. ropa a crédito a amigos y familiares. Además venD. cosméticos por catálogos.

Mientras que Eduarda es casada, tiene 45 años y 3 hijos, Eduarda viaja a la feria D. Huanta donD. compra animales menores y lo venD. en el Distrito D. Quinua. Además realiza artesanías en arcilla.

Felicidad, Socorro y Eduarda necesitan préstamos D. 1000 soles, 1000 soles, 300 soles respectivamente, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, golosinas, cremas, perfumes, ropa y cuy.

Los sueños D. Felicidad, Socorro y Eduarda son que sus negocios prosperen, tener un trabajo estable y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Felicidad, Socorro and Eduarda need loans of 1000 soles, 1000 soles and 300 soles respectively, money for the purchase of rice, sugar, milk, oil, snacks, creams, perfume, clothes and guinea pig

loans.name: Faatoaga

texts.en:
Faatoaga T., 66, is married with six children. Not allowing her age to restrict her, Faatoaga is still very active. She has been selling vegetables for many years to the people in her village, working six days per week.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~$83 USD). This is Mrs. T.'s first loan request. She sees this first loan as a very successful way for sustainable development in her family.

loans.use: To purchase cabbages, tomatoes, cucumbers, pumpkins, lemons, and a small cash box

loans.name: Sulesa Tapusoa's Group

texts.en:
This is the second group from the Vaitoomuli 1 Center on the big island of Savaii. This is the first loan for these women, who will be starting a taro plantation and sewing businesses. They will use the loan to purchase chemicals, a wheelbarrow, weed killer, weed spray, and bush knives for the plantation and material, a sewing machine, and other items for the sewing businesses.

This loan offers a good opportunity to provide the members' families with extra income and to move away from dependence on other villagers for survival. The group members know that, if they work hard on their businesses, they can look forward to another loan to extend the businesses, renovate their houses, and pay their children's school fees.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, a wheelbarrow, weed killer, weed spray, and bush knives for the plantation and material, a sewing machine, and other items for the sewing businesses

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara started her business because her husband worked as a bricklayer at that time, and they did not have enough money to cover their 3 young daughters’ expenses. Furthermore, they were in debt, so they needed the extra income. Sara's husband was not able to bear their situation, so he left them, which is why she felt the need to help her daughters get ahead in life.

She started her business 7 years ago when she requested a loan in order to purchase jewelry and sell it. Thanks to her hard work and dedication, she has managed to establish a client-base that has been increasing, and she now sells shoes as well.

She is requesting a loan of $300.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can purchase glass cases to display her merchandise because her business is prospering and she wants it to succeed even more.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Sara inició el negocio dado que su esposo trabajaba como albañil y no les alcanzaba el dinero para los gastos de sus 3 pequeñas hijas además que tenían una deuda y necesitaban de ingresos extras ante esta situación su esposo no soporto la deuda y las dejo, motivo por el cual ella se vio en la necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijas.

Comenzó hace 7 años pidió un crédito para poder comprar un portafolio de joyería y empezar a vender su producto, gracias a su empeño y esfuerzo, ella ha logrado crear una cartera de clientes la cual se ha ido incrementando y ahora tambien vende zapatos.

Ella solicita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar vitrinas para exhibir su mercancía ya que le empieza a ir bien en su negocio y quiere que le vaya mucho mejor.

loans.use: Purchase glass display cases

loans.name: Sa

texts.en: Sa P., 43, lives in Siem Reap with her husband, Thoan Soeung, and their eight children. Sa P. stays at home to manage this large family, while her husband works as a fisherman making US$5 each day from selling his catch in the local food market. One of their children works at a local golf course, while three others sell various food products, and the rest are too young to be employed. Sa P. has asked for a loan of US$1000 to open up a food stand that sells roast beef and drinks. Previously, she had been employed in a similar food stand and now she believes she has the experience necessary to open her own business. She looks forward to watching this new enterprise grow and is optimistic about her investment.

loans.use: Sa would like to open up her own food stand, selling roast beef and drinks.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy is a 40-year-old entrepreneur and mother of 4 school-aged children. She lives with her husband in Mombasa, Kenya. She began her current business of dressmaking in 1997. She specializes in making both women's and men's clothing. Her business location coupled with her friendly interaction with customers has enabled her to establish a good client base. She owes her success to hard work and perseverance. She has also established a training site for girls who have dropped out of school (currently she has 10), who are trained in dressmaking. She has also employed a full-time tailor to meet her customers' demands. Dorothy plans to move to a more spacious site with her next loan of KSH 42,300.

loans.use: To relocate her business to a more spacious place

loans.name: Boris

texts.en:
Boris is married and lives in Beregovo, Western Ukraine. Boris sells retail items in the central town market. His vending location is characterized by nice selection of products and favorable location of the kiosk itself. Boris has been involved in this business for over 4 years. His nice assortment of inventory helps him get good sale rates despite the season.

Boris always puts much emphasis on growth of his business. He has learned some of the tricks that stimulate promotion of his enterprise and knows how to manage his time and finances well to add to success of the trade. Boris's business is the only source of income for his family. His venture provided him with much needed finances after the earthquake that had happened in his area. The insurance company refused to cover the expenses and Boris was forced to repair everything using his own money. He is requesting a loan of 2500 Grivnas to re-stock his merchandise.

Note: this is a short term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: Increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Enaradela Group

texts.en:
This is the Enaradela group: Masse S. and Tenneh S.. They have been with SMT for the past three years. The previous loans have made meaningful impacts in their lives. The last loan was for Le 500,000.00 each. Now they are requesting a loan of Le 800,000.00 each to enable them to further strengthen their businesses.

Masse is the leader of the group. She was born in Koindu in the Koinadugu District in northern Sierra Leone. She is thirty-nine and married with seven children. Four of her children are already married, two are in secondary schools, and one is in primary school. Her husband is a retired soldier, now working as a security guard in the government hospital. 

She has been in business for over twenty years. She buys husk rice before it is pounded and cleans it before selling. She buys a pan of husk rice from villages surrounding Kabala at Le 2,000.00 and sells at Le 3,000.00. Masse uses part of her profit to repay the loan, part to feed herself and her family, and the rest to buy cattle. She rears the cattle and keeps them as collateral. In an emergency situation, Masse can then sell the cattle.

loans.use: To purchase husk rice.

loans.name: Isaura Margarita

texts.es:
En el Mercado La Estacion en la ciudad de León la señora Isaura T. se dedica a la actividad de venta de frutas y verduras como lo son uvas, manzanas, papas, cebollas, chiltomas, plátanos, zanahorias, entre otros.

Su negocio lo ha venido desarrollando a través del tiempo ya que ha invertido grandemente para aumentar el volumen de venta de los perecederos. Es importante destacar que Ceprodel le ha beneficiado grandemente por lo que le ha brindado los créditos para la compra de estas frutas y verduras. Es por esta razón que ella espera una vez más que su crédito sea aprobado para continuar con su negocio en el mercado.
texts.en:
At the La Estacion market in the city of Leon, Isaura Telleria makes a living selling fruits and vegetables. Among other things, she sells grapes, apples, potatoes, onions, sweet peppers, platanos, and carrots.

Her business has grown over the years because she's invested significantly to increase her sales of perishables. It's important to note that Ceprodel has played a huge role in her success by extending loans to her to buy the fruits and vegetables she sells. She's now applying for another loan so that she can continue her business in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Choukouratou

texts.fr: Née le 10 Octobre 1971 à Sakété dans le département du Plateau au Sud du Bénin,Dame O. Choukouratou est marié à ABALIOU Razack. Mère de cinq enfants, elle s'est depuis près de dix ans spécialisé dans le vents de différents articles divers, plastiques, et l'eau. Comfrontés aujourd'hui à des difficultés financières, elle sollicite son troisième crédit pour remforcer son activité en ces périodes de fête de fin d'année.
texts.en:
Born on October 10, 1971, in Sakété in the Plateau department in the south of Bénin, Ms. Choukouratou O. is married to Razack Abaliou. A mother of five, she has specialized for the last ten years in the sale of miscellaneous items, plastics, and water. Confronted with financial hardships, she seeks this third loan to strengthen her business during these holiday periods at the end of the year.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two boxes of sugar and liquors for the holidays

loans.name: Chear

texts.en: Mrs. Chear S., 29 years old and the mother of two children, lives with her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia, where she earns around $3/day selling fish in a local market; her husband, a construction worker who builds houses, earns about $5 a day. Chear is requesting a loan to purchase a motorbike to transport the fish to market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es: Sarita tiene 48 años de edad, casada hace 26 años con el padre de sus 4 hijos, su hijo mayor vive en otra ciudad, por lo que está viviendo con sus 3 hijos en la casa heredó de un familiar. Se dedica a pastar sus animales, también le ayuda a su esposo con los cultivos generalmente  cultivan zanahorias, porque aprovecha doblemente este cultivo, cosechar y vende los frutos, y con el resto que no ha cosechado los procesa y para conseguir la semilla que vende a unos clientes bolivianos que las cotizan a un buen precio y se llevan de 100 a 200 kilos. Este proceso es muy trabajoso pero también muy rentable, en temporadas altas le llena de mucha alegría porque su negocio le permite cubrir los gastos de educación de sus hijos. En sus préstamos anteriores con MFP tuvo varios cargos, era secretaria, también vocal, y estos cargos los asumió con mucha responsabilidad, este es su 12vo crédito, y todo este tiempo ha demostrado pagar sus cuotas puntualmente. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes, para sus chacras de zanahorias y papas, para ayudar a desarrollar sus frutos y den un buen tamaño.
texts.en:
Sarita is 48 years old and has been married for 26 years. She has 4 children—her oldest son lives in another city so she lives with her other three children in a home a family member left her. She raises animals for a living in addition to helping her husband with their crops. Normally they plant carrots because they get an extra advantage with this crop: first they harvest the vegetables and sell them and with what they don’t harvest, they process the seeds and sell them to Bolivian clients, who buy 100-200 kilos at a good price. This process is a lot of work but it is profitable. In good seasons she is filled with happiness because her job allows her to cover educational costs for her children. With previous MFP loans she has had various responsibilities, like secretary and spokeswoman. This is her twelfth loan and she has always made her payments on time. The money she is asking for is to buy fertilizer for her carrot and potato fields, to help the plants develop into a good size.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Abdo

texts.en:
Abdo is a 44-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Abdo has been selling fruits since 1988. He has requested a loan of 500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his business.

This is Abdo's third loan cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him improve his business and diversify his merchandise. Abdo is special in his work because he has a good variety of fruits. His clients can be anybody. When he first started, he had difficulty purchasing merchandise. In the future, he plans on improving his sales and purchasing the shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his business

loans.name: Dildorhon

texts.ru: Дилдорхон и ее муж занимаются предпринимательством – продают мужские брюки. Постоянного места для торговли не имеют и ездят по окрестным рынкам. На больших базарах им еще помогает старшая дочь. Дилдорхон 43 года, воспитывает 4 детей. Больше  года сотрудничает с МикроИнвест и проблем с погашением не было. Сейчас собирается получить новый займ и планирует приобрести весенний ассортимент брюк. Новый займ планирует погасить в течении 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Dildorhon and her husband are small business owners - they mainly sell men's pants. They don't have a permanent spot, and for this reason, they travel to different markets. Their older daughter occasionally helps them when they visit large markets. Dildorhon is 43 years old and has 4 children. She has been working with MicroInvest for more than a year and never had problems with repayment of her loan. At this moment, she would like to obtain a new loan so she could purchase pants for the new spring season. She plans to pay off this loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase goods for the new spring season

loans.name: Alika

texts.fr: Alika A. est âgé de 33 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. il est tapissier à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. il désire avec ce crédit acheter une machine à coudre et des outils de travail pour la bonne exécution de son travail. Cette opportunité lui permettra de gagner plus d’argent afin de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Alika A., age 33, is married and the father of two. He is an upholsterer in Lomé, the capital of Togo. He would like to use this loan to buy a sewing machine and tools of the trade for carrying out his work well. This opportunity will enable him to earn more money in order to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and work tools

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en: Mrs. Carmela A., 50 years old, is married and lives at Dicayas, Dipolog City. She is blessed with three children. One of her children is in school. Her husband is a driver. She wants to help him have additional income. She has an existing sari-sari store and is eager to develop it. She turned to Paglaum MPC for assistance and has no regret in her membership. Recently, she applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional stock as well as soft drinks and canned goods for her store. She prays for the success of her business and the future of her children.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods and soft drinks for her store

location.town: Dipolog - Dicayas, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Folly

texts.fr: Folly G. est un jeune homme de 29 ans célibataire sans enfants. il est réparateur d’appareils électro-ménagers à Wome. Il exerce ce métier depuis 4 ans. Parallèlement à cette activité, il tient le commerce des pièces détachées. Folly désire avec ce crédit alimenter son magasin afin de mieux satisfaire aux exigences de la clientèle. Ceci lui permettra de gagner plus d’argent pour améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Folly G. is a young man, 29 years old, unmarried, and without children. He is a home appliances repairman in Wome. He has been working at this trade for four years. Concurrently, he does commerce in spare parts. Folly would like to use this loan to supply his store in order to satisfy customer demand better. This will enable him to earn more money to improve his living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply a store

loans.name: Kalsoom Muhammad Hussain Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom baji is the wife of M. H.. They have lived in a mid-size city Riwind, Pakistan for the past ten years. They are a very hardworking couple. Kalsoom baji prepares decorative embroidered dresses based on orders from the shops and Mr. H. makes artificial jewelry and sells it the jewelry shops.

Kalsoom baji is applying for a loan to buy beads, tools, and sketches for her husband’s jewelry making business. She is the leader of a group of three other women from her locality. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery ssyore. Bashiran baji wants a loan to buy material beads, colored thread, and clothing for her embroidered clothing business. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy biscuit packs wholesale to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy materials for her husband's jewelry business.

loans.name: Guerreros Para Cristo 4 Group

texts.en:
The members of this group of five micro-entrepreneurs live in a small sugarcane settlement called Batey Guerrero. It is a small "neighborhood" only three streets long. During the cutting season, some people, specially male workers, work the fields and generate some kind of income. However, during the off-season employment in the batey is almost nonexistent and people don't have money to purchase the merchandise offered by those self-employed.

Luis B. is this group's representative. He sells clothing for a living. In most cases it's better for him to go to La Romana or other large towns to sell on market days. He will use this second loan he's receiving from Esperanza to buy fresher clothes to sell during the summer months. His dream is to have his own large boutique and own a house where he can live with his family.

loans.use: To purchase summer clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of cloth

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene comes from a family who experienced poverty. Now that she is the mother of five, she doesn't want her children to experience the life that she had. She is 43 years old and married to Lydio, a carpenter. She lives in Morong, Rizal province, in the Philippines.

With her innate desire to remove her family from poverty, in 2004 Arlene joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines. She was very careful and wise in spending her loans and invested them in her resale business. Her business brings her income that can sustain the needs of her family, specially of her children.

Just recently, Arlene requested a loan of 20,000 pesos as additional rolling capital for her resale business. Specifically, the loan will be used to pay for fifty kilos of peanuts, rice, charcoal, bananas and vegetables, all for resale. She hopes that her business will grow and will bring her enough profit for her to achieve her dreams: to educate her children and also to build her own house.

loans.use: To pay for 50 kilos of peanuts, rice, charcoal and bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Mrs. Samnang D. is a 28-year-old mother, and has been married for 6 years. She has two young children, a son and daughter. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Samnang has been fishing for over 10 years. Her boat is old and it breaks down, which disrupts her business. As a result, she is applying for her first loan of $500 to purchase a new boat. The new boat will replace her old one and will allow her to continue her business.

loans.use: Purchase a boat for her fishing business

loans.name: Gnanyome

texts.fr: Cette jeune dame habite l’un des quartiers périphériques de Lomé peuplé d’habitants : le quartier Minamadou à Agoè. Elle a appris la coiffure. Elle exerce ce métier depuis 2006 et cette activité lui permet non seulement de se prendre en charge mais aussi de subvenir aux besoins scolaires des ses petits frères. Elle est bien connue dans son quartier et coiffe ses clientes dans la perfection. Elle profite aussi de cette occasion pour vendre des mèches ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour renouveler son stock de mèches en baisse en ce moment. Avec l’argent du prêt, elle pourra s’acheter 100 mèches Nina et 100 mèches Curly. Cette femme n’est pas mariée et n’a aucun enfant à sa charge. Elle n’a aucune crainte de rembourser son prêt dans les délais en vigueur.

loans.use: Achat de mèches

loans.name: Saroem

texts.en: Mrs. Saroem K. is a villager in Samraong village in Takeo province. She owns a small grocery store in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her business. She is a widow with three children, one of whom earns an income by charging batteries. The others are employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy more grocery good for her business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is forty-three years old. She is married and has five kids in school.

Veronica has been trading in grocery products like rice, fresh tomatoes, tinned tomatoes, cocoa products, skim milk, body pomade, etc in the market in her community for two years. Her experience in trading has made her one of the successful traders in the market. She considers this loan a great opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by customers. She wants to use the loan to buy cartons of milk, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetables, and palm oil to increase her stock of goods available for sale. She hopes to increase her profits to support her kids in school.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk to expand her selection

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a 62-year-old married woman with six children. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the town of Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Rita works to help her husband to provide for their family. 

Rita produces and sells palm oil. She buys the fresh palm nuts from nearby communities, prepares the oil, and supplies to retailers in her community. She sells at the local market and treks to other communities, as well. Rita has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy plastes

loans.name: Felicita Mafalda

texts.es:
La Sra. Felicita Mafalda Z. A. tiene 62 años de edad, su domicilio se encuentra ubicado Urb. Pedreros – San Carlos – Ica zona afectada por la inundación del año 1997  y por el terremoto del 2007.
A pesar de eso la Sra. sigue adelante y vive con 3 de sus hijos los cuales son profesionales gracias a que es una persona bien trabajadora.
Actualmente es obrera de campo y reparte recibos de luz y agua. Trabaja de 6:00 am a 6:00 pm. y los fines de mes en las tardes reparte los recibos ya mencionados.
Es padre y madre para sus hijos, es por eso que solicita el financiamiento de un crédito para asumir gastos personales.
Cuenta con buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos.
texts.en:
Felicita Mafalda Z. A., 62, lives in the Pedreros Urbanization, San Carlos, Ica. This area was affected by the 1997 flood and the 2007 earthquake. Despite that, she perseveres. She lives with three of her children, who are professionals, thanks to her hard work. Currently, she works as a field hand and she distributes light and water bills. She works from 6am-6pm and at month's end she distributes the afore-mentioned utility bills. She is both mother and father to her children. This is the reason for her requesting funding to defray personal expenses. She has good references from her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For personal expenses.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Nuestra socia ROSARIO tiene 44 años, es viuda y hace 8 años que falleció su esposo. La socia es padre y madre para sus dos hijos. Cesar tiene 18 años y estudia Ingeniería de Sistema en la universidad y Geanella estudia en el colegio. La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de Artesanías. La socia tiene una tienda de artesanía llamada “Charito” en el Aeropuerto “Velasco Astete” del Cusco donde vende chompas y cerámica de barro. Ya son 30 años que tiene el negocio y le ha ido muy bien, gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que desde niña trabajo a lado de su mamá y heredo el negocio. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales para confeccionar más artesanía y chompas de lana de las mayorista que traen de la ciudad de Juliaca del departamento de Puno. 
 
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “FUENTE DE VIDA” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Cusco.

Cusco antiguamente, fue la capital del Imperio Inca y una de las ciudades más importantes del Virreinato del Perú. Declarada Patrimonio de la Humanidad y capital arqueológica de América 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rosario is 44. She is a widow; her husband died eight years ago. She is father and mother to her two children. Cesar is 18 and is studying Systems Engineering in the university. Geanella is in school. Rosario alternates her activities between the household and selling handicrafts. She has a handcrafts store called “Charito” in the Valasco Astete airport in Cusco. She sells sweaters and ceramics made of clay. She has had the business for 30 years. It has gone very well for her thanks to all of the effort she puts into her work. She is an enterprising and hard-working mother, who worked at her mother’s side as a girl. She inherited the business. She needs the loan to buy more material to make more handicrafts and to buy more wool sweater from the wholesalers who bring them from the city of Juliaca in the Puno department. She belongs to the Fuente de Vida Communal Bank of the Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco. Cusco was the ancient capitol of the Inca Empire and one of the most important cities of the viceroyalty of Perú. It was declared the Patrimony of Humanity and the archeological capitol of America. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more materials to make more handicrafts and wool sweaters

loans.name: Isaac

texts.es: El señor Isaac actualmente tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. Tiene  37 años el negocio del señor Isaac es una pulpería donde vende arroz, frijoles, azúcar y otros productos para el consumo del hogar  el comenzó con un financiamiento que adquirió en una  institución y compro una parte de mercadería dando apertura de esa manera,  ya que el comercio es mucho mayor  sus ganancias incrementaron muchísimo. Y con la ganancia logro comprar más mercadería  para vender, entonces ya cuenta con un buen inventario y su negocio se ha incrementado. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos que es lo que sus clientes más solicitan. El sueño de ella es obtener una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Isaac is 37 years old and has a son under his care. He owns a convenience store where he sells rice, beans, sugar and other household products. He started with a loan from an institution and purchased some supplies to open his store. Since then his commerce has increased and his profits have greatly improved. With his earnings he has been able to purchase more products to sell, so he has a good inventory and his business has improved. He plans to use the loan he is currently requesting to purchase basic grains, which is in high demand from his customers. His dream is to obtain financial stability.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains and other supplies for his store

loans.name: Aldo Jose

texts.es: Aldo José tiene 38 años es una persona muy inteligente y capaz. El tiene 4 hijos y todos están a su cargo. El se dedica a la venta de granos básicos, hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, el no tenia los recursos necesarios para salir adelante con este negocio, pero con la ayuda de los financiamientos ha mejorado, la atención que Aldo ofrece a sus clientes es la mejor ellos no se quejan del servicio que el ofrece. El solicita este financiamiento para proporcionarle a su negocio los productos necesarios para la variedad de clientes que tiene. Su deseo es ampliar su casa para agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Aldo Jose is a very capable and intelligent 38 year old man who takes care of four children. He has been selling basic grains for seven years to make a living. He did not have the resources to get ahead in this business, but with financial help it has gotten better. Aldo provides very good service to his customers and receives no complaints. He is asking for this financing so he can get basic products for his business to meet the variety of clientele he has. He would like to make his house larger so he can expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying a motorcycle

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban, de 65 años, es un padre de familia muy trabajador y responsable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Estela de 46 años, quien le ayuda en sus cultivos y sus 3 hijos; Elizabeth de 23, Luis de 20 y Rosa de 17 años. Lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila, para lo cual necesita darles una buena educación a sus hijos. 

La agricultura ha sido para Esteban una actividad necesaria para vivir, ya que desde muy pequeño sus padres le enseñaron que trabajando en la chacra la comida no le faltaría. Es por eso que decidió continuar con esta labor familiar y ahora tiene sus propios cultivos, donde tiene sembrados papa, alverja, zanahoria, etc., los cuales una vez cosechados llevara a vender al mercado de la ciudad de Tarma.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar, ya que sabe que de esta actividad depende la tranquilidad de su familia, lleva 50 años en la agricultura y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de los cambios bruscos del clima, ya que eso afecta mucho su productividad. 

Este es el octavo préstamo de Esteban con MFP y sabe que el dinero del crédito será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado.
Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará semillas de alverja, abono e insecticidas, para tener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Esteban is 65 years old. He is a very hardworking and responsible father. He lives in his own home with his wife Estela, who is 46. She helps him with his crops. He also lives with his 3 children: Elizabeth, 23, Luis, 20, and Rosa, 17. What he wants more than anything is to have a calm old age and for this he needs to give his children an good education. For Esteban, farming has been an activity he needs to live. Since he was very small, his parents taught him that if he worked in the fields he wouldn't lack for food. That is why he decided to continue with the family work and now he has his own crops. He has planted potatoes, peas, carrots, etc. Once these are harvested, he takes them to market in the city of Tarma. What he likes the most about his work is planting, since he knows that his family's stability depends on this activity. He has been in farming for 50 years. What he considers the hardest is taking care of his crops in sudden weather changes, since this affects his productivity a lot. This is the eight loan that Esteban has had with MFP and he knows that the loan will be beneficial to the development of his activity. In his communal bank, he is a very responsible member, and because of this he is very respected. With the eight hundred nuevos soles he is asking for, he will purchase pea seed, fertilizer and insecticide to have a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase of seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more salon items in bulk.

loans.name: Juna

texts.en:
Mrs. Juna N. lives in Dolchoki Village. She lives with her husband and two children. She has one son and one daughter. Her son is studying in grade 1 and daughter is studying in grade 3.

Both Mrs. N. and her husband Mr. Lekba N. are farmer in the village of Dolchoki. They owns a piece of land where they grow seasonal vegetables. They sell their vegetables in the local market in the morning and evening daily. Mrs. Magarkoti is requesting the first loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for their vegetable farming.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: Aminata S. lives in Wellington with her husband and four children. She is 36 years old. She has a shop very close to Wellington Market, where she sells pepper, palm oil, onions, maggi (instant soup), tomatoes, groundut oil and charcoal. Aminata has taken two loans from LAPO,SL since she joined in 2009. She was able to take care of her children's school fees with the extra profits resulting from the loan. She is asking for a loan of SLL1,500,000 to enable her buy more pepper, maggi, palm oil, groundnut oil, tomatoes, rice, charcoal and beans to stock her shop. She intends to make a good profit from this loan that will change her living forever.

loans.use: This loan will be use to buy pepper, palm oil, onions, maggi, rice, tomatoes and beans.

loans.name: Dashbileg

texts.en: Dashbileg G. lives with her husband and grandchildren in the Chingeltey district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger (a Mongolian nomadic housing tent). They have been living together in their current home for 15 years. With the help of her husband, Dashbileg operates a newspaper selling business at Huchit Shonhor, a local market in the city. She has been operating her business since 2002, and has gained significant experience over the past eight years. Dashbileg's main goal is to find more sales channels to sell her newspapers. She is an open and very hardworking person. Dashbileg is requesting a 400,000 MNT loan to purchase cell phone credits which she will resell to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase cell phones credits

loans.name: Las Orquideas De Jilo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama las Orquídeas de Jilo y esta ubicado en el  Estado de México, en México. El grupo esta conformado por diez integrantes y es la primera vez que solicitan crédito a credicomun.

La señora Ángela Zúñiga Hernández es integrante de este grupo, tiene 31 años de edad, estudió hasta el sexto año de primaria, es casada y tiene en total 2 hijos varones de 8 y 7 años, ella se dedica a ala crianza y engorda de borregos que inicio hace 8 años con un solo borrego, el cual engordo y lo vendió, y con el dinero compro una borrega para la reproducción de la especie, y así fue como ha ido forjando su patrimonio. Solicita el crédito para la compra de alimento y forrajes para alimentar a sus borregos y en cuanto estén listos venderlos para nuevamente adquirir otros e invertir en el crecimiento de las crías de sus borregas, ella también tiene otros animales como pollos, guajolotes y conejos. Al momento de solicitar el crédito se siente animada ya que dice ha tenido otros créditos que le han beneficiado notoriamente pues con las ganancias ha podido invertir en la siembra para la alimentación de sus animales y el consumo de su hogar, en útiles escolares y prendas de vestir para sus hijos y esta convencida que mientras la actividad siga funcionando ella seguirá trabajando, para así brindar una mayor oportunidad de estudio a sus hijos y mejorar su calidad de vida, ponerle loza a su casa  y los servicios de agua y luz ya que hasta el momento no cuenta con ellos.

También espera a un plazo no muy largo ampliar la cría y engorda de conejos pues considera que este negocio también genera buenas ganancias y tal ves mas adelante pueda conseguir pedidos más grandes para entregarlos en canal o vivos y que el negocio crezca generando para ella y su familia mejores ingresos.

Areli C. Díaz es la presidenta del grupo tiene 22 años y estudio hasta el 3° de secundaria es ama de casa y aun no tiene hijos ella se dedica a la engorda de puercos que inicio hace 1 año y solicita el préstamo para comprar el alimento de estos animales.

Las demás integrantes del grupo son:
-	Paulina T. D.  (Venta de dulces)
-	Ma. Luisa M. G. (Venta de dulces)
-	Dolores S. V.        (Cría y engorda de guajolotes y pollos)
-	Celia Hernández G.  (Venta de mercería)
-	Lourdes G. F.   (Venta de Colchas)
-	Graciela D. A.    (Venta de verduras)
-	Yanet T. D.    (Venta de servilletas)
-	Teresa Zúñiga V.       (Cría de pollos)
texts.en:
This group is called the Orchids of Jilo and is located in the State of Mexico, in Mexico. The group is comprised of 10 members and it is the first time that they have requested a loan from credicomun. Mrs. Ángela Zúñiga Hernández is a member of this group; she is 31 years old and studied until the 6th grade. She is married and has two sons- ages 8 and 7. She breeds and fattens sheep, which began 8 years ago with a single lamb, which fattened and sold. With this money, she bought a lamb for the reproduction of the species and that’s how their business began. She is requesting the loan to buy food and fodder to feed their sheep. When she sells them, she will be able to acquire others and again invest in the growth of the lamb from the sheep. Also, she has other animals such as chickens, turkeys, and rabbits. She is excited about her loan application, because she has had other loans, which have benefited her greatly. She has been able to invest in growing food for her animals and to consume in her home. She has also been able to invest in school supplies and clothing for her children. She is convinced that while business thrives she will continue working to provide greater opportunity for her childrens’ education. She will also be able to improve their quality of life by bringing in goods for the home and services such as water and electricity since she does not currently have them. Also, she hopes in time to increase the size of her rabbit-raising business because she believes that this business also generates good profits and maybe later can get larger orders, butchered or alive. Then, the business will grow generating the best income possible for her and her family. Areli C. Díaz is the president of the group. She is 22 years old and studied until her third year of high school. She is a housewife with no children. She started fattening pigs a year ago and is requesting a loan to buy the food and fodder for these animals. The other members of the group include: -Paulina T. D. (Candy Sale)  -Ma. Luisa M. G. (Candy Sale)  -Dolores S. V. (Breeding and fattening of turkeys and chickens)  -Celia Hernández G. (Sale of Haberdashery)  -Lourdes G. F. (Quilt Sale)  -Graciela D. A. (Vegetable Sale)  -Yanet T. D. (Napkin Sale)  -Teresa Zúñiga V. (Breeding Chickens)

Translated from Spanish by Dina Bach, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food and fodder to feed their sheep

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr:
femme de 41 ans avec 3 enfants a sa charge dont l'age varie entre 22 ans et 13 ans.elle s'est interessee a la quincaillerie depuis 2001, generalement c'est une activite reservee aux hommes , comme etant tres courageuse et entreprenante elle a ose faire de la quincaillerie son travail.


  Elle a juste 35000f quand elle commence ,elle a elargie son activite 
 en multipliant ses efforts 
avec ce pret elle va
  renforcer les activites en achetant des serrures,crochets, materiels de plomberie;menuiserie, tuyauterie , des robinets et electricite; pointes et vis.
Tres strategique elle va s'approvisionner dans les grands magasins de quincaillerie sur place et soit a Pointe Noire, sa vente journaliere est de 20.000 a 25000 frs par jour, elle epargne toujours pour assurer son avenir et ameliorer les conditions de sa vie et celle des ces enfants.
texts.en:
This is a 41-year-old woman with three children to support whose ages range from13 to 22.  She became interested is hardware in 2001.  Generally, this is a business reserved for men.  But since she is very courageous and enterprising, she dared to make hardware her line of work. She only had 35,000 francs when she stared.  She expanded her business by doubling her efforts.  With this loan, she is going to bolster her business by buying some locks, hooks, and supplies for plumbing, carpentry, electricity, and piping, and some faucets, spark plugs, etc.  A very strategic woman, she is going to stock up at the big hardware stores locally and perhaps in Pointe Noire.  Her sales amount to 20,000 to 25,000 francs per day.  She is still saving money to ensure her future and to improve her and her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying locks, keys, saws, hooks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase palm nuts for palm oil

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina is 41-year old lady, married and a mother of a single son. They all belong to a city called Borewala in Pakistan. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. Her son's name is M. kashif and he reads in the 8th standard (grade). Zarina pays attention to his future so that he will walk in the world and prove himself a good human being.  

Zarina operates a decorative embroidery business to bear the education expenses of her son so that he gets a quality education without any hurdles and financial problems. 

Her husband's name is M. B., and he is involved in a timber-selling business. He has been in this business for over twenty years.  
Zarina has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount he will buy the timbers in bulk and increase his selling.  
She is a fourth-year member. In the last three years she has maintained a good credit behavior with Asasah and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: Purchase timbers for reselling

loans.name: Mussarat Nazir's Group

texts.en:
Mussarat Nazir, 53 years old, lives in the historic city of Lahore, in Pakistan. She makes her livelihood from her clothes-sewing business. She sews clothes for her neighborhood clients. She is also involved in selling clothes.

She purchases cloth from the Azam market, a big cloth market in Lahore. She generates better income with her clothes selling business than from her sewing but she can't quit her sewing because her customers don't allow her to quit because of the quality of her stitching.

Her husband, M. A., is a driver. He works full-time to put three meals on the table for his family. They have three sons who could not complete their education due to financial constraints. They all are young now and involved in different kinds of work. The eldest and youngest son are rickshaw drivers and the middle son has a business of renting bikes.

Mussarat has applied for her third loan from Asasah for her clothes selling business. With the loan she will buy clothes in bulk and expand her business.

She has applied for a loan for this business because she has been doing it for the last 15 years and she is very sure that she can change the fortune of her family by expanding this business. She is a regular borrower from Asasah and has maintained a good credit record in the last two years.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to resell.

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.fr: H. Jean Marie Vianney est un homme de 50  ans qui a été à Kicukiro en province de la ville de Kigali, il vit actuellement en province de Kigali  district de Kicukiro, capital du Rwanda. Il est marié, il a trois enfants dont le plus âgée a 20 ans et le moins âgée a 3 deux  vont à l’école. Il est salarié dans une entreprise fabriquant les matériaux métalliques. Avec le prêt il veut réhabiliter  sa maison en achetant du sima, pierres pour fondation, portes et fenêtres. Les épargnes continuelles lui permettent de la survie de sa famille et il acheter une vache pour le lait des ses enfants, le reste il le vend pour augmenter les revenues et la capacité financière de la famille. Dans l’avenir il veut acheter une deux autres vaches pour devenir un grand éleveur en abandonnant le secteur des salaries et planifier pour le bon futur de  sa famille.
texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianney H. is a 50 year-old man who has lived in Kicukiro in the province of Kigali City. He now lives in the Kicukiro district of Kigali province, the capital of Rwanda. He is married and has three children. The oldest is 20 years old and the youngest is 3 years old. Two of the children go to school. He is an employee in a metal manufacturing company. He wants to renovate his house with the loan, buying sima, foundation stones, doors and windows. His continuous savings enable him to support his family and he will buy a cow to provide milk for his children. He will sell the rest of the milk to increase his income and the family's financial resources. In the future, he wants to buy two more cows and become a large breeder, leaving the wage-earning sector and planning for a better future for his family.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sima, doors, windows and foundation stones for his house

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 48 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Pepe de 53  años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Trabajando arduamente, Ana ha logrado que sus chacras le brinden los productos necesarios, para mantener a su familia. Antes que el sol deje ver sus primeros rayos, sale de su casa y camina cerca de una hora y media para llegar a sus tierras, donde tiene sembrado papa y arveja, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que siente que les da un buen uso, lleva 27 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los costales que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Con el tiempo, desea poner una tienda de abarrotes, de esa manera pueda mejorar su economía. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, está muy feliz de poder acceder a este crédito y quiere agradecer a todas las personas que harán posible que obtenga el dinero que necesita. En su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada por el orden que pone en las reuniones. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará nuevas semillas de arveja y sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Ana, 48, is a cheerful, hard working woman. She lives in her own house with her husband, Pepe, 53, and their two beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. Working hard, Ana has gotten her fields to produce the necessary products to support her family. Before the sun even shows its first rays she is out of the house to walk the nearly hour and a half to reach her fields where she grows potatoes and peas, products which she later takes to sell in Tarma’s wholesale market. What she likes best about her work is tilling the soil because she feels she uses them well. She has been a farmer for 27 years and considers the most difficult part of it transporting the products to Tarma because the sacks are very heavy and they tire her out a lot. In time she’d like to install a grocery store to improve her economy. This is her 8th loan with MFP and she is happy to be able to access it. She wants to thank all the people that will fund it making it possible for her to get the money she needs. She is respected in her communal bank because she imposes order at the meetings. She will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy new pea seed and sacks of manure.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure and pea seeds.

loans.name: Guldasta

texts.ru: Сафарова Гулдаста проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 49 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Сын на заработках в России. Сама Гулдаста имеет среднее образование. Вместе с мужем занимается животноводством. Разводит скот в дальнейшем для перепродажи. Имеет хороший опыт в этой сфере. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Guldasta S. lives in the Yavan district. She is 49 years old, married and has 5 children. Her son works in Russia. Guldasta has a secondary education. Together with her husband, she is involved in animal husbandry. She breeds livestock for future resale. She has a good experience in this field. Guldasta is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Osvaldo

texts.es: El señor Osvaldo vive en el Barrio de la Urbanización El Terrado, el se dedica al servicio del transporte Urbano hace como cinco años, él necesita el crédito para la reparación del vehículo, ya que es su fuente de ingresos y debe cambiar algunas partes del motor. Tiene cuatro hijos que asisten a primaria, su esposa se dedica al servicio de la educación, es profesora en un colegio cerca de su casa, ambos tiene como meta conseguir el dinero que les falta para comenzar a construir su casa para ya no vivir en alquiler ya que no les alcanza el dinero para otros gastos que tienen, Ellos son personas responsables y muy carismáticas, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Osvaldo lives in the El Terrado urban neighborhood.  He has been a taxi driver for about five years.

He needs the loan to repair his vehicle because it’s his source of income and he has to replace some of the engine’s parts.

He has four children in elementary school and his wife is a teacher at a school near their house.  The goal of both of them is to acquire the money they still need to start building a house and stop renting because their money isn’t enough to cover other expenses they have.

They are responsible, very charismatic people.  He is very grateful to the institution for the support given.

loans.use: For vehicle repair.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita B. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 47 years old, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Florita buys and sells green bananas in the local community. Florita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2010, Florita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services with the hopes of improving her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florita successfully repaid a previous loan from HSPFI which was used to to purchase additional bananas to buy and sell. Florita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the the 3rd loan taken out by Florita from HSPFI.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory of bananas, and as working capital

loans.name: Elida Carmita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Constructoras Del Éxito, esta ciudad se la conoce desde hace mucho con el nombre de Ciudad Del Valle por estar encerrada por muchos cerros que rodean la urbe.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Elida,  ella tiene 36 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha tenido tres hijos de 17, 11 y 9 años, la mayor este año termina el colegio y los menores están en la escuela. Su marido vende periódicos. 

Ella se dedica a la venta de yogurt por litros, el mismo que lo recibe de la ciudad de Quito que es donde fabrican este producto, ella recibe en su casa de dos a cuatro  veces por semana, una vez que recibe el producto, sale a recorrer con sus productos, vende a personas de su localidad y en tiendas a las que deja a buen precio, dice que aunque gane poco lo importante es vender. Trabaja todos los días en sus ventas desde las 7am hasta las 11am, lleva tres años en este negocio.
 
Este crédito es para comprar el producto ya que tiene que pagar por adelantado. Hace tres años es socia del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras siempre están atentas a las necesidades de las otras socias. Su sueño es tener algún día su propia fábrica.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the Communal Bank “Constructoras del Éxito” (Builders of Success) meets every fifteen days. This city has long been known as the “City of the Valley” because of the many surrounding hills.

Sra. Elida is 36 years old and in a common law marriage. She has three children (ages 17, 11, and 9). Her oldest child finishes high school this year and the younger children are in elementary school. Her husband sells newspapers.

Elida sells yogurt by the liter. Her product comes from the city of Quito where it is made. The yogurt is delivered to her house 2-4 times per week. As soon as she receives her product, she goes out to sell it to customers in her community and to stores at a good price. Elida says it is very important for her to make sales even though she may not earn much. She works every day making sales from 7am to 11am. Her business has been in operation for three years.

This loan will be used to buy yogurt since she must pay for the product in advance. Elida has been a member of the Communal Bank for three years. She likes the fact that her fellow members are attentive to the needs of all the others. Her dream is to have her own factory one day.

loans.use: Purchase yogurt

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
La señora Dora vive por la Zona de Viloma Grande, a 25 Km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, ella se dedica a la produccion de leche cruda y a la agricultura, con el cultivo de cebolla, zanahoria y maiz. Tiene 3 hijos pequeños. de 12, 7 y 5 años. Su concubino la abandono hace tres años. Desde entonces viven solos en su casa y ell a siempre a buscado la forma de  sustentar su hogar por eso tiene multiples actividades como la agricultura, la alecheria y ademas ayuda en un vive con el cuida de plantas. 

Ahora ella desea aumentar su ganado para poder tener mejores ingresos mensuales pues la agricultura solo le ayuda de forma temporal cada 6 meses o cuando es epoca de cosecha, y ella necesita mas ingresos mensuales pues sus pequeños hijos requieren de mas necesidades. Por esa razon solicito un credito para poder compranse una vaca mas.
texts.en:
Dora lives in the Viloma Grande area, 25km from the city of Cochabamba. She works in raw-milk production and agriculture, cultivating onions, carrots and corn. She has three small children, who are 12, 7 and 5 years old. Her partner left her three years ago. Since then, they have lived alone in their home. She has always looked for a way to support her household, which is why she undertakes multiple economic activities, such as agriculture, dairy farming and also helping in a nursery taking care of the plants.

Now she wants to increase the number of her cattle in order to have greater monthly income, since agriculture only helps her on a seasonal basis every six months or when it is harvest time. She needs more monthly income to support her children. For this reason, she sought a loan in order to buy herself one more cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Hugo Enrique

texts.es:
Hugo, reside en Corinto, departamento de Morazán, tiene 25 años de edad, administra una tienda de la cual obtiene los ingresos para dar la alimentación y salud a su esposa y su hija Nohemí de 2 años de edad, este negocio tiene 3 años de existir y surge por iniciativa propia, él con su esposa lo atienden sin horario fijo.
Actualmente el necesita comprar mercadería para el negocio ya que por las fiestas de fin de año que se acercan quiere preparase desde ya, por lo que solicita un préstamo para la compra de artículos de primera necesidad, ayudando así a que el negocio este preparado para atender la demanda y ofrezca un mejor servicio a los clientes.
Él sueño de Hugo es poseer un negocio estable que le garantice ingresos para solventar las necesidades del hogar y le permita ir creciendo en el mercado.
texts.en:
Hugo, who lives in Corinto in the Department of Morazán, is 25 years old. He runs a store, which provides what he needs to ensure that his wife and 2 year old daughter Nohemí have their health and enough to eat. He has had the business since he started it on his own initiative 3 years ago. He and his wife serve in the shop, without a fixed schedule. 

Now he needs to buy merchandise for the store, because he wants to be prepared for the approaching festive season. He is therefore seeking a loan for the purchase of basic household goods, so that the store will be well-prepared to meet demand and offer a better service to customers.

Hugo's dream is to have a solid business which guarantees him sufficient income to meet the needs of the household and permit him to expand his market.

loans.use: To buy household products

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa L. is from the village of Sepac Sapang Dalaga Mis. Occ. She is 31 years old. Elsa is separated from spouse and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Elsa owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as noodles, milk, coffee, sugar, sardines, spices, shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elsa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Elsa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional daily use products to sell

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila L. is from the village of Katipunan,Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Cirila is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Cirila owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising goats for sale. Cirila has been engaged in her business for more than eight years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Cirila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cirila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. Cirila is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase young goats, livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Cirila from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: San Judas Tadeo I Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama San Judas Tadeo I, está ubicado en San Martín Texmelucan en el Estado de puebla. El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes. Felix S. H es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 42 años, estudió hasta el 3ro de secundaria. Es casada y tiene en total 3 varones.  Ella se dedica a vender en una cooperativa escolar que inició hace 2 años. Aparte tiene su negocio de comida que con ayuda de su esposo atienden por la tarde comenta que gracias a este tipo de prestamos a logrado sobresalir con el paso de los años, al igual apenas inicio un pequeño negocio de papelería. Solicita el préstamo para compra de refrescos, jugos y otras cosas para su negocio. Sus clientes son alumnos y maestros de la escuela. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente entusiasmada ya que obtiene un crédito que para ella es importante para sobresalir cada día. Quiere este crédito para compra de refrescos, jugos y pan, gas y una mesa para que puedan comer los maestros. También espera que con este préstamo y su esfuerzo poder tener unas mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called San Judas Tadeo 1. It is located in San Martín Texmelucan, in Puebla state. The group has 9 members. Felix S. H. is the group president. She is 42 and studied up to the third grade of secondary school. She is married and has 3 sons. She sells in a school cooperative that she started two years ago. She also has a food sales business with which she helps her husband in the afternoons. She says that thanks to these loans she has been able to excel as the years have passed. She recently started a grocery store business. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of drinks, juice and other items for her business. 
Her customers are students and teachers at the school. She is excited to be getting the loan that for her is so important to her success. She wants this loan for purchasing drinks, juice and bread, pop and a table where the teachers will eat.
She also hopes that through this loan and her hard work she and her family will have  better quality of life.

loans.use: the purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Las Velocez Group

texts.es: El  grupo se llama LAS VELOCEZ, se encuentra ubicado en el Estado de México. Esta conformado por 11 integrantes, entre ellas está la señora Maria Isabel A. y tiene 24 años de edad,  tiene  1 hijo de 1 año 8 meses. Se dedica a vender zapatos desde hace  2 años.
