Ella vende para poder apoyarlo porque lo que gana su esposo no les alcanza, ella comenzo vendiendo zapatos con su familia y posteriormente  como vendia mucho comenzo a vender con los vecinos y en las colonias aledañas. Con su crédito pretende comprar muchos catálogos de diferentes marcas. Su deseo es hacer crecer su negocio y asi poder darles una educación a su hijo, y que el negocio cresca cada día más.
texts.en: The group called "Las Velocez" is located in the state of Mexico.  There are 11 members: among them is Maria Isabel A., who is 24 years old.  She has a child who is a year and 8 months old.  Maria has been selling shoes for 2 years.  She works to support her child, since her husband's earnings are not enough for them.  She started selling shoes with her family, and later, as she sold a lot, she started to sell to neighbors and in the surrounding neighborhoods.  With her loan she plans to buy many catalogs of different brands.  Her desire is to make her business grow, and in this way be able to give a good education to her child.  She hopes to see her business grow larger each day.

loans.use: to purchase shoes

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a married woman who lives in Silay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  perfumes/cosmetics sales and fish vending.  Her husband Roland, who is 46 years old, works as a government employee to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are 12 to 24 years old. Elisa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 20 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Elisa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 21st loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, which she intends to use to buy perfumes/cosmetics to sell to continue to save up for future house renovations.  Elisa is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more perfumes/cosmetics

loans.name: Silvia Patricia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” KANTU DE SAN JERONIMO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Silvia Patricia; la socia tiene 44 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; la socia se dedica al negocio de carpintería metálica ella trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo llevan años en este negocio del cual se siente feliz ya que mediante este negocio ella saca a su familia adelante, a la vez la socia trabaja en una ONG como madre sustituta cuidando a niños que no tienen papas esta actividad le gusta mucho ya que puede ayudar a niños que necesitan cariño. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de una maquina de soldar para su negocio ya que con este instrumento le será más fácil realizar su trabajo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Silvia Patricia is a member of the Communal Bank “Kantu de San Jeronimo” which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She is 44 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children. Silvia manages a metal shop where she and her husband have worked together for several years. She is pleased with her business because it has enabled her family to get ahead. At one time she worked for an NGO as a foster mother who took care of orphans. She enjoyed that job very much because was able to provide the love these children needed.

Silvia is requesting a loan to buy a soldering machine for her business since it will help make her job easier. She is happy to receive this loan and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase a soldering machine

loans.name: Naseem Akhter's Group

texts.en:
A talented lady, Naseem Akhter is a seamstress by profession. She does sewing work for her neighboring clients. She receives a good number of orders every month and earns a good income after completing them. She is also a very good housewife and takes care of her household responsibilities very well. 
 
She is a resident of Jaranwala, which is a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family in a three-room brick house for the past 14 years. 

Her husband’s name is M. A., and he operates a lathe machine. He provides iron items and spare-part repair services to his clients. He is very good in his work and provides quality service.
 
Naseem has three children. All of them are young and getting their education. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy iron in larger quantities, which will enable him to repair more iron items and increase his monthly income.  

He has been operating this business for many years, and Naseem is very confident about the positive growth of his business after the loan investment. She is a regular loan user of Asasah, and this is her third loan application. She has maintained good credit behavior in every loan year and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with the book (called Asasah Passbook) is Naseem Akhter.

loans.use: to buy iron for the lathe business

loans.name: Rodora

texts.en: Rodora is a 34-year-old married mother of two children, aged five and four months. She grows rice and corn to earn a living. She tills land in Surallah, South Cotabato. Rodora sells her harvest to the people in her community. She works hard to support her family. Rodora has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes that her business will grow and dreams for her children to be successful in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es: Blanca Azucena se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Ella es una mujer muy admirable, por lo que se siente muy contenta con su medio de vida. Inicio este negocio hace más de 8 años con muy pocos productos fue que ella inicio este medio de vida. Se siente muy contenta pues la mayoría de sus clientes son personas jóvenes que le solicitan calzado, perfumes, ropa en general, cremas, tratamientos entre otros productos. Es por eso que solicita este crédito con el fin de invertir en la compra de estos productos. Sueña con mejorar las condiciones de su hogar.
texts.en: Blanca Azucena sells general merchandise.  She is an admirable woman and she is very happy with her career choice.  She started this business eight years ago with only a few items and is happy because most of her customers are young and request shoes, perfume, clothing, creams, and skin treatments, among other products.  She is asking for this loan to invest in these items.  She hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her business

loans.name: Cecilia Verónica

texts.es:
La Señorita. Verónica C. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Trabajo, vive en la ciudad de Azogues, ciudad que tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica, cuenta con grandes iglesias que resaltan la belleza de esta ciudad, su gente se dedica al comercio de todo tipo, son personas muy amables y carismáticas.

La Señorita. Verónica tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres y ayuda en la economía de su hogar. La casa en la que habitan es propia.
 
Nuestra socia trabaja en la atención de una tienda de abarrotes, esta actividad la desempeña hace algún tiempo. También se dedica  a estudiar Ciencias Educativas en la universidad y está en primer año.

Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y medio y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en los gastos de sus estudios.
 
Su meta es llegar a ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Verónica C., age 21, is a member of the communal bank Mujeres de Trabajo (Working Women); she lives in the city of Azogues -- a city known for its architectural beauty, its great churches, and its people who are very kind and charismatic. Veronica is single; she lives with her parents and helps them with the household expenses. They live in their own house. 

Veronica works in a grocery store; she has been in this job for some time. She is also studying at the university in an Education Science program; she is currently in her first year.Veronica has been a member of the communal bank for a year and plans to use the new loan to pay for her studies. Her goal is to become an accomplished professional.

loans.use: to pay for education expenses

loans.name: Segundo Andres

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 48 años de edad, vive con su esposa y su menor hijo. Ellos residen en una localidad bastante grande del  distrito de Chepen en el departamento de La Libertad a una hora de Chiclayo.

Segundo se dedica a la comercialización de juguetes, en una zona comercial cerca a su hogar.  Dicha actividad la realiza de manera ambulatoria desde hace más de 6 años, en los cuales a obtenido experiencia en el rubro. Con estas actividad segundo realiza el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Segundo está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2500 nuevos soles para poder invertir en su negocio, comprando más mercadería y de esta manera obtener mayores oportunidades de venta.

Segundo es una persona entusiasta y empeñosa, con muy buenas referencias, además cuenta con el apoyo su familia, para desarrollar su negocio y poder salir a delante.
texts.en:
Segundo, 48, lives with his wife and youngest son.  They live in a rather large town in the district of Chepen in the department of La Lilbertad, an hour from Chiclayo.

He sells toys at the shopping center near his home.  He has been working as a street vendor for over six years and gained much experience.  With this business he is able to support his family.

Segundo is very enthusiastic and hard-working, with good references.  He also has the support of his family to develop his business and get ahead.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Sophin

texts.en: Sophin, 54, resides in Kampot province, Cambodia, an area known for fresh seafood. Sophin is a housewife and her husband is a village chief, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 54 on food and USD 40 on the other necessary expenses. Sophin is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to provide transportation services when he is available from his work. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Bismark

texts.en: Bismark, 24, is married with one child and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the retail business for three years, and with the income earned, he has been able to buy land. His hardship is debtors who delay payments and his vision is to have a wholesale business plus a building in town. Bismark needs the loan to buy biscuits for resale.

loans.use: to buy biscuits and drinks for resale.

loans.name: Piellina

texts.en:
Piellina has practiced farming in Njabini for the last six years. She is 38 years old, married to Joseph and they have two school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Piellina hopes to buy more land and practice mixed farming on a large scale.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Khetam

texts.en: Khetam is a 28-year-old woman. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee in Jabalia Refugee Camp in Gaza Strip. Khetam took out a loan from FATEN to purchase living room furniture that they couldn't purchase when she got married. She was using plastic chairs instead. Now that she learned about FATEN, she took out the loan to pay for the furniture and pay the loan back on a daily basis. Khetam is a conservative woman. Therefore, her husband is photographed instead in FATEN's Branch office.

loans.use: to purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Michael

texts.es: El joven Michael, es nacido Santa Ana de Yacuma en el Beni, vive en anticrético, su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona la Guardia, es de ocupación moto taxista, trabaja, hace unos dos años desde que se dedica a esta labor, el destino del crédito es para terminar de cancelar su moto nueva y trabajarla, se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que se le a brindado ya que esta es su única herramienta de trabajo y con esta actividad mantiene a su familia, es una persona muy trabajadora y con ganas de mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Michael was born in Santa Ana de Yacuma in El Beni. He lives in a house located in the  La Guardia. He is a motorcycle taxi driver and has done this for two years. The loan is to finish paying for his new motorcycle and to put it to use. He is grateful to the institution for the support it has offered since this is his only work took. With this activity he supports his family. He is a very hardworking person who wants to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to finish paying for a motorcycle.

loans.name: Tiessiri Vi Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe TIESSIRI VI sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans et qui ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles polygames à Koula, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont  le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, MAMA, debout au milieu, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,25 hectare de riz .
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20 000F CFA environs  en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group TIESSIRI VI are married women who average 29 years of age  and three children each. The women live in polygamous families in Koula, a village in the Rural Commune of Banco, Prefecture of Dioïla, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of organizing their businesses better at the start of the off-season. The crops grown are rice and peanuts. The group members are now on their first collaboration with the institution. 

With this loan, MAMA, who is standing in the middle of the photo, intends to buy inputs and assorted supplies and equipment and to pay the cost of plowing for maintaining about 0.25 hectare of rice. After the harvests, the produce is sold at the markets of Baou, Koula, Banco, and N’Golobougou. The customer base is composed of women and men. MAMA plans on making an average profit of about 20,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, manure, herbicides, weeding, and assorted equipment

loans.name: Yhenny

texts.es: La señora Yhenny se dedica a la venta de almuerzos y cenas con ayuda de su madre. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de insumos como ser: arroz, fideo, carne, así podrá ofrecer a su clientela mayor variedad en el menú que ofrece.  Vive en casa en alquiler la misma queda ubicada en la zona de villa  armonía en la ciudad de La Paz, es soltera  y tiene un  hijo. Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en: Yhenny sells lunches and dinners with help from her mother.  She needs the loan to buy ingredients like: rice, noodles and meat so that she can offer a wider variety in the menu she offers.  She lives in a rented house located in the city of La Paz’s Villa Armonía zone.  She’s single and has a son.  This is the first time the client has obtained an IMPRO loan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es: Liliana de 39 años de edad, vive con su esposo y tiene dos hijos en las edades de 4 y 7 años respectivamente; ella es una diseñadora gráfica, que trabajó durante 15 años ejerciendo su profesión en una importante empresa de la ciudad  y el año pasado cuando dejó de trabajar, puso a funcionar su idea emprendedora de vender mercancías mediante guías especializadas de productos. que hoy tiene empeño en hacerla crecer y desarrollar todo su potencial, para genera estabilidad en sus ingresos y mayor bienestar para su hogar. Su principal mercado son sus vecinos, amigos, familiares y ahora cuenta con muchos referidos, que han generado un importante crecimiento de pedidos, que hacen ver su capital de trabajo insuficiente, para resolver oportunamente sus necesidades. Esta es la razón por la cual acuden a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará  accesorios femeninos, cosméticos y ropa. Su estrategia es ofrecer a su clientela descuentos del 5 y el 10% por su pago puntual y así ha logrado fidelizarlos. Su meta más adelante es abrir un local al público, para incrementar sus ventas y lograr una atención confortable y estable, para que sus clientes continúen prefiriéndola. En su negocio maneja un margen de utilidad no menor del 35% y una rotación de inventarios de 4 días, indicadores financieros desde los cuales planea su crecimiento.
texts.en:
Liliana is 39 years old and lives with her husband and two children, ages 4 and 7 respectively. She is a graphic designer and worked for 15 years in this profession for a major company in the city. When she left this job last year, Liliana came up with the idea of selling merchandise through specialty catalogs. Today she is committed to growing and developing to her full potential so that she can generate a stable income in order to provide for the welfare of her household. Her main market consists of her neighbors, friends, relatives, and now the many referrals that she has accumulated. Even though Liliana has experienced significant growth in her orders, she has not built up sufficient capital necessary to respond to opportunities. For this reason she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

Liliana will use the money to buy women’s accessories, cosmetics, and clothing. Her strategy is to offer her customers discounts of 5 and 10% for paying on time and for being loyal. Going forward, her goal is to have a shop that is open to the public so that she can increase her sales and provide comfortable and stable service that will encourage her customers to continue doing business with her. Liliana maintains a profit margin of no less than 35% and a product turnover period of four days. These financial indicators signal her plans for growth.

loans.use: to buy women’s accessories, cosmetics, and clothing.

loans.name: Iván Darío

texts.es:
Iván es un luchador incansable que nunca se ha rendido ante las dificultades, a sus 53 años de edad se considera un soñador, pues desde que sus hijos nacieron se ha preocupado por brindarles estabilidad y armonía en el hogar y para ello ha tenido que enfrentar grandes retos como el de llegar a la ciudad después de haber vivido por muchos años en el pueblo de donde es oriundo, Cañas Gordas, municipio que hace parte del departamento de Antioquia, allí trabajó en una finca y con la ilusión de progresar y brindarle un mejor futuro a sus hijos  se trasladó a Medellín, donde actualmente tiene una panadería y salsamentaria, en su negocio la variedad y calidad de sus productos, marcan la diferencia. 

Sueña con que este progreso sea continuo, es por este motivo que solicita un préstamo, ya que él no cuenta con el capital necesario para comprar un botellero, en el cual organizar mejor las botellas, dándole al negocio más orden, más espacio, y mejor apariencia.
texts.en:
Iván is a tirelessly determined man who has never surrendered when faced with difficulties. At 53 years of age, he considers himself a dreamer as since the birth of his children he has been concerned with providing them with stability and harmony in the home. To do this he has had to face great challenges such as coming to the city after living for many years in his home town of Cañas Gordas, a municipality that forms part of the department of Antioquia where he used to work on a farm. With the dream of making progress and providing his children with a better future, he moved to Medellín where he currently has a bakery and delicatessen. In his business, range and quality of product make a difference.

He dreams that this progress continues. That  is why he is asking for a loan as he does not have the capital necessary to buy a bottle holder, with which to better organize the bottles, making the business more organized and giving it more space and a better appearance.

loans.use: to buy a bottle holder that he needs for his business.

loans.name: Remedio

texts.en:
This is Remedio.  He is 50 years old and is a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. He is married to Jesselyn, a caregiver and mother to their three children. Their eldest child is already in high school while the other two are still staying at home. Remedio, together with his wife, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Remedio operates a rolling store. His rolling store is basically a small household product store, which retails plastic containers, dippers, pails, plastic flowers and basins to the local neighborhood. He drives his rolling store within the local community to sell the products. He earns profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of Php 800 in sales every day.

To help him continue the operations of his business, Remedio is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy pails, plasticware, hangers, clothes pins, plastic flowers and other items to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Remedio hopes that his business will continue to be successful and dreams to have a permanent store. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy plasticware

loans.name: Main Street Group

texts.en:
Suward is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Suward was born in Makeni city 28 years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple has 5 children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Suward sells market food – salt, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), pepper, etc. She has been a businesswoman for many years now. 

With the help of this loan, Suward and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Suward is going to use her share of the loan (500,000 SLL) to buy salt, margi, pepper, etc. in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy salt, margi, pepper, etc. in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: El Futuro 6 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Mari is one of the members in the group called El Futuro 6 & 7 (The Future). She has two children and they live together with her long term partner in a simple structure home. Her group is located in a rural zone in the outskirts of the touristy city of La Romana. Her community is a sugar cane growing area where the main activity is growing and cutting sugar cane. These 10 women carry out a variety of activities like the sale of clothes, cosmetics and shoes; beauty salon, grocery store among others.

Mari is very excited about receiving her third loan from Esperanza Internacional having paid her previous loans and invested her loans and profits in her business. Mari started her business 15 years ago, with a help she received from her mother, now she has a little grocery store called in Dominican Republic “colmado” which is a small grocery store where her neighbors come by to purchase basic need items for their families daily meals. She will use the loan to buy rice, beans, cooking oil, and other goods. 

Her most difficult challenge is to have her own house, this is also her most important dream, when she has her own house, she will be very happy and proud of her work.

loans.use: to buy rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Luz Estella

texts.es:
A sus 48 años de edad, Luz Estella vive con su esposo y su hijo en el barrio la salle de la ciudad de Medellín, desde hace 7 años consiente de la necesidad de colaborarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, Luz creo su propio negocio, vende en un puesto en una de las principales calles de su barrio comidas rápidas y jugos naturales. 

Ahora Luz Estella, ve la necesidad de irle realizando mejoras a su negocio con el fin de ser mas eficiente y mediante esto atraer nuevos clientes, por eso a solicitado un crédito para comprar 2 licuadoras nuevas al igual que surtido para su negocio, logrando así mejorar sus activos, producir más, mejorar las ventas y proporcionalmente su calidad de vida para brindarles todo lo que se merecen.
texts.en:
At the age of 48, Luz Estella lives with her husband and son in the city of Medellín’s La Salle neighborhood.  Conscious of the need to help her husband meet household expenses Luz started her own business seven years ago.  She sells fast food and natural juices in a stand on one of her neighborhood’s main streets.

Now Luz Estella sees the necessity to do some improvements to her business so that she can be more efficient and attract new customers.  This is why she’s asking for a loan to buy two new blenders as well as ingredients to stock her business thereby having more assets to produce more, improve sales and proportionately her quality of life to provide them with all they deserve.

loans.use: to buy two blenders and ingredients.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 26 years old and married with two children between the ages of 2 and 3 years old. Jacqueline sells tableware and has two years of experience in this business.

Jacqueline has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more tableware (dishes, plates, spoons, cups, etc) to sell. With any profits, Jacqueline will be able to save for her future and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more tableware (dishes, plates, spoons, cups etc) to sell

loans.name: Wokape Njete B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Wokape Njete B Group in Western Kenya! This group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Joseph is the facilitator of the Wokape Njete B Group. He is a father of two children. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow maize well to ensure food security for his family and to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Joseph had an excellent maize yield harvesting twenty-five bags on two and a half acres of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Joseph was only able to harvest ten bags of maize on two and a half acres of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joseph and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Joseph will save to ensure food security for his family and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Wokape Njete B Group will each plant between half and two and a half acres of maize.
In the photograph above, Joseph is pictured together with his group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, de 39 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa,  está separada de su pareja hace 9 años, vive en compañía de sus cuatro hijos de 21, 19, 14 y 11 años de edad y una empleada del hogar, instalado cómodamente en propia casa.
El negocio de tiene Rosa es la venta ropa de diferentes modelos para damas, caballeros y niños, para lo cual viaja periódicamente a la ciudad de Lima, para luego venderlo entre sus amistades y familiares de manera personal. Tiene 16 años realizando esta actividad y paralelo a ello tiene otro negocio desde hace 3 años y consistes en la venta de comidas en un centro educativo. Lo que le gusta de su negocio es que la mantienen ocupada y la distraen, además del ingreso económico que le generará para solventar sus gastos familiares. Comenta además que gana más en la venta de ropa donde sus ganancias logran llegar hasta el 100% de lo invertido, y con sus ganancias tiene planes de invertir en  abrir una fuente de soda en su propia casa. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta con el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo y desea seguir contando con ese apoyo, por eso dice será puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, comprará más ropa al por mayor a menor precio para tener mayores ganancias, para ésta campaña navideña.
texts.en: Rosa, 39 years of age, is a diligent and hard-working woman.  She separated from her husband 9 years ago and lives with her four children ages 21, 19, 14 and 11 and an employee of the home, installed conveniently in her own house.  Rosa's business is the sale clothes of different models for ladies, gentlemen and children, for which she travels periodically to the city of Lima, in order to sell to her friends and relatives in a personal way.  She has been carrying out this activity for 16 years and along with this she has had another business for 3 years which consists of selling food in an educational center.  What she likes about her businesses is that they keep her busy and distract her, besides the economic income that they will generate to settle her family expenses.  In addition, she tells us that she earns more in the sale of clothes where her profits manage to reach 100% of her investment, and with her profits she has plans to invest in opening a snack bar in her own house.  This will be loan number 2 with the institution MFP.  She is happy with the financial support that she is receiving and desires to continue counting on that support, therefore she says that she will be punctual in making her payments.  With the requested total of 2000 new soles, she will buy more clothes wholesale at a smaller price to have greater profits, for this Christmas campaign.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Originally from the Ponhea Krek district, Navy is 41 years old. She is a peasant who has been growing soy beans and cassava for more than five years to make a living. She now earns more than 15 U.S. dollars per day from her current business. 

Navy is the fourth cycled loan client. The previous loans from VisionFund have helped her grow her business. Now she is applying for another loan. She will use it to grow more soy beans and use some of the loan to buy a new ladder for her house. She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her business growing while having a new ladder for her house.

loans.use: to grow more soy beans and buy a new ladder for her house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Vergie is 57 years old and is married with six children. She lives in Tag-ibo, San Juan, Siquijor. To earn a living, Vergie runs a general store and she earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one month.

Vergie is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase more merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to purchse stock for her store

loans.name: Tumema

texts.en:
Tumema is 41 years of age and is married with 7 children.

Tumema owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She has 1 year of experience in this business. Tumema needs a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Tumema joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Tumema's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Dios Verdadero 1 & 3 Group

texts.en: Mary is the coordinator of her group Dios Verdadero (True God) 1 & 3. This group, in which most of the members are Haitian, lives in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and the sugar cane industry. Mary makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their five children. Mary is excited to be taking her ninth loan with Esperanza. She has a clothing sales business; she sells all kind of clothes, for women, men and kids. With this loan, she will invest in her business by increasing her inventory, buying jeans, pants, shirts, skirts, t-shirts and other items. Mary's long-term goal is to have a successful business and to build her own house. Now she is living in a batey (a sugar-cane company town) and she is very interested in moving to a more affordable community. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Kahrman

texts.en: Kahrman is a 52 year old married woman who has two family members from Ashrafia Amman Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 JD to pay for materials that will allow her to arrange flowers and to buy antiques to sell. She would like to sell her products to the shops near her and in other areas. In the future, she hopes to open a small shop to show her products and to increase her family income.

loans.use: to pay for the materials for her to sell her flower arrangements.

loans.name: Néné

texts.fr: Madame Néné est  une femme mariée qui s’active depuis 5 ans dans la vente de d’huile de palme et de balais. Elle vit dans une des localités du Sénégal. Les revenus que lui procure son activité lui permettent de participer aux charges du ménage (paiement factures et frais  de transport).Elle est membre du guichet de l’UIMCEC de sa zone d’habitation ou elle a déjà remboursé 3 crédits antérieurs. Elle sollicite présentement un prêt de 150 000 frs prévu pour  l’achat d’huile de palme et de balais a revendre. Son intention est de développer son activité de commerce, d’accroitre ses bénéfices pour parvenir a  épargner davantage et diversifier les produits qu’elle commercialise. Elle souhaite  démarrer la vente de jus. Son projet futur consiste a disposer d’une cantine.

loans.use: acheter de l'huile de palme et des balais a revendre

loans.name: Shaida

texts.en: Shaida , is 33 years old, married woman, runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sewing and then selling it to the people of her locality.  She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. The garment selling business has allowed Nusrat to help earn money for the household thus easing the expenses and improving the standard of living for the family. For the improvement of her business, Shaida  has requested a Murabaha loan of 25000 PKR  to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to meet customers’ demand consistently to increase her net income for improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to meet customers’ demand consistently to increase her net income for improving their standard of living

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria Elidja N., 26 years old, is a native of Salamanga, Matutuíne District, Maputo Province and is married and the mother of two children. She attended school through fifth grade. For various reasons, she separated from her first husband, and returned to her parents' home, starting a type of business where she walked about selling clothes. She did not have enough funds available to make the business viable, and turned to HLUVUKU's financial services in 2001.

With financing, the results were encouraging, having acquired, repaired and equipped a market-type commercial establishment.

She currently employs four people, including herself. She has two children depending on her, as well as her parents and five nephews whose parents died as victims of HIV/AIDS.

With this loan, she is trying to increase her working capital in order to respond to the shopping for basic goods needed during the holiday period that is approaching, Christmas and New Year's. This establishment benefits around sixty (60) families residing in the village of Salamanga.

Translated from Portuguese by Naomi Baer, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização : Vila de Salamanga

Cliente : Maria Elija N.

Sector : Comercio

Montante : 47.000,00Mtn (1,808.00US$)

Aplicação : Compra de produtos primeira necessidade

Inicio : 30 de Novembro de 2006

Período : 16 Meses

Maria Elidja N. de 26 anos de idade, Natural de Salamanga distrito de Matutuíne, Província de Maputo, Casada maritalmente e Mãe de Dois filhos, frequentou a escola até quinta classe, por motivos de vária ordem separou-se do primeiro marido, regressada a casa dos pais iniciou negócio de tipo ambulatório de venda de roupa (vestuário), esta não dispunha de fundos suficientes para viabilizar o seu negócio, tendo recorrido aos serviços financeiros da HLUVUKU em 2001.

Com os financiamentos os resultados foram encorajadores tendo adquirido, reabilitado e equipado um estabelecimento comercial tipo mercearia.

Actualmente emprega quatro pessoas, incluindo ela própria, dela dependem dois filhos, seus pais e cinco sobrinhos cujos pais morreram vitimas de HIV/SIDA.

Com este empréstimo tenciona aumentar o capital de trabalho de modo a responder a procura de produtos de primeira necessidade durante a quadra festiva que se aproxima, Natal e Fim do Ano. Este estabelecimento beneficia cerca de sessenta (60) famílias residentes na vila de Salamanga.

loans.use: Increase food stock

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en:
Ophie, 36,is married and has 3 children.  She started her operations 4 years ago and sells household provisions in her community.  Items sold include canned foods,beverages,soft drinks and bread as well as sachet water.

Ophie has benefited from the KRABAN'S 'TEACH' sessions in February,2007.  She intends to use the KIVA loan to add more items to her inventory.

loans.use: Add items to her inventory

loans.name: Christo

texts.en: Christo O. is a young woman of 37 years. She is married with three (3) children, a LAPO client for over 6 years. She has proved her wealth of experience in her line of business. She needs the money ($550) to keep her business booming.

loans.use: To buy more ice cream ingredients

loans.name: Patrocinia

texts.en:
Patrocinia M. D. S., 58 and her husband Cirilo S., 62, run a despensa (grocery store) at their home. Patrocinia, a retired professor, is a mother of two daughters, ages 26 and 19. The elder daughter is a professor and the other is a student, both of whom still live with her.

Patrocinia and her husband started the store over 7 years ago. Her husband wakes up at 5:30 in the morning to open the store every day and they work until 9 at night. They buy their merchandise from Mercado Itá, downtown Asuncion, and from vendors that pass by and sell to their store. They sell a variety of items at their store, such as notebooks, cleaning products, a huge selection of snacks, and bags.

Products that are sold most frequently are drinks and edible items. Usually, she sells more drinks in the summer when it is hotter than in the wintertime. Recently they introduced a new type of gummy candy to their store, which has been a huge favorite amongst the children in the neighborhood and is selling very quickly. Cirilo and Patrocinia are hoping to receive a loan in order to invest in their business, in particular to purchase a larger variety of products for their store. They would like to buy more of the gummy candy that all the children are demanding from their store.

loans.use: Purchase candy and drinks.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago is 51 years old, married to his wife who is 49 years old. They have 4 children, three daughters and one son, all of them study, and the oldest will finish highschool this year.

From the time he was young, Santiago was learning to work in the small business with his parents. With a lot of sacrifice, he became a main producer in agriculture in the area where he lived. After he married, he continued working in the same business, watching the business grow as a result of his sacrifice, and seeing his family progressing more and more. With the income he was able to open a dispensary in his house and also raise the cattle successfully.

His hope is to continue growing and improving his business to offer a better future for his children, and see them as professional, ethical and hardworking. He wants this loan to buy livestock, as raising and selling the animals generates an excellent profit margin.

El señor Santiago, tiene 51 años de edad y su esposa 49, tienen cuatro hijos, tres mujeres y un varón, todos estudian; tres están en edad escolar y la mayor termina este año el colegio. Desde la infancia don Santiago fue aprendiendo a trabajar en la chacra con sus padres con mucho sacrificio llegando a ser un gran agricultor y productor de la zona donde vive. Después de casarse continuó trabajando en la misma actividad, viendo crecer el fruto de su sacrificio y el de su familia progresando cada vez más, ya que con los ingresos que obtuvo pudo abrir una despensa en su casa y también realiza engorde de ganados vacunos con éxito. Su deseo es continuar creciendo y mejorar cada vez más su negocio para así ofrecerle un mejor futuro a sus hijos y verlos profesionales, éticos y trabajadores. Desea el crédito para comprar ganado vacuno, ya que el engorde y venta de estos animales generan un excelente margen de ganancias.

loans.use: purchase livestock, cattle

loans.name: Thi Phuong

texts.vi:
Ms Phượng is 47 years old. She lives in Phú Mẫn hamlet, in the town of Chờ, Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh. She is married with 2 school aged children. Before she worked as a laborer for hire: vegetables picking, construction worker, sand bag carrier. She made an effort to save money to start a chicken raising business. Today she has a peep of egg laying chickens. Everyday she carries the eggs to the market to sell. She plans to repair the chicken coop and to expand her business. She really wishes to obtain a loan to realize her plan.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Phượng 47 tuổi sống ở thôn Phú Mẫn, thị trấn Chờ, Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh. Chị có chồng và có 2 con đang đi học. Trước đây, chị chủ yếu đi làm thuê như gánh cát, đánh vữa xây dựng, gặt hái thuê... Sau này, chị đã cố gắng tiết kiệm và nuôi được đàn gà đẻ. Chị dùng số lượng trứng thu được mỗi ngày mang ra chợ bán. Hiện tại chị đang muốn cải tạo lại chuồng gà cho phù hợp và rộng rãi hơn. Chị rất mong muốn có được khoản vay như đã đăng ký để thực hiện kế hoạch của mình.

loans.use: To repair the chicken coop.

loans.name: Lonise

texts.en:
Lonise is a lady of 41 years and is married with three children. She applied for this loan in order to buy food and ingredients needed for running her business. She sells food at the school every day and at stores near her house on weekends. She earns around $64 USD ($160 ST) per day, but more on weekends.

She said she is very happy with her business, because it gives her much help and the money is used to meet her family's needs, especially those of her children. She said she’s going to stay in the program for a long time.

loans.use: To buy food and supplies for her fast food stall

loans.name: Anarsih

texts.en: Anarsih, 42, is a mother of 3 children. Her husband, E., sells waste materials and earns USD21 a week. To supplement her husband's income, she sells vegetables such as chilis, onions, etc., earning USD5 a day. She needs a loan of USD75 to add to her business capital. As a member of MBK she agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty K. is 36 years old and married with three school-going children. She runs a retail shop together with her husband in Nakifuma, and she has been our client for over three years. The loans have really helped her in building her shop, especially with transporting her goods from the trading center, although at times she buys goods from the wholesale shop in her area that belongs to another member of ours.

loans.use: Restock her shop with more sugar, salt, soap, Vaseline and toothpaste

loans.name: Affiwa Akpé

texts.fr:
Ms. Affiwa Akpé A., age 52, is married to Mr. Richard TSOKONA, who is a taxi driver. They have three children. Ms. A.'s main business is commerce in fabrics at the grand marketplace in Lomé. She began in this business and has been in it since 1982. Her first loan of 450,000 francs CFA, which she has by the way paid off promptly, enabled her to avoid inventory shortages up until now. Given the size of her current customer base, she is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs CFA to buy 50 roles of new fabrics to meet customer demand better. With the income from this business, she helps her husband with family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 52 ans, madame A. Affiwa Akpé s’est mariée à Monsieur TSOKONA Richard qui est un conducteur de Taxi. Ils ont 3 enfants. Madame A. Affiwa Akpé a pour activité principale l’achat et vente de tissus au grand marché de Lomé. Elle a commencé par exercer cette activité depuis 1982. Son premier crédit d’une valeur de 450.000FCFA qu’elle a d’ailleurs promptement remboursé lui a permis de ne plus avoir une rupture de stock jusqu’à ce jour. Compte tenu de l’importance de sa clientèle actuelle, elle sollicite un emprunt d’une valeur de 500.000FCFA pour acheter 50 rouleaux de nouveaux tissus pour mieux répondre à la demande de ses clients. Avec le revenu de cette activité elle aide son mari dans les dépenses familiales.

loans.use: To stock an inventory of fabrics

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
Violeta belongs to "Banco Comunal Vecinas Unidas", located in "`Jr Agustín Cauper 167, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali". She is 48 years old and mother of 6 children. However, her income is not enough to support her family. WIth the first loan she received, she invested on some clothes for her store.

She currently owns a store which has clothes for men, women and children. She wakes up every morning at 7am in order to prepare breakfast for her kids. She then heads to her store in which she works until 9pm.

With this loan of S/. 1,000, which will be paid back in 4 months, she will buy more clothes, fabrics of diverse colors and forms, needles, threads, etc.

Violeta is very happy, her business is improving every day. She still remembers when she began and is happy to be able to support her family. She has become a hard-working woman and is very happy for the support she has received.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Violeta pertenece al Banco Comunal Vecinas Unidas, ubicado en el Jr Agustín Cauper 167, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 48 años y es madre D. 6 hijos, pero los ingresos económicos que tiene no le alcanzan para mantener los gastos familiares, Violeta con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en el negocio D. confecciones D. ropas. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio D. bazar y confecciones D. ropas para damas, caballeros y niños, se levanta a las7am para preparar el desayuno D. sus hijos y D. allí se dedica a la atención D. su bazar y confección D. sus prendas hasta las 9 pm. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará pasamanería, telas D. diversas formas y colores, blondas, hilos, etc. Violeta esta muy feliz y contenta, su negocio esta mejorando cada día y no olvida que cuando empezó todo era distinto ahora ella pueD. sacar adelante a su familia valiéndose por si misma, se ha convertido en una mujer luchadora, ella esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for her store

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
I must fix the front door of my house as well as a window since they were not finished during a refurbishment that we did. I am requesting $430 to carry out the repairs.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: Door and window repairs

loans.name: Robiya

texts.en:
Robiya H. is 51 years old and is married. She and her husband have raised seven children. For more than 12 years, Robiya has been selling vegetables, such as cabbage, tomatoes, cucumbers, and garlic. Her son helps Robiya with the business. Robiya begins her work day early in the morning, at 5:00 a.m., buying vegetables wholesale from the local farmers, and then selling them in the market. In the market, she is known among people because of her attractive prices and friendly personality. This allows Robiya’s business to generate a stable and considerable income for her family.

Now it is the season and her goods are in great demand. For this reason, she is planning to purchase new fresh fruits and vegetables to sell. For this purpose, she requests 2600 Somoni ($775 USD) for 10 months. Your support will really help her. Be an important part of the growth of Robiya’s business.

loans.use: Increasing the range of vegetables that she sells

loans.name: Shabnam's Group

texts.en:
Shabnam baji is the wife of A. S. and lives in Arifwala, Pakistan. (Baji is the Urdu term of respect for 'elder sister'.) They have been married for the last 25 years and she is the mother of seven children: three sons and four daughters. Her eldest son works in a rice factory. All of her daughters are enrolled in a local school near her neighborhood. Shabnam’s husband has a livestock business and Shabnam baji sews clothes on order from her neighborhood. Now she wants a loan for her husband’s livestock business. He wants to buy another animal and resell it for profit.

The loan group has three additional members. Hanifan baji wants a loan for her scrap work. Jannat baji requests a loan for her embroidery business, and Yasmeen baji wants a loan for her garment business.

Loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Toa

texts.en:
Toa R., 29, is a young farmer living in Siem Reap with her husband, Lea Lam, and their two children. She raises pigs out of her home, making the wine that is used to help them grow large quickly. She typically makes US$2 per day, while her husband works their field making US$3 per day. Toa R. has asked for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a pair of cows to help her husband with the field work. They can be valuable as plows and the family believes the benefits that two cows can provide to the family's farm will be enough to increase their income and improve their business. They are optimistic about this investment and they look forward to the relief that these cows will provide to the work on the farm.

Toa R. was unavailable for a photograph at the time of the interview, so her husband is pictured above.

loans.use: Toa would like to purchase cows to help around the farm.

loans.name: Atsufe

texts.fr: Atsufe A.  est propriétaire d’une boutique d’alimentation générale depuis bientôt 3 ans à Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle est âgée de 35 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle désire par ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son commerce en achetant des cartons de laits, de sucres, des sacs de riz et autres produits afin de répondre au besoin de la clientèle. Atsufe compte sur cette opportunité pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
For almost three years, Atsufe A. has been the proprietor of a general store in Kpalimé, a town situated about 120 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is 35, married and the mother of two children. She would like to use this loan to expand her business by buying cases of milk, sugar, sacks of rice and other products so as to meet the needs of her clientele. Atsufe is counting on this opportunity to be able to better support her children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase cases of milk, sugar, sacks of rice and other products for re-sale

loans.name: Trabajando Juntas Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal trabajando juntas pertenece a L. comunidad D. Yauli ubicado en el Departamento D. Huancavelica. Esta comunidad tiene 2 zonas turísticas D. Incañan y también es zona comercial.

Norma S., es casada tiene 7 hijos, se dedica a tejer en telares, teje día y noche a pedidos. A pesar D. que esta enferma y L. van a operar Norma continúa con sus tejidos. Con los préstamos que recibe elL. compra materiales como lanas e insumos para su negocio. Su sueño es tener una empresa textil y exportar sus productos, tambien comprarse una maquina remalladora.

Norma L., es casada y tiene 2 hijos, le gusta tejer mantas, gorros, hilo D. lana D. alpaca, ovino, que luego venD. en las ferias D. Paucará – Yauli, algunas veces los lleva a Lima con el apoyo D. su esposo. Su préstamo lo utilizará en comprar materia prima para su negocio. Su sueño es tener una empresa granD. y abrir una tiendita para solventar el estudio D. sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Trabajando Juntas Communal Bank is located in the community of Yauli, Huancavelica province. This community's economic activities are tourism (in Incañan) and traD..

Norma S., is married and has 7 children. She is a loom weaver, and weaves day and night to fulfill customers' orders. She has not stopped weaving in spite of being ill, and expecting to undergo surgery. Norma has used her loans to buy raw materials for her business. Her dream is to have a textile factory and export her products. She would also like to buy a weaving machine.

Norma L., is married and has two children. She likes to weave covers, hats, alpaca and lamb wool, which she sells at the fairs in Paucara and Yauli. Sometimes she takes her items to sell in Lima, with the help of her husband. She will use her loan to purchase raw materials for her business. Her dream is to have a large textile company, and to open a small grocery store to give her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The Trabajando Juntas Communal Bank needs 6,200 nuevo soles for 10 members to invest in their business

loans.name: Zahid

texts.en:
Zahid B. is a 29 year old trader who keeps his store, which he has already had for 8 years.  He is married and has 2 sons.  He sells drinks, home stuff, hair coloring, etc. 

Zahid doesn't have a permanent job, which is why this shop in the only own source of income for his family.  His wife actively helps him.  Zahid dreams of providing the best education to his children. 

He applied for $1,200 to purchase more inventory to stock his shop and increase his income.  Let's do our best to make Zahid's dreams come true.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory to stock his shop

loans.name: Khom

texts.en:
Mrs. Khom P. is a villager in Krodass Kor village in Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband, Mr. Koy Kai, are farmers who own a plot of land where they cultivate rice to earn their living. Since they have only one business from which they can make only a meager income to provide for their family, Mrs. Khom P. decided to ask for a loan to buy ducklings and duck food to start breeding ducks. She hopes to increase their income and improve her living conditions.

Khom is 51 years old and the mother of six children, one of whom is a computer teacher in the local institute while another one is employed in a garment factory. Two of them stay home to do household work while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy ducklings and duck food to start breeding ducks

loans.name: Lat

texts.en:
Mrs. Lat H. is 30 years old and she now lives in An Loung Tnout village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a Khmer cake seller. Her husband, Mr. En Ny, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. In the plantation, he faces an obstacle because his field is far froman irrigation system. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Lat H. decided to ask for a loan to buy a water pump to water the field to make the crop more productive.

She has six children. Five are enrolled in the local school while the youngest one, four years old, is too young to work or study.

loans.use: Buy a water pump to water the field to make the crop more productive.

loans.name: Misriah

texts.id: Misriah, 35 tahun, tinggal dipesisir pantai. Sebagai seorang istri nelayan, Misriah menekuni usaha jual beli ikan. Disamping menjual ikan segar, Misriah juga menjual ikan Teri ( ikan kecil yang dikeringkan ). Usaha ini ditekuninya untuk menunjang usaha utamanya menjual ikan segar yang didapat olegh suaminya. Untuk meningkatkan usahanya, Misriah memerlukan dana sebesar Rp. 1.000.000.- Dana ini dipergunakan untuk membeli lebih banyak lagi ikan kecil dari nelayan yang lain. Setelah dibersihkan dan dijemur sampai kering, harga per kilo Rp. 10.000.- Dalam seminggu Misriah bisa menjual 10 kilo ikan Teri. Dengan tambahan dana yang didapatnya, Misriah berharap dalam seminggu dia bisa menjual 20 kilo ikan Teri.
texts.en:
35 years old Misriah lives by a sea shore. As a fisherman’s wife, Misriah trades fish. In addition to selling fresh fish, Misriah also sells small dried fish. She runs this business to support her primary business of selling fresh fish caught by her husband. To take her business to the next level, Misriah needs 1,000,000 IDR. This fund will be used to buy more small dried fish from other fishermen. After cleaning and drying, the fish can be sold for 10,000 IDR per kilogram. In a week Misriah can sell 10 kilograms of small dried fish. With additional capital Misriah hopes to sell 20 kilograms of small dried fish in a week.

Translated from Indonesian by Arliadi (Ludi) Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more fish

loans.name: Leocadia

texts.en:
Leocadia C. is 37 years old. She lives in Barangay Pilitan, Tumauini, Isabela, a rural village located near the Cagayan River. Ybanag is the common dialect of the people. She is married to Minileo, a farmer, and they have no children as of now.

She chooses to engage in eggplant production as her business. She has a 200 square meter vegetable garden near their house that she has planted with eggplant. This serves as their alternative source of income that helps provide their daily needs.

Leocadia wants to borrow the amount of PHP 3, 000 that she can use in her business. Aside from eggplant, she is also engaged in meat-vending and part of the loan will also be used for this. She said that she will work hard towards the development of their life.

loans.use: For eggplant production and meat vending

loans.name: Ravshan

texts.en: A. Ravshan applied to MicroInvest in 2009 for the first time but she appears to be a reliable client since she has not had any delays in repaying prior loans. She wants to take the next step and increase turnover to expand her existing business. Ravshan has been selling vegetables for 8 years. She works directly with collective farmers and she has lower prices than the bazaar prices. Ravshan sells mostly  tomatoes, cucumbers and onions. Ravshan also works in the local library. Ravshan is applying for a business development loan of 500 STJ for 6 months to import goods on a large-scale. She thanks KIVA for its support and help.

loans.use: large-scale good importing

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario tiene 62 años, vive con su esposo Bernardo en la casa que le dejaron sus padres. Ella es una mujer muy alegre y carismática, se dedica a la atención de su pequeña tienda, la cual tiene en su propia casa y en la cual aparte de comestibles, vende también prendas de vestir tejidas a mano, las cuales ella misma elabora gracias a lo aprendido de joven. Adicionalmente, da clases de tejido y manualidades en el hospital de su zona, ayudando a las personas de la tercera edad a sentirse más útiles. Sus ”viejitos” como de cariño les dice, también quieren mucho a Rosario, ya que siempre está muy alegre y desbordante de alegría, y no es difícil dejar de quererla, pues su magnética personalidad hace que cause ese efecto en todos los que la conocen, es por eso que tiene gran cantidad de clientela, siendo su negocio muy rentable. En el futuro quiere tener una gran tienda donde pueda ofrecer cremoladas, jugos y otros productos, para eso necesita un local más grande. Rosario es una cliente muy fiel a MFP, ya tiene muchos préstamos con esta intitución, pero este es su primer crédito individual, fuera de su banco comunal, y promete ser muy puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará una reja para poder agrandar el espacio de su tienda hacia el exterior, poner mesas para que la clientela pueda consumir los productos al aire libre, esto hará que tenga más espacio y mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Rosario is 62 years old and lives with her husband Bernardo in a house that was left to her by her parents. She is a very happy and charismatic woman who runs a small shop in her home. In addition to groceries, Rosario's shop sells clothing that she makes by hand, utilizing a skill she learned as a child. She also gives classes in crocheting and handicrafts to elderly people at the local hospital, helping them feel more useful. Her “old folks,” as she affectionately calls them, love her, as she is always very kind and overflowing with happiness. It is easy to love Rosario, as her magnetic personality has this effect on everyone who knows her. Because of this, she has a very large clientele and that makes for a very profitable business. In the future, Rosario would like to have a large shop where she can sell smoothies, juices, and other items. For this, she will need to expand her storefront.

Rosario is a very loyal client of Microfinanzas PRISMA, and has already received many loans. This is her first loan as an individual, not as a member of a community bank, and she promises to be very punctual in its repayment. With this loan she will purchase a railing to expand her shop outside and will install tables so that her customers can enjoy their purchases in the open air. This will enable her to have more space and more security.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her shop to provide better customer service

loans.name: Eliza

texts.es: Eliza tiene 33 años, es madre soltera, vive en casa de sus padres con su único hijo. Hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de golosinas y bebidas (gaseosas y jugos) en su casa. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar una buena atención a sus clientes para que los mismos se sientan a gusto y regresen otro día. Su negocio le es rentable porque por donde ella vive es la única que vende estos productos que gustan a muchos y sobre todo a los niños. Eliza está contenta con su trabajo, y gracias al mismo, está logrando, poco a poco, sus objetivos. Para más adelante quiere ampliar su negocio y ambientarlo mejor para dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes. Con este ya son 11 préstamos que tiene con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque todos los integrantes son responsables, coordinados y puntuales en sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora viene solicitando comprará golosinas y bebidas gaseosas a un costo de 1000 soles, lo demás lo invertirá en la construcción de su casa, ya que sus padres le cedieron una parte de su terreno para que construya su vivienda, donde podrá implementar mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Eliza is 33 years old, a single mother, and lives in her parents’ house with her only son. For six years she has dedicated herself to the sale of candies and drinks (sodas and juices) in her house. What she likes about her job is to give good service to her customers so that they like it and come back another day. Her business is profitable because where she lives she is the only person that sells these products that so many enjoy, above all the children. Eliza is happy with her work and, thanks to that, is achieving her objectives little by little. In the future she wants to increase her business and improve the atmosphere in order to give her customers a better reception.

This will be her eleventh loan with MFP, and she enjoys working with her communal bank because all of the members are responsible, coordinated, and punctual in their payments. With the money she is now asking for she will purchase candies and sodas at a cost of 1000 PEN, and the rest will be invested in the construction of her house, now that her parents have given her a part of their land to build her own house, where she will be able to better set up her business.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing of merchandise and arrangement of her living quarters

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma C. is a 44-year-old married housewife and mother of one, who lives in Tuyabang Bajo, Oroquieta City, in the Philippines.  For a living, Alma buys and sells coconuts in a neighboring town. She plans to use her requested loan from Kiva partner, Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, as additional capital for her buying and selling business. Her personal goal is to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy additional coconuts

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga tiene 61 años, está separada, vive sola en su casa propia. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de carne de manera ambulante, ofreciendo su producto a sus vecinos y amistades; y de acuerdo a los pedidos que le hacen compra su mercadería. Es importante para ella asegurarse de que la carne que le vende su proveedor sea de buena calidad y con garantía, porque de eso dependen sus próximas ventas. Cada día, Olga se levanta muy temprano para comprar la carne y llevarla a sus clientes, sabe que su ritmo de trabajo es cansado, sin embargo, disfruta de hacerlo, y piensa en continuar con este negocio mientras tenga fuerzas para ello. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y está muy contenta de tener un espacio de amistad donde crece personal y económicamente. El dinero que Olga solicita será invertido en la compra de más carne para abastecer los pedidos para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Olga is 61 years old: she is separated and lives alone in her own house. For the last three years she has sold meat on the street, offering her products to neighbours and friends, in accordance with the the orders they make for her merchandise. It is important for her to be sure that the meat which her provider sells is of guaranteed good quality, because this is what her future sales depend on. Every day, Olga gets up very early in order to buy meat and take it to her customers. She knows that her work routine is tiring, but she enjoys doing it and she thinks that she'll continue in this line of work while she has the strength to do it. This is her first loan from MFP, and she is very happy to have a friendly space where she can grow personally and financially. The money that Olga is asking for will be invested in the purchase of more meat in order to meet her customers' orders.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina E., 55, is from the village of Katipa where she is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Marcelina owns and operates a business whose main source of income comes from manufacturing and selling bamboo products to local businesses and community members. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Marcelina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC, she is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used as working capital and to purchase additional inventory. This loan will be Marcelina's twelfth from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to have working capital.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana N. is forty-eight years old, married, and has given birth to seven children: four sons and three daughters. All are currently in school – senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband is a farmer.

Susana is a trader and trades in cereals – maize. She has been in business for ten years and supplies to other retailers and food vendors. She buys her goods from nearby communities and wants a loan to buy bags of maize in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize in bulk

loans.name: Sorohon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Сорохон 37 лет. Она замужем и мать 5-х детей. Занимается перепродажей шерсти и шерстяной пряжи. Её муж пастух. Он пасет свое стадо. Сорохон закупает шерсть у других пастухов и делает пряжу. Сорохон хочет закупить побольше козьей и овечьей шерсти, пока они дешевле. На зимний сезон они подорожают. За этим Сорохон просит займ.
texts.en:
Sorohon is 37 years old. She is married and the mother of five children. She sells wool and yarn. Her husband is a shepherd and tends to his flocks. Sorohon purchases wool from other shepherds and makes yarn. Sorohon wishes to purchase some goat and sheep wool, as they are cheaper now, and their prices go up during the winter. To do so, Sorohon requests a loan.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of wool and yarn

loans.name: Jelina

texts.en:
Jelina A. is from the town of La Libertad. She is 57 years old. Jelina is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Jelina owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling soft drinks, beer, and wine in the local community. Jelina has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jelina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jelina is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jelina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana P., from the village of Libertad, Aurora, Zamboanga del sur, is a 52-year-old married mother of six adult-aged children. To make a living, Juana owns and operates a specialized retail store whose main source of income comes from selling gasoline in the local community. Juana has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2007, she joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC that was used to expand the business, Juana is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fifth from GDMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Sipaepae

texts.en:
Sipaepae V. is a 72-year-old married woman with nine adult-aged children. She lives in Siumu where she raises crops, primarily breadfruit. She derives approximately 800 tala WST a month from planting, harvesting, then selling her crops. Sipaepae has been engaged in this business for over seven years.

In 2004, Sipaepae joined SPBD to gain access to its financial services. Sipaepae successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 tala WST from SPBD that was used to purchase harvesting equipment (this will be her sixth loan from SPBD). Sipaepae is now requesting a loan of 1000 tala WST, which she will use to buy fertilizers such as manure. Sipaepae plans to use all business profits to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's lending philosophy is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en: Hadjah is a 48 year married with 7 children aged between 6 and 17 years.All her children go to school. Hadjah resides and owns a two roomed house where she staying with nine people. There is electricity and no piped water at home. Hadjah takes care of additional family members  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala and works seven days a week.  She receives 20 customers a day. Hadjah owns a retail shop selling home products goods and other soft drinks in Makerere and sells to all categories of people.  She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping.  The major challenges she faces in her business are transportation and medication and feeding the family. Hadjah has been with MCDT for 8 years servicing her sixteenth loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more crates of soda soap salt sugar and other merchandise Hadjah is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning a permanent business structure and also build a house from the available profits

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her reatil shop

loans.name: Thear

texts.en: Mrs. Thear P. lives in Ro Lous village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Nak Khom, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. In this plantation, he faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to buy fertilizer, for plowing, and to hire laborers to work on the rice field.
