Thus, Mrs. Thear P. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She is 41 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is attending the local school and the others are farmers. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, for plowing, and to hire laborers to work on the rice field.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
La señora  ROSA MARIA R. E., tiene 38 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal ESFUERZO DE MUJERES II . Ella   presenta estudios  hasta 5to de secundaria,  es  casada tiene 3  hijos pequeños quienes  depende económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de alimentos, tiene una pequeña bodega instalada en su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compró productos alimenticios como: leche, gaseosa, cerveza, verduras, etc.
Con este crédito de 500 nuevos soles comprará gaseosas, verduras, leche, arroz ,fideo, golosinas, etc para surtir su bodega. Rosa sueña con ampliar su negocio y así poder obtener más ganancias para los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
ROSA MARIA is 38 years old, lives in the Trujillo district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú and is a member of the ESFUERZO DE MUJERES II communal bank. She finished 11th grade, is married and has 3 small children who depend upon her financially. She buys and sell foodstuffs and has a small grocery store which she runs from her own home. With her first 300 sol loan she bought food items like: milk, soft drinks, beer, vegetables. etc. With this new 500 sol loan she will buy soft drinks, vegetables, milk, rice, pasta, snacks, etc. to stock her store. Rosa dreams with enlarging her store so that she can make better profits to pay for household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, vegetables, milk, rice, pasta, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee M. is 51 years old, married with two children ages 19 and 21. Immaculee lives with her family in Ngoma district, Kibungo province of Rwanda which is 2 hours from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Immaculee has 13 years of experience in her business selling beverages and other grocery-type items such as Fanta, milk, snacks, and breads. Her shop is open every day from 6 AM to 9PM and employs two people who work as helpers to keep her business running well.

Immaculee is applying for this loan to help grow her business by purchasing additional inventory and supplies which she believes her current customers will want and which will also attract new customers to her store. If successful, this strategy will allow her to earn more profit, which will allow her to grow her business and save money for herself and her family.

loans.use: purchase milk, Fanta, bread and other inventory/supplies

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Lucia Z. le está haciendo falta terminar un cuarto, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material ya que su esposo se encargar de realizar la mejora en horario adicional a su trabajo. 
Solicita el préstamo para poder terminar la recamara que será para sus tres hijos ya que están creciendo y necesitan su propio espacio en la casa. 
Doña Lucia tiene ya más de tres años de dedicándose a su negocio la venta de abarrotes 
con las ganancias del  negocio planea pagar el préstamo, ya que su esposo el señor José Concepción Ramírez se encargara de los gastos familiares, con su sueldo que obtiene como empleado de una fabrica en el departamento de producción.
texts.en:
A room in Lucia Z.’s house needs to be finished. At this time she does not have the money that is needed to be able to buy the material. Her husband will be responsible for making the improvement by working extra hours. She is asking for the loan to be able to finish a bedroom, which her three children will use. Now that they are growing, they need their own space in the house. Lucia has been in the business of selling groceries for over three years. She plans to repay the loan with earnings from this business. Her husband, José Conceptión Ramírez, pays for the family expenses with the salary he gets as an employee in the production department of a factory.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish a room

loans.name: Katia

texts.es:
Katia tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de ocho años tiene una bodega en su casa en la cual ofrece productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes a sus clientes. Este negocio constituye una importante ayuda para solventar los gastos familiares.

El negocio ha dido creciendo con el tiempo y goza de buena aceptación por parte de sus clientes debido a la calidad del trato que brinda. Katia se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de abarrotes para surtir y ampliar su bodega.

Ella es una madre responsable que siempre trabaja por el bienestar de su familia. Su más grande anhelo es ver a sus dos hijos convertidos en profesionales. Este es su segundo crédito con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus cuotas por lo que es considerada una cliente excelente.
texts.en:
Katia is 39 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two children in the district of Cayaltí, which is located one hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than eight years, Katia has managed a store in her home where she offers basic necessities and groceries to her customers. This business is important in helping her meet her family’s expenses.

Her business has grown over time and is widely accepted by her customers because of the quality service provided. Katia has come to Edpyme Alternativa to request a loan of 1000 soles to purchase groceries to restock and expand her store.

She is a responsible mother who always works for the welfare of her family. Her greatest desire is to see her two children become professionals. This is her second loan with Edpyme Alternativa. She has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with her payments and is therefore considered an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries to expand her business

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La señora MARIA ISABEL tiene 47 años, vive en el distrito D. LAREDO, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal LAREDO. La socia presenta estudios hasta 6to D. primaria , es conviviente  y tiene 3 hijos D. los cuales 2 dependen económicamente D. ella. La socia se dedica a la  venta D. cosméticos. Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo comprar cosméticos como: cremas, labiales, colonias, perfumes, shampoo, delineadores, etc. 
Con este crédito D. 2,500.00 nuevos soles comprará más cosméticos como: labiales, talcos, gel, cremas, polvos, colonias, perfumes, etc . Ella sueña con tener su restaurante y así poder generar mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel is 47 and lives in the Laredo District, Trujillo Province, Department of Libertad, Perú. She is a member of the Laredo Village Bank, and is educated through the sixth year of primary school. She has a common law husband and three children, two of whom are dependent on her. She earns her living selling cosmetics. With her first loan, for 300 soles, she was able to buy cosmetics, including creams, lipsticks, colognes, perfumes, shampoo, eyeliners, etc. She plans to use this loan for 2,500 soles, to buy more cosmetics, like lipsticks, talcum powder, hair gels, creams, powders, colognes, perfumes, etc. Maria Isabel dreams of having her own restaurant so she can generate greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lipsticks, talcum powder, hair gels, creams, powders, colognes, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Bertha Janet

texts.es:
La señora Bertha es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Estrellas Solitarias” desde hace 3 años, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 28 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos, ambos menores de edad. Ella estudió superior (incompleta), se dedica a la compra y venta de carne.

Bertha nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar carne de cordero, alpaca, res y chancho.

Su sueño para el futuro es trabajar mejor y hacer crecer su negocio.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son reuniones con las socias con las que puede bromear y así puede distraerse.
texts.en:
Bertha, 28, has been a member of the "Las Estrellas Solitarias" communal bank for 3 years. She lives in Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She lives with her life partner and has two, minor children. She did not finish college and she is a meat retailer. She tells us that she used her first, 300 new sol, loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement to increase her working capital. She now will ask for 3000 new soles to buy lamb, alpaca, beef, and pork. Her dream for the future is to work better and help her business grow. What she likes best about her communal bank is the get-togethers with her fellow members where she can joke around and entertain herself.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beef, alpaca, lamb, and pork.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo, el señor Juan José A. se dedica a su actividad de venta de frutas y verduras ofrecidas por él mismo en su propio local donde a diario inicia sus ventas desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta el atardecer.

Atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en la compra de las frutas y verduras para continuar laborando y para ello solicita un crédito para adquirir de inmediato dichos perecederos. Entre los que vende se encuentran papas, cebollas, zanahorias, tomates, chayotes, yuca, entre otros.
texts.en:
In the market of Mayoreo, Mr. Juan José A. has a business selling fruits and vegetables. Selling is done by him personally at his own stall, where daily he begins selling early in the morning and works until sunset. He is experiencing the need to invest in the purchase of fruits and vegetables to continue working, and for this, he is asking for a loan to purchase the said perishable items right away. Among those which he sells are potatoes, onions, carrots, tomatoes, chayotes (in the squash family), and yucca, among others.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Kurten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Domingo Javier

texts.es:
Domingo E. Bermúdez, Labora como Vigilante en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua.
 El tiene dos hijos a su cargo, y estos se  encuentran en  edad escolar, esta casado, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante un año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena y piedra  para la  construcción de tres pilares de concreto para  su casa y 5 pliegos de zinc, para el techo de su casa de habitación.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Domingo E. Bermúdez works as a security guard for the National Autonomous University of Nicaragua. He is married and has 2 children in his care; they are both school-aged. He has worked with CEPRODEL for a year. Thanks a previous loan granted by CEPRODEL he was able to improve the house that he lives in. He is an excellent client. The loan he requests now will be used to buy construction materials such as cement, sand and stone to build three pillars of concrete for his house, and 5 sheets of corrugated metal for the roof of his home. His aim is to provide better security and a better quality of life for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: home improvement

loans.name: Oneyda De Jesús

texts.es:
En el municipio El Sauce en León, la señora Oneyda E. se dedica con gran esfuerzo a la venta de cosméticos tales como perfumes, cremas, colonias, shampoo, desodorante, entre otros. También ella vende ropa en menores cantidades.
Solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los cosméticos para damas, caballeros y niños y también para la compra de la ropa con el único propósito de continuar comercializándolo y de esta forma percibir los ingresos para el mantenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Oneyda E., with great care and dedication, sells cosmetics in El Sauce, León. She sells such items as: perfume, creams, colognes, shampoo, deodorant, among others. She also sells clothing in smaller quantities. She is asking for a loan to buy cosmetics for women, men and children. She wants to buy clothing also with the sole purpose of selling it in order to earn income to support her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothing in bulk to sell to her customers

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is a 32-year-old man who is married and lives in Rafah city in Gaza Strip. Salam is a National Palestinian Authority employee and owns a computer selling and maintenance store which is considered to be his main source of income.

Salam requested a loan from FATEN to purchase more computers which will increase his number of customers, whether for buying or coming back for maintenance. Islam has a good number of customers and covers a large area of his city.

Salam is the one behind the desk in the picture above.

loans.use: Purchasing more computers

loans.name: Patricia Beatriz

texts.es:
Patricia es una madre de familia de 38 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su hija en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, considerado el distrito más poblado de la región, pero también el que tiene más altos índices de pobreza, la mayoría de su población se encuentra agrupada en zonas urbano – marginales, es aledaño a la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace muchos años a la venta de comida en su domicilio, ella ofrece diariamente menú y cebiche (plato típico del país hecho a base de pescado fresco) a los mecánicos que trabajan por la zona y a los mototaxistas que frecuentan el lugar. Este negocio le provee de ingresos necesarios para ayudar en el mantenimiento de su hogar, ya que los ingresos que percibe su esposo como trabajador de un pequeño hotel no bastan para salir adelante.

Hace dos años Patricia y su esposo adquirieron una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) con unos ahorros que habían estado reuniendo, con este vehículo se vienen generando algunos ingresos adicionales, el vehículo es manejado por un chofer particular y brinda servicios dentro del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz y la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El continuo uso brindado a la unidad movil ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para que pueda funcionar correctamente. Por ello Patricia se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la reparación y mantenimiento de su vehículo así como en la renovación de las licencias necesarias que permitan brindar su servicio dentro de la legalidad correspondiente.

Patricia es una mujer emprendedora y una madre muy entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a su hija una mejor calidad de vida. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos. En la imagen aparece en su vehículo junto al chofer encargado de manejarlo.
texts.en:
Patricia is a 38 year old mother who lives with her husband and daughter in the José Leonardo Ortiz district. It is considered the most populated district in the region and it also has one of the highest indices of poverty. The majority of the population is in urban areas and is marginalized; she lives next to the city of Chiclayo.

Patricia has sold food in her home for many years, she has a menu and cebiche (typical dish made from fresh fish) sold to mechanics that work in the area and to the mototaxistas who frequent the place. This business gives her the necessary income to help the household since the income that her husband receives as a worker in a small hotel is not enough to get ahead.

Two years ago, Patricia and her husband got a mototaxi (a motorized vehicle used to transport cargo and passengers) with some savings that they collected. They have gotten some extra income from this vehicle. It is driven by a hired driver and the mototaxi runs in the José Leonardo Ortiz district and in the city of Chiclayo.

The continual use of the vehicle has meant that it has had some problems and it is important to repair it so that it can work properly. Patricia is asking for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva’s field partner) that she will use to repair and maintain and to renew the necessary licenses to operate the mototaxi legally.

Patricia is a very enterprising woman and a very dedicated mother. Her biggest with is to give her daughter a better quality of life. She has worked with our institution before and has shown to be punctual and responsible when making her payments. In the picture she is shown with her mototaxi and the driver in charge of driving it.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair, maintain, and renew the operational licenses of a mototaxi.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is married to a driver and they have three children. Only one of her children is at the university. Deborah owns the house where the family resides and she takes care of additional family members. Deborah stays in Makerere and moves door-to-door selling second hand clothes. She has been doing this business for quite a long time. Besides this clothing business, she also works as a health worker with MAWDA (Makerere Women Development Association) and works six days a week. She pays for transportation from town to her home. She buys from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda. The family has access to electricity and piped water and her monthly expenses include feeding the family, medication and school fees.   She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second hand clothes. Deborah aspires to see her business grow big and to build a house on the plot of land she bought with previous loans. She joined MCDT because it was charging low interest compared to other MFIs in the region.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Malani

texts.en:
Malani is a 49-year-old married woman living in the Telijjawila area of Matara, Sri Lanka. She has two sons and two daughters. Malani sells vegetables from home.

Malani’s husband makes a living selling firewood and she helps him with the business. She has requested a 20,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help with her husband's business.

Thank you for taking the time to consider this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy firewood for her husband's business

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en: Ruben J. is from the town of Banga. He is 47 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Ruben owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over fifteen years already. In 2009, Ruben joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Ruben is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, and other farm inputs. This loan will be his second from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Mirian Luzmila

texts.es:
Mirian Luzmila P. P. tiene 18 años, y vive con sus padres en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

Mirian es una socia de de la ventanilla rural Mushuc Yuyai (Nuevo Pensamiento), que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda.  Son 12 socios en total, jóvenes, que están estudiando y trabajando en la agricultura al mismo tiempo.

Mirian trabaja desde pequeña en la agricultura y pecuaria, cultivando papas y habas, y cuidando ganado. Hace las compras y ventas de sus productos en Guaranda.

Solicita el préstamo para mejorar su situación económica, comprando semillas. Sus sueños es cumplir con las actividades que realiza en el campo, seguir con sus estudios adelante, y realizar su propia empresa con más crédito. 

Le gusta escuchar música y la costumbre del carnaval que se celebra con toda la familia. Su familia es unida y siempre trabajan para mejorar su actividad económica
texts.en:
Mirian Luzmila P. P. is 18 years old and lives with her parents in the district of Guaranda in the province of Bolivar.

Mirian is a partner of the rural "ventanilla Mushuc Yuyai (New Thinking), located half-an-hour from Guaranda. There are a total of 12 young partners who are studying and working in farming at the same time.

Mirian has worked since very young in farming and livestock, planting potatoes and broad beans as well as taking care of livestock. She buys and sells her products in Guaranda.

He requests the loan to improve his economic situation buying seeds. It is her dream to carry out the activities in the field, continue her studies, and set up her own business with more loans.

She likes to listen to music and the tradition of the carnival which she enjoys with the entire family. Her family is united and always works to improve their economic activity.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds

loans.name: G.s. Chavarria Group

texts.es: La Señora Paula C. y Juana del Carmen pertenecen al grupo solidario Chavarría, ella siempre están buscando la forma de mejorar sus ingresos, pues saben que los financiamientos le han brindado ayuda en sus negocios. La Señora Juana del Carmen tiene 45 años es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos y se dedica a una pulpería tiene más de 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad, en el caso de Paula Emilia tiene 54 años, su actividad es una pulpería y venta de mercadería en general, pues siempre está en aumentar su inventario fue así que se unió a su amiga. El financiamiento que solicitan es para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
Ms. Paula C. and Juana del Carmen are members of the Chavarría solidarity group. They are always looking for a way to improve their income, knowing that these microloans have helped their businesses. Ms. Juana del Carmen is a 45-year-old single mother with 2 children. She has been running a general store for over 7 years. As for Paula Emilia, she is 54 years old and runs a general store. Since she is all about increasing her inventory, she joined her friend. The loan that they are requesting will be used to purchase raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine P. is from the city of Rizal Santiago. She is 40 years old. Josephine is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Josephine has been in business for more than two years and earns approximately 1,300 PHP a month.

In 2010, Josephine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Josephine from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Beugueu Diam Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BEUGUEU JAM  est créé depuis plus de 08 ans. Il est composé de 08 femmes issues du même village. Elles ont formé leur groupe par affinité et par voisinage. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de SANGHE DOUKA.

Madame Adama P. deuxième à partir de la droite de la photo (mise en médaillon) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 52 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. 

Elle vend des céréales locales (mil et maïs) elle vend également des arachides. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans.

Avec son crédit elle va augmenter son niveau d’approvisionnement en marchandises pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et générer plus de bénéfices. 

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge financière de la famille
texts.en:
The solidarity group BEUGUEU JAM was formed more than 8 years ago. It is composed of 8 women from the same village. They formed their group by neighborhood and kinship. The group is affiliated with the SANGHE DOUKA village bank. Mrs. Adama P., second on the right in the photo (seen in the medaillon), is the leader of the group. She is 52 years old, married and the mother of 5 children. She sells local grains (millet and corn) and also sells peanuts. She has operated this business for more than 10 years. With her loan she is going to increase her stock of merchandise so that she can better satisfy her customers and generate more profit. Her goal is to help her husband provide for the family’s financial needs.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy local grains

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat has been operating his mixed farm in Nkubu town, Eastern Kenya for the last 7 years. He has employed two people from his community on a temporary basis. His farm produces bananas and milk which he sells to middlemen. He mainly depends on the income from his farming activities to cater for the basic needs of his family.

Josphat has requested this loan of 45,000 Kenyan Shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase pipes for irrigation. He says that this loan will increase the productivity of his farm and this means increased income to help in educating his children. His major challenges have been insufficient water supply and inadequate land to expand his farming.

Josphat is 44 years old. He is married and has 4 children whose ages are between 9 and 18. All the children attend school.

He plans to buy another plot of land in the future to increase his productivity and income. He comments that Juhudi Kilimo staff are friendly and the products are farmer friendly.

loans.use: To purchase pipes for irrigation

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: Marcela, D. 60 años, es una madre muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Fortunato D. 64 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad D. vida. Trabajando arduamente Marcela ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos, todas las mañanas se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus cultivos D. papa, espinaca y arveja, productos que llevará a comercializarlas en la ciudad D. Tarma, ya que es ahí donD. obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es que pueD. disfrutar D. la libertad D. laborar en sus campos, lleva 37 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra. Con el tiempo, espera poder adecuar la mayoría D. sus tierras para el sembrado D. arveja, ya que por estas fechas es lo que mejor se venD.. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que este préstamo le ayudará bastante en el progreso y desarrollo D. su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar la calidad D. sus tierras.
texts.en:
Marcela is 60 years old. She is a very loving mother and a hard working woman. She lives in her own house together with her husband Fortunato, 64 years old, and their 3 beloved children. She hopes to proviD. them all with a better quality of life. Working arduously Marcela has managed her plantations. Every morning she starts her work very early, providing the needed care to her fields of potatoes, spinach, and peas. She takes her products to sell in the city of Tarma, location where she gets the best prices. Her favorite part of her work is the freedom she enjoys when she works in her fields. She has 37 years' experience in the business. The most difficult part of her work is preparing the fields for seeding. In time she hopes to prepare most of her fields to cultivate peas, during this time of year it is the harvest that sells the best. This is her first loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She sees this loan as a great help in the advancement and development of her business. She is committed to the responsibilities of the loan. In the community bank she is known as a very responsible and much liked member. The one thousand nuevos soles requested will be invested in the purchase of fertilizers to improve the quality of her fields.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace A. is from the village of Poblacion, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 26 years old. Mary Grace is married and has an infant child. To make a living, Mary Grace sells personal products such as glasses, toys, silver-plated jewelries and watches in the local community. Mary Grace has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Mary Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Grace is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Mary Grace from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Verónica Yasmina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Cristo Rey, esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora Verónica tiene 39 años de edad,  mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha procreado tres hijos, dos de ellos mayores de edad y una linda jovencita de 14 años que aun estudia en el colegio,  su marido es agricultor.
 
Ella y su esposo se dedican a la agricultura tienen sembríos de maíz y maní así como también habas y habichuelas las cuales las venden en su casa o las entregan a comerciantes de la zona, el maíz lo venden una  parte en choclos (maíz tierno) a comerciantes que lo compran en su sembrío, los cuales los llevan a los mercados de la capital manabita. Trabaja en su sembrío de lunes a viernes desde las 6h30 hasta las 13h00 y los sábados y domingos se dedican  a la venta de pescado ya que como dice la vida esta muy dura y hay que ayudarse con algo más  para salir adelante.
 
Este crédito es para comprar insumos agrícolas, abonos y fertilizantes para tener una mejor producción. Está en el Banco Comunal hace dos años y le gusta porque no hay que hacer tantos trámites para conseguir los créditos.
 
Su sueño es que su hija termine sus estudios y tenga un titulo profesional.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, every fifteen days the Cristo Rey Communal Bank meets, this place is known for its traditions and for being a few minutes away from the two best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Mrs. Verónica is 39 years old, she has a common law marriage where she has had 3 children, two are grown up and she has a lovely 14 year old daughter who is attending high school, Verónica’s husband is in agriculture.

Verónica and her husband work in agriculture and they have corn and peanut crops as well as haba beans and kidney beans which they sell in their home or to merchants in the area. The corn they sell in part as choclos (tender corn) to merchants that buy it in their land and who then sell it to markets in the capital Manabita. Verónica works in the fields Monday through Friday from 6:30 a.m. to 1 p.m. and Saturdays and Sundays they work selling fish since life is tough and they have to help themselves with other modes of income to get ahead in life.

This loan is to buy agricultural supplies, manure and fertilizers to have better crop production. Verónica has been in the communal bank for two years and she enjoys it because she doesn’t have to go through so many procedures to get loans.

Verónica’s dream is that her daughter finishes her studies and has her degree.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies, manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Korng

texts.en: Korng L., 58, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. L. is a housewife while her husband is a traditional doctor, earning an income of USD 12 per day. L. has to spend USD 88 on food, USD 15 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 10 on other necessary expenses every month.  L. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a cow to help plow the rice field. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.

loans.use: Buy a cow to help plow the rice field

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion A. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Sutay, Brgy. Antipolo, Pontevedra, Negros Occidental.  She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a general store, as an Avon dealer and a land rental business.  Her husband Leonilo, who is 37 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps with his wife's business activities.  They have one child who is seven years old. 

Salvacion joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Salvacion has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 17,000, thus uplifting her family's standard of living.  This time, for her fifth cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000 which she intends to use to buy products for her sari-sari (general) store so that she could continue to save up for future improvements of her business. 

Salvacion A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Segundo

texts.en:
Segundo is thirty-eight years old.  He lives in the village of Cruz del Mediano in the district of Morrope.  It is a rural district in northern Peru, which is primarily populated by small farmers and individuals who raise animals.  Segundo owns the home in which his family lives.  He lives along with his wife and their three dependent children.

Segundo and his family raise animals in the yard behind their home.  They raise pigs, chickens, ducks and turkeys.  Once these animals reach the appropriate size, they sell them in the major market of the city of Chiclayo called the Moshoqueque market.  They generally visit the market every fifteen days in order to maintain a consistent level of income and reduce the risk of price fluctuations.  Additionally, Segundo works as a hired hand on local farms.  He completes planting, maintenance and harvesting of various crops.

The loan will be used to purchase additional feed for the animals and to expand the herd.  The family has found that the business has the opportunity for growth and they hope to be able to take advantage of the holiday season price increases for their sales.  They are a proud and dedicated family.  Segundo is well known as a hardworking individual who is very dedicated to the improvement of his family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed for the animals and to expand the herd.

loans.name: Leyda Luz

texts.es:
La señora Leyda es socia del banco comunal Las Almendras, del departamento de Ucayali, tiene 39 años y su esposo se desempeña como docente (profesor), lleva 2 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos.

Con su primer préstamo inició su negocio de productos naturales para poder ayudar con los gastos a su esposo y así ahorrar un poco de dinero, los productos los trae de la ciudad de lima y los compra por docena.

Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará 2 docenas de  frascos de chanca piedra, 1 docena de Potes de maca, 1 docena de Frascos de sangre de grado, 1 docena de Frascos de chanca piedra y 1 docena de frascos de vitaminas.

Leyda está agradecida con Manuela Ramos, gracias a los préstamos muchas mujeres pueden crecer en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Ms. Leyda is a member of the Las Almendras ["The Almonds"] communal bank, in the department of Ucayali.  She is 39 years old and her husband works as a teacher.  She has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for two years.

She used her first loan to start her business selling natural products so that she could help her husband with expenses and save a little money.  She brings her products from the city of Lima, where she buys them by the dozen.

She will use this new loan of S/. 1,500 nuevos soles to buy two dozen bottles of chanca piedra, a dozen jars of maca, a dozen bottles of sangre de grado, a dozen bottles of chanca piedra [all natural remedies], and a dozen bottles of vitamins.

Leyda is grateful to Manuela Ramos because thanks to the organization's loans, many women are able to grow their businesses.

loans.use: To buy several dozen bottles of various natural remedies and vitamins

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
This is Jasmin S., 28.  She is a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Arvin S., a system analyst.  Together they have two children, both of whom are enrolled in elementary school.  They also help her in managing the household and with the business. By the grace of God, Jasmin has managed to support her children's schooling.  She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jasmin operates an alkaline water station. She retails drinking water to her immediate community.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales everyday.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000. She will use the loan to maintain her facilities and to pay the bills for the business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Jasmin dreams to be able to renovate her house soon, with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To maintain facilities and pay business bills

loans.name: Pok's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of twenty-three members, they are located in Ta Reab Doun Sa village in Kandal province. This village selected, Mrs. Pok S., 40 years old, as the village bank president. Each member of this village will use their portions of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Pok S. is a farmer who rents some of her land to grow different vegetables for a living. She also earns her living by selling banana. Her husband, Mr. Dorn Narith, 41 years old, and he is a teacher. With their carrier, they still earn less income to support the family. In order to increase income to improve the family’s condition, Mrs. Pok S. wants to conduct a new business. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fish for breeding. 

This couple has five children who are the students and who also help their mother's businesses.

loans.use: To buy fish for breeding.

loans.name: Julieto

texts.en:
Julieto is from the village of Bonifacio Extension, Aguada, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. He is 31 years old. Julieto is single. To make a living, Julieto owns and operates a business making homemade cookies. Julieto has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In December 2010, Julieto joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieto is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase ingredients to make cookies. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions for his family.

 About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for cookies business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana vive en la histórica ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, Perú. En la ciudad del Cusco las personas se dedican a diferentes tipos de negocios y a brindar servicios. Juana se dedica a confeccionar prendas de vestir y tiene un pequeño taller donde realiza sus actividades. Juana requiere el préstamo para comprar más telas, hilos, botones y muchas cosas más. El sueño de la socia abrir otra tienda donde tenga maquinas de coses industriales.    
    
Juana pertenece al banco comunal “Hijas de María” de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Juana lives in the historic city of Cusco, Cusco Department, Perú.  In the city of Cusco, people make their livings with different types of businesses and services.  Juana makes her living making clothing, and she has a small workshop in which to create the garments.  Juana needs the loan to purchase more fabric, thread, buttons and many other things.  Her dream is to open another store where she would have industrial sewing machines.  
    
Juana belongs to the "Hijas de María” (Maria's Daughters) communal bank, a part of the Arariwa Association, Cusco, Perú. The communal bank is in its third year, and it has been going very well for all of the members.

loans.use: To purchase more fabric, thread, buttons and many other things.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 46 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 hijos, a quienes mantiene sola, ya que lleva bastante tiempo separada de su esposo. Con mucho esfuerzo, Carmen logró levantarse de la caída de su tienda de Maletas, la cual no pudo administrar por estar enferma. Ahora viendo el mercado de la ciudad de Tarma, decidió alquilar un local y instalar el servicio de locutorio, y en el que ahora son muchos los que concurren su negocio, resultándole muy rentable y beneficioso.  Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es atender a sus clientes y eso siempre les enseña a sus hijos, quienes cuando ella no esta atienden el locutorio. Lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y espera que su negocio crezca y le pueda brindar mejores ingresos económicos. Este es el onceavo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas a tiempo y esta dispuesta a hacerlo, ya que no quiere perjudicar a su banco comunal, en donde es muy querida, por la solidaridad que demuestra. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará una nueva cabina, para poder atender a más clientes a la vez.
texts.en:
Carmen, 46, is a very hardworking woman.  She lives in her own house with her three children, whom she supports on her own because she has been separated from her husband for a long time.

Carmen was able to come back from the failure of her suitcase store, which she could not run because she was ill.  Seeing the market in the city of Tarma, she decided to rent a store and install phone booth service there.  Many people now come to her business, which makes it very profitable and beneficial to her.  What she likes most about her work is helping her customers, and this is what she teaches her children, who run the phone booth service when she is not there.  She has been doing this for two years and hopes that her business will grow and give her a better income.

This is Carmen's eleventh loan with MFP.  She knows she must make her payments on time, and she is ready to do so because she does not want to hurt her communal bank, where she is well-loved for the comradeship she shows.  With the thousand new soles she asked for, she will buy a new booth so she can serve more customers at the same time.

loans.use: Purchase a new booth to offer phone service

loans.name: Ayde Marisol

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” KANTU DE SAN JERONIMO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ayde Marisol; la socia tiene 41 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche también vende otro tipo de productos como golosinas, aceite entre otros, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de productos para su negocio y así tener más variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ayde Marisol is a member of the "KANTU DE SAN JERONIMO” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province, in Cusco department.

Ayde Marisol is 41 years old, lives with her partner, and has 1 child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store business.  She sells essentials such as rice, sugar and milk.  She also sells other products such as candy, oil, etc.  She is a very cheerful person who has a great desire to get ahead in life.

Ayde Marisol is requesting this loan to buy products for her business, so that she will have a greater variety of products to offer her customers.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy products for her business, so that she will have a greater variety of products to offer her customers

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane J. is 36 years old.  She is married to Samuel Kipngetich, a tailor, and they have four children aged 16, 13, 11 and 6 years old.  Jane buys and resells milk in the Kabirsang trading center. She has been in this business for 6 years and earns a monthly income of Kshs 6,500. Besides selling milk she also sells maize from her crop farming.

This will be her second loan from KADET LTD. She successfully repaid her previous loan of Kshs 25,000.  She intends to use the new loan to pay the farmers for the milk that she sells. The anticipated profits will be used to improve the welfare of her family.

She hopes to educate her children to higher levels.

loans.use: to buy milk for resale

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is a married woman with two children. She is 36 years old and has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for one year.

Shirley sells items like coffee and toothpaste to the people in her community. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods and sugar.

In the future, Shirley hopes to have a bigger store. She also wants her children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase items like canned goods and sugar

loans.name: Llamocctachi Group

texts.en:
The rural communal bank, Llamocctachi, is currently starting its 25th loan cycle at FINCA Peru. The nineteen members of the bank all live in the rural area outsiD. of Ayacucho and are involved in agriculture and grocery-selling businesses. Antonia is the president of this communal bank and has an alfalfa-growing business. She has two children, aged 15 and 12, who are both studying. 

She will be using her loan of 1,000 PEN to purchase alfalfa seed, fix up her land (she says that the heavy rains during the rainy season have left it quite a mess) and plant the seeds. After four months, she will harvest the alfalfa and travel to the main market in Ayacucho to sell it. Antonia has been a member of FINCA Peru for eight years now.

loans.use: to purchase alfalfa seed

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La señora Bertha del socorro García es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 35 años. Ella inicio hace ocho años con el alquiler de teléfonos con las ganancias emprendió otros negocios como la venta de cosméticos y granos básicos pero vio que generaba mayor ingreso el comercio de productos telefónicos como cargadores, chit, recargas, carcasa…etc. 
Ella invertirá el crédito en cargadores y carcasas, y su meta principal es adecuar el local, tener más surtido de mercadería y llagar a vender celulares.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bertha del Socorro G. is a hardworking and enterprising woman of 35 years of age. She started her business eight years ago with telephone booths. With her earnings she started up other businesses such as cosmetics sales and sales of basic grains. But she saw that the greatest earning business is the sale of telephone products such as chargers, chips, prepaid cards, cases, etc.

She will invest her loan on chargers and cases. Her principal goal is to supply her store, to have a greater variety of merchandise, and to eventually sell cellular telephones.

loans.use: to purchase cellular phone cases and prepaid cards.

loans.name: Razel

texts.en:
Razel is 36 years old and manages a school canteen business where she sells cooked noodles, biscuits, juice, candies, native cakes and other kinds of snacks. Razel has had this business for six years and she can able to earn about PHP 5,000 monthly. She has three children and they are generally in school-aged. Razel is married to Jerry who is a carpenter.

Razel is grateful because her business is growing but still she wants to improve it because of the high cost of commodities. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP from KIVA lenders and ASKI. She will use the loan to buy additional biscuits, soft drinks, junk foods, breads, candies and noodles.

The couple is aiming to make their school canteen more productive by borrowing additional capital from the lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional biscuits, soft drinks, junk foods, breads, candies and noodles

loans.name: Zafar

texts.ru: Зафар житель города Кургантюбе. Ему 38 лет. Он женат, имеет 4 детей. Образование у него среднее. Он занимается торговлей на рынке. В основном он занимается продажей необходимых вещей для дома и хоз. товаров. В этой области он уже 5 лет. В продвижении бизнеса ему помогает его сын. Он берет кредит для увеличения ассортимента товара и расширения свой деятельности.
texts.en: Zafar lives in Qurgan-Tube. He is 38 years old, married, and has four children. He has a high school education.  He works trading in the market. Basically he sells things necessary for house and home.  He has been doing this work for five years. His son helps him with his business.  He is taking out a loan to increase the variety of goods he sells and to expand his shop.

loans.use: Для увеличения ассортимента товара и расширения своей деятельности

loans.name: Aracely Maria

texts.es: La señora Aracely tiene un negocio de comercialización de artículos para el hogar tales como Colchones, abanicos, licuadoras, ollas , artículos plásticos, artículos de cocina su esposo quien fue el de la iniciativa,  es  quien hace trabaja la venta ambulante y de cobro de la cartera mientras que ella vende en el local, ubicado en una zona muy comercial del municipio de Galapa, donde vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 3 y 9 años. El negocio de Aracely y su esposo, funciona hace 8 años y tiene una buena infraestructura física,  la mayor parte de sus ventas las hace a crédito y los pagos los recibe semanalmente. Sus ventas le permiten cubrir sus costos y los gastos familiares, compra a sus proveedores a 45 días y tiene un buen surtido de mercancías, pero su capital de trabajo está representado principalmente en cartera a largo plazo y necesita financiarla; esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva que es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará sillas, mesas plásticas, electrodomésticos menores etc. En el negocio de Aracely sus razones de liquidez son altas  y conserva  un margen de rentabilidad acorde al tipo de negocio; la consecuencia de que su nueva inyección de capital de trabajo tendrá éxito es su buen posicionamiento en el mercado, además de que Aracely y su esposo poseen  la experiencia   para este logro. Su sueño se proyecta en tener su propia vivienda y lograr con sus esfuerzos que sus hijos logren un futuro próspero apoyándolos en el tema educativo.
texts.en:
Aracely has a business selling household products such as mattresses, fans, blenders, pots, plastic products and kitchen items.  The idea for this business was her husband's and he is the one who makes sales door to door and collects payment for their goods while Aracely makes sales in their business premises which is located in a very commercial area of the town of Galapa.  Aracely lives in Galapa with her husband and their two children who are 3 and 9.

Aracely and her husband have been running their business for eight years and have a good physical infrastructure.  They make most of their sales on credit and collect payment weekly.  Aracely's sales allow her to cover her costs and family expenses.  She buys goods from her suppliers every 45 days and has a good stock of merchandise.  However, her working capital is mainly tied up in her long-term portfolio and she needs to finance her business.  This is why she is requesting a Kiva loan, which will be the first loan that she has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy plastic tables and chairs, small electrical appliances, etc.

Aracely's liquidity ratio is high and she maintains a profitability margin which is in keeping with this type of business.  Her new injection of working capital will be successful because she has a good position in the market.  In addition, Aracely and her husband have the experience they need to achieve their goal.

Aracely's dream is to own her own home and, through her efforts, to ensure a prosperous future for her children by supporting them in their education.

loans.use: to buy plastic tables and chairs and small electrical appliances

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia has operated her fruit shop in Njabini town for the last 4 years. She is 44 years old, married to Mwangi and they have 3 children.

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her fourth loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her shop.

In the future, Patricia hopes to grow her shop to a big grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a widowed woman with six children, all of whom are adults. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past ten years, she has operated a food vending business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of owning a fresh water selling business in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase timber and cement and to pay for a license.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase timber and cement and to pay for a license.

loans.name: Obertila

texts.es:
La señora Obertila es socia del banco comunal Líderes triunfadoras del Distrito Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 51 años D. edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos independientes.  Con su primer préstamo y en sociedad, empezó a trabajar porque el negocio requería D. mayor inversión.. 
En el tiempo que lleva trabajando con Manuela Ramos ha tenido la oportunidad D. hacer distintos negocios, sola o en sociedad, pero ahora se dedica a las confecciones D. prendas D. vestir y lencería. No tiene socio alguno.
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 7 metros D. algodón, 1 rollo D. elástico para pierna, 1 rollo D. elástico para cintura, 4 hilos D. remalle, 2 paños D. aguja para maquina, 1 paño D. aguja para remalladora.
Ahora solo se dedica a la costura y lo hace en su casa, solo tiene que atender a su esposo que es con quien vive y comparte los gastos del hogar, ya sus hijos sonindependientes y sus nietos los visitan los sábados que es cuando se dedica todo el día  a ellos.
texts.en:
Señora Obertila is a member of the community bank "Líderes Triunfadoras " ("Triumphant Leaders"), which is in the Calleria District in the Department of Ucayali.  She is 51 years old, and is married with two independent children.  She took her first loan as part of a partnership because her business required more investment.

In the time she has been working with Manuela Ramos, she has had the opportunity to work in various businesses, alone or in partnership, but now she works making apparel and lingerie.  She does not have any partner in this business.

With her new loan of 3000 New Soles, she will buy 7 meters of cotton, 1 roll of elastic for legs, 1 roll elastic for waists, 4 spools of thread, 2 sleeves of needles for the machine, 1 sleeve of sewing needles.

Now she only works on sewing and does it from home.  She only needs to look after her husband, with whom she lives and shares household expenses.  Their children and grandchildren are independent, and visit them on Saturdays, when she spends all day with them.

loans.use: to buy cotton, elastic, needles, etc.

loans.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
Gulmira, 29, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Tashkomur, a small mining town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Her husband went to work in Russia to make money. Gulmira takes care of two children, both of whom are preschool age (under seven). 

In order to earn additional money the family breeds livestock, fattens it and then resells it at a higher price. At the moment Gulmira's brother helps in running the business. Reselling livestock after fattening they earn an additional 5000 Kyrgyzstani soms per month. 

With money received from the loan Gulmira wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future Gulmira wants to give her children a good education. 

---Where Did This Loan Come From?---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line–People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team-Supporters of Kyrgyzstan–Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Blas Osvaldo

texts.es:
Blas tiene 32 años de edad, está casado con la señora Gloria de 25 años, vive en su casa propia, es vendedor ambulante hace más de diez años y su señora es artesana, fabrica sobrecamas que después son comercializados por su marido.
Blas es muy sacrificado debido a que los días hábiles de semana trabaja como albañil y los fines de semana se va a vender sus productos a la capital y sus alrededores recorriendo varios kilómetros en su moto, realizando las ventas casa por casa. 
Blas empezó como vendedor de un tío suyo por dos años y despues que compró para su moto y con la ayuda de su tío pudo tener su propia microempresa.
Hoy en dia cuenta con clientela formada por su buena atención y por la buena calidad de sus productos
Necesita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías (edredones, sábanas) debido a que ésta es la época en que más salida tienen dichos productos ya que es invierno en esta parte del mundo.
texts.en:
Blas, 32, is married to Gloria, 25. He lives in his own house.  He’s been a street vendor for over  ten years and his wife’s a craftswoman; she makes bedspreads that are then sold by her husband.

Blas is very self-sacrificed because he works all the working days in a week as a bricklayer and then goes to the capital and its environs on weekends to sell his wares covering several kilometers on his motorcycle selling door to door.

Blas started out working for two years as a salesman for his uncle and later bought his motorcycle and with help from his uncle was able to set up his own micro business.  Today, he has a well-established clientele thanks to his good customer service and the good quality of his products.

He needs the loan to buy merchandise (comforters, sheets) because this season is when this type of product sells the most because its winter in this part of the world.

loans.use: to buy comforters and sheets to resell.

loans.name: Rezyl

texts.en:
Rezyl is 25 years old and married. She has three children, ages 6, 4 and 2.

Rezyl is a farmer. She and her husband own a rice farm located in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Rezyl helps grow rice and sell their harvest. She does her best to support her family.

Rezyl has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. In the future, she hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Virgen De Fátima Group

texts.es:
El Comité Virgen de Fátima se conformó con la iniciativa de una de las miembros, está integrado por 10 mujeres, actualmente están en el primer ciclo. Son todas vecinas y amigas de la ciudad de Curuguaty, por tal motivo les gusto el programa de Comité de Mujeres Rurales de la Fundación Paraguaya, como que todas tienen una actividad económica fija decidieron comprometerse entre sí trabajando todas juntas por un bien común. Ellas están aprendiendo a trabajar en equipo, también a ahorrar cosa que nunca antes lo habían hecho.
Una de ellas es la señora Mirian, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas usadas, como ser remeras, camisas pantalones y demás. Comenta que tiene mucha clientela que frecuentemente compra de ella, ya que ella es una persona muy buena a la hora de tratar con los clientes. Una de sus metas es poder tener una tienda propia donde pueda ofrecer sus prendas. Comenta que todo lo que realiza es por darle a su familia todo lo que necesitan.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas como ser camisas, pantalones, remeras y demás para la posterior venta. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, pues de obtener el crédito le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The Virgen de Fátima committee was formed thanks to the initiative of one of its members.  It is made up of 10 women that are currently in their first loan cycle. They are all neighbors and friends from the city of Curuguaty. Because of this, they like the Comité de Mujeres Rurales (Rural Women Committee) program of the Fundación Paraguaya. Since they all have a fixed economic activity, they decided to commit to each other, working together for a common good. They are learning to work together as a team and also to save, which is something that they had never done before. 
One of the members is Mirian. She sells used clothing such as T-shirts, shirts, pants etc. She says that she has many customers that frequently buy from her, since she is very good at dealing with customers. One of her goals is to have her own store from which to sell the clothing. She says that everything she does is in order to provide her family with all that they need.
She is requesting the loan to buy clothing such as shirts, pants, T-shirts etc. to later sell. She is grateful to the Foundation for the opportunity that it gives her; obtaining the loan will be very helpful to her.

loans.use: to buy second-hand shirts, T-shirts and pants to resell.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a married woman with seven children, six of whom attend school while one is too young for school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and water. 

Rachael has operated a retail shop for the past three years, and her clients are the local area customers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, where the demand is high only during the end of the month. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase ten bundles of maize flour. She decided to join Yehu because of easy access of loans.

loans.use: To purchase ten bundles of maize flour.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Antonio y su esposa la señora Maria Elena tienen ya más de seis años dedicándose a la venta de ropa y muebles usados en diferentes partes de la ciudad.
Están solicitando un préstamo para invertir en comprar más mercancía que es (ropa para dama y hombre, muebles, juguetes y accesoria para la cocina) ya que no cuentan con el dinero necesario para invertir en el negocio.
Con las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas del negocio planea pagar el crédito, con el sueldo que recibe de su empleo como chofer de trasporte de personal,  será para los gastos familiares.
Desean que su negocio tenga más mercancía y inversión y poder mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señor Antonio and his wife Señora Maria Elena have been selling used clothing and furniture in different parts of the city for more than 6 years. They are asking for a loan to purchase more merchandise that is: men's and women's clothing, furniture, toys and kitchen accessories as they do not have the money necessary to invest in the business.

With the earnings from the sale of the merchandise they plan to pay off the loan. He will use the salary he receives from his job as a personnel carrier driver to pay for the family expenses.

They want their business to stock more merchandise and have more investment so as to improve the quality of their children's lives.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his clothing business.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es: El Sr. Ramón vive en el municipio de el Torno localidad de Puerto Rico, es casado  su esposa con la cual tiene un hijo, es de ocupación ama de casa, la  actividad del Sr. Ramón es prestar el servicio de albañilería, lleva ya 3 años con esta actividad donde va hasta lugares lejanos para realizar su trabajo,  el destino del crédito es para comprar una motocicleta para trasladarse a las obra en construcción, esto le ayuda al Sr. ya que minimizara los gasto de transporte, es un apersona bien solicitada en las obras de construcción por el buen conocimiento que tiene en el rubro, es muy trabajador y  se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que se le ha brindado.
texts.en: Ramón lives in the Puerto Rico neighborhood in El Torno.  He’s married to his wife and they have a son.  She’s a housewife.  Ramón is a bricklayer; he’s been in this occupation for three years and travels to distant locations offering his services.  The loan will be used to buy a motorcycle to transport himself to construction sites.  This will help him save on transportation costs. He is a well sought-after person on construction jobs because of the good knowledge he has in this line of work.  He’s very hardworking ad feels grateful to the institution for the support it’s provided him.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia  es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”, ubicado en el distrito Juli, provincia de Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 46 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene un hijo.  Cuenta con estudios secundarios.
Sonia recientemente se incorpora a trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, solicita un préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invertirá en su negocio de venta de combustible y gaseosa.
En sus ratos libres realiza bordados en bayeta (tela) y los vende a sus clientes, su esposo trabaja como transportista.
Su deseo es mejorar el negocio, lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the Santa Rosa de Lima communal bank located in Juli district, in the province of Chucuito in Puno department. She is 46 years old, lives with her partner and has a son. She has a secondary school education. 

Sonia recently began to work with Movimiento Manuela Ramos and is requesting a loan of 300 nuevos soles, which she will invest in her business selling fuel and soft drinks.

In her free time she makes embroidered cloths and sells them to her customers. Her husband works as a trucker.

Her wish is to improve her business. What she likes about the communal bank is the ease in obtaining a loan.

loans.use: to buy fuel and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more maize, beans, and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Aita

texts.fr: Madame Aita est une femme  mariée de  34 ans qui vit sur le territoire sénégalais depuis  plusieurs années. Elle s’active dans l’activité de vente d’habits  pour enfants  ou elle capitalise une expérience de 5 ans. C’est une activité qu’elle a choisi par opportunité mais aussi  sous  l’influence de sa mère. Elle est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis mai 2009. Elle sollicite un crédit de 350 000 frs prévu pour achever une construction déjà entamée pour y habiter et se décharger de frais de location. Ce crédit va contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie sociale de Aita.
texts.en: Madame Aita is a 34-year old married woman who has been living in Senegal for several years. She has a business selling childrens' clothes and has gained 5 years experience in this activity. She decided to pursue this activity when an opportunity arose thanks to her mother's encouragement. She has been a member of one of U-IMCEC's branches since May 2009. She is requesting a loan of 350,000 francs so that she can complete the ongoing construction of a building that will become her home so that she no longer has to pay rent. This loan will contribute to the improvement of Aita's social living conditions.

loans.use: to complete the construction of a dwelling

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is divorced. She lives with her grown son in Vodyanoye. 

Valentina owns two big and spacious greenhouses and two smaller ones. She grows vegetables for sale. She has been in this farming business for 12 years. Currently, she has 50,000 UAH invested in this venture. 

She usually spends about 20,000 to 25,000 UAH on seeds and plastic film every year. Valentina is seeking a 20,000 UAH loan to purchase three rolls of polyethylene film, tomato seeds and fertilizers for her greenhouses. 

She is very excited to see her business grow and provide a stable income for her family. Profits generated have helped them make enough savings to purchase a new house. Valentina is hoping to further expand her business and eventually finish all the remodeling in her recently purchased house.

loans.use: to purchase polyethylene film, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 27 years old and lives in San Isidro Bajo, Sinacaban. She is married and has 1 child. For the past year, Grace has operated a store, selling a variety of goods. Grace has requested a loan  of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional goods such as noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. Grace has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.  In the future, she hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods such as noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Guandugloma (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Guandugloma está formado por 7 socias, quienes son mujeres luchadoras que a pesar de las adversidades miran la vida de una manera positiva, con sus trabajos mejoran y ayudan la economía familiar. Viven por la parroquia de Nabon en Cuenca lugar que se encuentra ubicado al sur-este de la provincia del Azuay, es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad, mantienen la gastronomía, cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Elsa, tiene 25 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 9 y 7 años de edad que estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Vive en la casa de su mamá compartiendo los gastos del hogar, la casa de su mamá es propia.

Doña Elsa se dedica al cuidado de su hogar y a la cría y venta de borregos, cuyes, ganado y gallinas, también trabaja en la agricultura en la siembra de hortalizas las que vende en su comunidad.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ganado.
 
Su meta es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
The Guandugloma communal bank consists of 7 members. They are determined women who view life in a positive manner in spite of adversities. With their work, they are contributing to and improving their household economies. They live in the parish of Nabon, in Cuenca, located in the southeast of Azuay province. The climate there is cold, and the inhabitants work in agriculture, raise animals, or in many cases work in the city. They preserve the cuisine, culture and traditions of their indigenous peoples. 

One of the members of this group is Elsa. She is 25 years old and the single mother of 2 children, aged 9 and 7, who attend a small school in the city. She lives in her mother's house, sharing the household expenses. Her mother owns the house. 

Elsa dedicates herself to taking care of her home as well as raising and selling sheep, guinea pigs, chickens and livestock. She also works in agriculture, growing vegetables which she sells in her community. 

This is the first loan she is taking out within her communal bank, to which she was invited by a friend. She will invest the funds from the loan in buying livestock. 

Her goal is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ice cream to sell

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
María tiene 63 años de edad, es casada. Ella es una mujer luchadora, cuenta con 15 años de trabajar en la elaboración de tamales y oficios varios; con el firme propósito de llevar el alimento diario a su hogar. Estas actividades las aprendió de su madre que se ha dedicado a lo mismo toda la vida. Antes de aprender el oficio, ella era estudiante pero decidió mejor  dedicarse a la venta de tamales, vive con su esposo e hijos, en la propiedad de su madre.

A ella le proveen el elote para sus tamales en su casa; pero estos llevan un costo mas alto ya que se los llevan a domicilio, pero en época de invierno ella busca la materia prima en los alrededores por lo cual tiene que desplazarse grandes distancias y acarrearlo ella por sus  propios medios.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para la compra de recipientes, leña e ingredientes para elaborar los tamales, y a la misma vez tener capital de trabajo, porque en el verano el elote aumenta su precio y así mantener su venta y no perder los clientes.
