Al tener capital de trabajo la cliente,  abastecerá siempre a sus clientes y tendrá siempre todo el equipo necesario para la elaboración de los tamales y los ingresos necesarios para poder mantener a su familia.

Ella esta convencida de seguir trabajando fuerte día con día, para que a sus hijos no les falte nada y convertirlos en profesionales.
texts.en:
María, 63, is married and has been working 15 years in the "tamales" business as well as doing other jobs in order to put food on the table every day.  She learned her trade from her mother who is also in the same line of business.  Before learning her trade, María was a student, but then decided to sell tamales.  She lives with her husband and children in a house owned by her mother.

The corn she uses for the tamales is delivered to her home but it is more expensive because of the delivery.  In the winter she goes out to buy raw materirals and must travel long distances and transport the goods home through her own means.

The loan she is requesting through Fundación Campo is to buy containers, firewood and ingredients to make tamales.  She also needs working capital because, in the summer, corn prices go up; so she wants to keep selling her products and not lose customers.  By having working capital she will always have enough supply to sell to customers and be able to support her family.

María is convinced that if she works hard every day and provide everything her family needs, she will able to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: To buy containers, firewood and ingredients to make tamales, and to have working capital.

loans.name: Jurabek

texts.ru: 33 летный мужчина из города Турсунзаде, это Чурабек. Чурабек женат и отец одного ребенка. Жена сидит дома и присматривает за ребенка. В семье только Чурабек зарабатывает на жизнь. Чурабек талантливый человек. Он занимается ремонтом домов. Чурабек днем и ночь работает ради жены и ребенка, чтобы обеспечить им хорошую жилищную условия. Он не сможет копить денег, потому что  его доходы только хватает на жилищные расходы. Чурабек решил отремонтировать свой дом, и хочет взять кредит и за счет кредита приобрести стройматериалы для ремонта дома. Чурабек надеется на Вашу поддержку. Вы можете поддержать его.
texts.en: Jurabek, 33, comes from Tursun-zoda. He is married and has one child. His wife is a stay-at-home mom. Jurabek is the sole breadwinner for his family. Jurabek is a talented person who makes his living by renovating houses. He works day and night to provide his family with good living conditions. He is unable to save money because his income is just enough to cover living expenses. Jurabek is requesting a loan because he decided to renovate his own home and thus would like to buy construction materials. He hopes that you will be able to help him. Please support him.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for home renovation

loans.name: Ngeleno Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Silvia. She is twenty six year old, married and blessed with three children. She is a member of Ngeleno Women Group which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from enterprise development and financial management training.
She is a dairy farmer. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy high quality fodder for her cows. This will increase her milk production and enable her meet the rising demand for milk in her locality hence more income. She will use the anticipated income to cater for basic family needs such as food and clothing.
 She is grateful to kiva and their lenders for the help and support

loans.use: To buy quality fodder and increase milk production hence more income to cater for basic family needs such as food and clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Agnes would like to buy polythene bags, cake wrappers, and sweater threads

loans.name: Bafale

texts.en:
Mrs. E. is married and the mother of five children. She has been in the business of improving charcoal for the the last 12 months. She has been very successful as the business uses new technology and is environmentally-friendly.

Mrs. E. is part of the HELP Africa solidarity group "ARCB", which collectively has applied for a loan of $600. Each member of the group will receive a part of this loan and will be responsible for helping their fellow group members if they are delinquent or default.

loans.use: Improving charcoal quality

loans.name: Aishetu

texts.en: A mother of seven (7) children Mrs. Aishetu A., a trader, lives in Jattu, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells used clothes to the community. She is looking forward to getting this loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Filomena Huanco de Silva has been a member of Pro Mujer for 14 years making her one of the longest-standing members. She used her first loan, 200 Bolivars, to buy vicuña wool. With profits from it's sale, she bought candy to sell in front of a school in El Alto. At this time she owns a grocery store in front of the San Vicente School. With proceeds from the business she supports her husband and four children. At this time she would like to buy a van to use for public transportation, so that she can continue to support her children.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Filomena H. de Silva es una de las socias más antiguas de Pro Mujer, tiene una permanencia de 14 años dentro de la organización. Su primer desembolso fue de 200 Bs. con lo que decide comprar algunos kilos de lana de vicuña para poder realizar la reventa y así generar algunos ingresos. Con las ganancias de la venta de la lana de vicuña, Filomena invierte en la compra de dulces y golosinas, para instalarse frente a un colegio de la zona de El Alto. En la actualidad la señora Filomena es propietaria de un almacén y tienda de abarrotes frente al colegio San Vicente, negocio que le permitió salir adelante junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Ella necesita de inversión de capital para lograr la compra de un minibús, para incursionar en el transporte público, de esta forma mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy a van to be used for public transportation.

loans.name: Chien

texts.en:
Chien and her family live in Lap Phuoc hamlet, in the Tan Lap commune of Ham Thuan Nam district.

Chien's family consists of a total of five members: Chien and her husband, as well as their three children. The youngest daughter is in the 7th grade and the other two work as day laborers. The father had a heart attack so currently does house work.

Chien spends her days selling rice spaghetti on a daily basis. Together, their average income is $10 USD per month/person. They wish to borrow $75 USD to raise a cow so that in can further reproduce. They plan to pay it back over the course of seven months.

loans.use: To raise a cow

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome makes all types of clothes and sells them to a local market . She is married and has three children aged 12,14 and 18 years. Her husband works with Salome in their business. Their income is too low to support the family. Salome is very hard working. She is asking for a loan of US $500 to buy materials and expand their business. She is proposing to repay the loan in 12 months. She thanks you.

loans.use: BUY MATERIALS AND EXPAND BUSINESS

loans.name: Moe

texts.en: Moe T. is a new member of the loan program. She heard about SPBD a long time ago, and she wanted be able to run her own business. Moe sells her pancakes at the school compound and sells only five days of the week. She is now starting with a pancake business and if it goes well then she will add another one as a substitute. Moe’s husband works and this money will help her a lot. She has five children and she is working hard to support them not only physically, but also in schooling.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour, oil, an oven, and other ingredients for making pancakes

loans.name: Andrea De Lourdes

texts.es:
Andrea de Lourdes is a single mother of a little boy of 2 years, which she wants to provide a better future for him, one better than hers. Four years ago, Andrea started to sell used clothing to among her family and neighbours. Later on she started to see an increase in business and decided to add to her shop some jewelery sales, and slowly she has been increasing her clientele, and of consequently increasing her business.

For this Andrea is requesting a credit of US$250 which she is ready to repay in a term of 3 months. With this loan Andrea will be able to purchase more clothing and jewelery and therefore increase her selection and finally earn money to cover her son's expenses. With your help Andrea will be able to support her small family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Andrea de Lourdes es madre soltera de un pequeño de 2 años, al cual desea brindarle un futuro mejor que el de ella. Hace 4 años, Andrea comenzó a vender ropa usada entre sus familiares y vecinos. Posteriormente comenzó a incrementar la competencia y decidió agregarle a su negocio la venta de joyería, poco a poco se ha ido incrementando su clientela, sin embargo la competencia también.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and silver jewelery.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A., 37-years-old, is married with two children. She hails from Lagos State. Mrs.  A. has been in the business of selling drinks since 1990. She is also a fashion designer. Her request for a loan of $450 will give her the funds to purchase a higher inventory of drinks for resale.

loans.use: To purchase a larger inventory of  drinks for resale

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raul lives with his wife and daughter in a long-term leased property on Menédez and Pelayo Street in the Alta Sopocachi zone of the city of La Paz. He works as a mechanic to earn income; his wife has a general store and in this way helps out with family expenses. The loan he is requesting is to buy merchandise for the store so that they can offer a greater variety to their customers.

He does not have any previous record with IMPRO, this is his first loan and we believe that it is worthwhile to help this family improve their income and their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Raul vive con su esposa e hija en anticretico en la calle Menéndez y Pelayo de la zona de Alto Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es la de mecánico con la cual genera sus ingresos, la esposa tiene una tienda de abarrotes y así ayuda a su esposo con los gastos de la familia. El crédito que solicita es para comprar mercadería para la tienda y poder ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.

No tiene antecedente con IMPRO, es su primer crédito y creemos que vale la pena ayudar a esta familia para que mejoren sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of merchandise for a general store

loans.name: Dy

texts.en:
Mrs. Dy Choen and her husband married in 1990. Together, they have six sons; her oldest son is a wooden house constructor. The family lives on an island on Mekong River about twelve kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Dy has been in the business of selling groceries for six years. She buys grocery items from a market in Phnom Penh for resale at her shop in front of the house. Her husband serves as a driver for a transportation company.

Mrs. Dy is requesting a loan in the amount of $500 to purchase a construction crane for her son’s business.

loans.use: To purchase a construction crane for her son.

loans.name: Leydi Teresita

texts.es:
Leydi started her business shortly before separating from her partner and decided to maintain her 3 children selling clothing and footwear, which she had been doing for 10 years to bring up her children successfully. Recently, she had big expenses because one of her daughters enrolled at a university, taking up a lot of her capital. However, her customer base is large and they have requested merchandise, for which she needs this loan to invest and fulfill her customers’ orders as well as close the sale.

She needs a credit for US $250, which she will repay in 3 months, to purchase merchandise. With your contribution, she will continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Leydi, inicio su negocio poco antes de que se separara de su pareja, y decidió mantener a sus 3 hijos vendiendo ropa y zapatos, actividad que ha realizado durante 10 años sacando a sus hijos adelante, últimamente tuvo gastos fuertes por que una de sus hijas ingreso a la universidad y se descapitalizo, pero su clientela es grande y le han solicitado mercancía, por lo que requiere de este crédito para invertir y poder cumplirle a sus clientes, además de asegurar su venta.

Ella necesita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para compra mercancía. Con tu contribución ella seguirá con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to stock her business and fulfill her customers' orders.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. sells clothing. She is married but her husband's income from his job as a pastor is not sufficient for Grace and her five children. Demand for her goods is high and she is looking to expand her business. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business selling clothing.

loans.name: Rak

texts.en:
Mr. Rak S. is a farmer and he sells firewood and coal in Au Krosa Village in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. His wife, Mrs. Sara Vom, helps him with the farming. They have a child who is too young to work or attend school.

Mr. Rak S. does not have equipment to plow his rice field. Thus, he is asking for a loan to buy an "electric cow" to plow his own field as well as plowing other people’s fields in exchange for money. In addition, this motorized item can be used to transport wood and coal, enabling Mr. Rak S. to improve his other business.

Previously, Mr. Rak S. obtained a loan from AMK to buy piglets for breeding. Mr. Rak S. and his wife are both presented in the photo.

loans.use: To buy an "electric cow" to plow his own field other people’s fields

loans.name: Halima S.

texts.en: Halima Ramadhan is a Tanzanian business woman. She runs a shop from which she sells a variety of items including cereal crop products. Items are purchased from Kariakoo city shopping centers and then sold in Buguruni. Her family depends on the business income to meet their daily demands. Her business dream is to one day run a wholesale shop. She is requesting a loan of  $350 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Chamroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chamroeun C., 38, and her husband, Mr. Vuthy Nhem, 38, live in a small village off of National Road Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They were married in 1994 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Two of their children study in the local school and other two are still young and stay at home.

Mrs. Chamroeun and her husband have been selling sugarcane juice and Khmer cakes for over one year. They buy them from Ta Khmao market for resale in the village. Chamroeun is requesting a loan of US$150 to purchase soft drinks for resale at her shop.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Alonso

texts.es: Alonso T. de 29 años de edad, es soltero, trabajador del Hospital Asunción, con 2 años de servicio, habita en casa de su mamá donde hará la mejora de la vivienda que consiste en instalar una extractor de humo para evitar que el humo de la cocina entre en la vivienda, además legalizará un terreno de su propiedad ya que piensa prepararse para el futuro, donde con esfuerzo propio y con la ayuda de los créditos piensa construir su propia vivienda. Está solicitando su segundo crédito el que está dispuesto a cancelar en tiempo y forma, ya que se considera un joven responsable, honesto y cumplidor de los acuerdos que asume. Su sueño es poder terminar de acondicionar la casa de su mamá antes de empezar la propia.
texts.en:
Alonso T. is 29 years old, and a bachelor who has worked at Asunción hospital for two years. He lives at home with his mother, and he would like to make improvements to the house by installing a fan to prevent kitchen smoke from entering the rest of the house. Additionally, he will formalize ownership of some land on which, through his own endeavors and with some loan assistance, he is planning to build his own home in the future. The loan he is currently requesting would be his second. He intends to repay it in full and on time as he considers himself a responsible and honest young man, who fulfills the agreements he makes. His dream is to finish remodeling his mother’s home prior to beginning his own.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of a kitchen smoke ventilator

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El Señor Juan P. tiene 31 años de edad y esta casado con la Señora Antonia Garcete  de 29 años, son padres de un hijo de 5 años.n El cliente se dedica a la fabricación y venta de carbón vegetal, comenzó con un horno de barro y en la actualidad ya cuenta con 10 hornos y produce 20.000 Kg de carbón al mes. Además esta montando una pequeña despensa en su domicilio razón por la cual se acercó a esta institución para solicitar un prestamo, el cual será invertido en la compra de productos de primera necesidad.n Desea un pais con mayores fuentes de trabajo y mayor oportunidad para los jovenes.nnn
texts.en:
Juan P. is 31 years old and married to Antonia Garcete, 29. They are the parents of a 5-year-old son. Juan makes a living making and selling charcoal. He started with a single clay oven and currently accounts for 10 ovens and produces 20,000 kilograms of charcoal a month. Furthermore, he's trying to open a small convenience store in his home, the reason for which he approached our institution in hopes of a loan. He plans to invest in the purchase of products of primary necessity. He wishes for a country with better sources of employment and more opportunities for the youth.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products of primary necessity

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily E., a 33-year-old from Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur, has three children. She is a devoted wife has long been worried about what future she could give to her children, considering that they are just tilling a small parcel of land. Emily knows that she could do something else to improve their lives through venturing into a business. Farming has been their ultimate source of living into which she believes she should invest more to increase yield and have enough food to eat for her family. As she reached initial success, she was able to hire people to work in her rice field during planting season and harvest.

She wants a loan of Php 7,000 to purchase 2 sacks of fertilizer, 1 sack of seeds (50 kls/sack) as well as pesticides needed in her farm.

Her being part of CEV makes her enjoy credit assistance convenience as well as training and insurance coverage it offers to all its clients. “CEV taught me to save and do better in my farm. They provide opportunities to all their clients to have additional income as well as to be good entrepreneurs in their own ways,” she added.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizers, pesticides and seeds

loans.name: Shukufa

texts.ru: Шукуфа  Абдуллаева  ей 23 года, Замужем, детей пока нет. недавно устроилась на работу в детский сад  работает в детском саду  бухгалтером, у нее не большая заработная плата. Ей необходимо работа, что бы  был стаж (опыт работы), скоро она должна  выйти на декрет, но стаж будет продолжаться. Кроме того, после обеда Шукуфа торгует  не далеко от дома в маленьком ларьке, она помогает своей свекрови торговать продуктами , например хлеб, сахар, макароны и.т.д. и разными  вещами: носками, шапками, платками и всякой всячиной. Ее свекровь ездит за продуктами в городской рынок, а за товаром в другой город. Шукуфа получает кредит  первый раз, но ей очень хочется помочь получить хорошую прибыль  перед новым годом, если у них пойдут хорошо дела, она будет кредитоватся в будущем, тоже.
texts.en:
Shukufa A. is 23 years old. Married, no children yet. Recently she got a job in a kindergarten, working as an secretary. She has a small salary. She needs a job to get more experience working. Soon she will take a leave of absence, but will remain on the pay-roll. Also, in the afternoon Shukufa helps her mother-in-law sell various goods in a small shop close to her home. They sell such food items as bread, sugar, pasta, etc. and other things including socks, hats, scarves, and all sorts of knick-knacks. Her mother-in-law goes to the town market for the food-stuffs, and has to go to a different town to get the non-edible things. Shukufa is taking out a loan for the first time, but she really wants to make a large profit before the New Year. If everything goes well, she will continue to take out loans in the future.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for business expansion

loans.name: Bashiran Sabir Ali Group

texts.en:
Bashiran baji is a 52 years old married lady and has resided in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan, for the past 12 years. Her husband name is S. A., who is a driver of a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). She is the mother of six children: four sons and two daughters. Her elder son has a food selling business. The next to him is a driver and drives a rented auto-rickshaw. The others are not employed. Bashiran baji belongs to an agriculture profession. She takes care of the land of land owners and earns income. She invests her income in a committee and plans to renovate her house when she saves the right amount. She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw for her son, so that he able to earn a larger income. 

She is part of a group loan of several women in her locality. Kalsoom baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Majidan baji wants a loan to buy shaving creams and razors for her barbershop. Shazia baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw. Irshad baji wants a loan to buy material (sugar, dry fruits) for her sweetmeat making business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora B. lives in the village of Barangay Lapogan Tumauini, Isabela. She is 35 years old and married to Luiseno, a farmer. They have four children: Marmites, 17, a high school student; Richard, 15, an elementary school graduate; Mary Rose, 12, and Melody, 10, both elementary school students. Nora is hoping that in the future, she will be able to send all her children to school through her business.

Nora sells vegetables in their village. She earns around PHP300 daily. This is budgeted for their daily needs and allowances for her children. Her husband is sometimes hired as farm laborer in their village and this also generates additional income for their family.

Nora wants to request a loan amounting to PHP5, 000 as additional capital for her vegetable vending business. She will utilize the loan to buy different kinds of vegetables including some native snacks to increase her daily vending income, which would somehow improve her business. Nora promises to repay the amount weekly so that she will be able to avoid past due accounts.

loans.use: Buy different kinds of vegetable to sell

loans.name: Margret Akinyi

texts.en: Margret Akinyi O. lives and works in the Nyamasaria slum in Kenya. She has a daughter named Emily Adhiambo who is four years old. Her husband sells timber and she sells vegetables to supplement his income. She believes her customers really like what she sells.

loans.use: Tomatoes, Onions

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa A. M. is a married, 52-year old micro-business entrepreneur. She has a 16 year-old son who is in school and living at home with his family.

Rosa grows and sells grains and rice to local customers. She would like to borrow money in order to purchase an ox to help plow the land and harvest the crops. For this reason, Rosa seeks a loan from Fundación León 2000 and the network of Kiva lenders. She has previously received loans from Fundación León, and each one has helped her maintain some semblance of financial security and increase the viability of her crops.

Rosa dreams of making enough money one day to make improvements to her home and purchase two more acres of farmland.

Rosa A. M. would like to thank all Kiva lenders for their support in helping her improve her life through micro-business development and poverty alleviation.

loans.use: Purchase an ox to plow field.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi A. est une femme de 55 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. elle est revendeuse de céréales au grand marché de Lomé. Pour accroître la taille de son commerce, Afi souhaite avec ce crédit acheter des sacs de maïs, mils, haricots et d'arachides pour la revente. Elle gagnera à cet effet plus de fonds pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants
texts.en:
Afi A., age 55, is married and the mother of 5 children. She resells cereals at the grand market in Lomé. In order to expand her business, Afi wishes to use this loan to buy sacks of corn, millet, beans and peanuts, for reselling. She will thus earn a higher income to provide for her children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn, millet, beans and peanuts

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Ana M. con mucho entusiasmo se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de frutas las cuales son comercializadas por ella misma todos los días.

Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de las frutas y verduras y por esta razón es que espera con mucha confianza que el crédito le sea otorgado para salir adelante en su negocio y brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
In the Mayoreo market of the city of Managua, Señora Ana M. enthusiastically attends to her business of selling fruit. She herself sells them every day. At this time, she has turned to CEPRODEL to be granted a loan for the purchase of fruits and vegetables. She confidently hopes the loan will be approved in order for her to move forward with her business and to provide better living conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr: Maimouna B., 59 ans est mariée avec 04 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de banc villageois à Vélingara depuis 05 ans. Son activité est la vente de tissus teintés. Elle veut renforcer son commerce et soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
Maimouna B., age 59, is married and has four children in her care. She has been a member of the village lending group in Vélingara for five years. Her work involves selling dyed cloth. She wants to bolster her business and to support her husband with covering family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell dyed fabrics

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena G. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 34 years old. Rowena is single. To make a living, Rowena owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Rowena has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 1999, Rowena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rowena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. Rowena is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 12th loan taken out by Rowena from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her general living conditions. About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte is 33 years old, married and the mother of two beautiful girls. Her husband is a farmer. Her children are in school because of government free compulsory education. She is a very hardworking young mother who works all day. She operates a hairdressing salon in front of her house. She has been in business for five years now. She always tries new styles for her clients and, because of that, many people come to her to have their hair done. She requests a loan to buy a hair dryer, weavings etc. to service her clients. She belongs to a village bank called Nyame Mere meaning "God’s Time."

loans.use: To buy mesh, weavings, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Рустам мужчина, который использует кредиты для увеличения своего оборотного капитала. Его точка реализации расположена в центре города Худжанда.На полученный кредит Рустам хочет закупить мясо окарачка и баранины. У него шашлык и куриного мясо и баранины. У Рустама очень много клиентов и торговля всегда кипит.
texts.en:
Rustam is a man, who uses loans for increasing his working capital. His store is located in the Khujand city center. Rustam wants to use this loan to buy chicken and lamb. He makes chicken and lamb kebobs. Rustam has many customers, and his sales are always busy.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chicken and lamb

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita A., 48, has seven children. Through her handwork, her husband's her eldest child has graduated from college. Clarita's business has been of great help to sustain the education of their children. Every month, she receives money from her daughter.

She had a livestock raising business. In 2001, Clarita became a member of ASHI. It was hard for Clarita to accept the fact that she can't give her children the right education. But with her membership in ASHI she is hopeful that someday her business will grow and produce a big profit.

She planned to purchase cattle and pigs to raise in her backyard, surrounded by verdant grass which is good for cattle and less populated and good for raising pigs.

loans.use: Livestock raising and selling business.

loans.name: Christopher Owino

texts.en:
Christopher, 24, is married and has a 9 month-old child. He is a hard-working man who earns income operating a motorbike taxi (called a piki piki by the locals) in Kisumu, Kenya.  However, he currently has to lease a motorcycle which costs a lot, leaving little profit.  Even if he does not get much business on a given day, Christopher has to pay the fee to the motorbike owner.  He therefore dreams of being able to save enough to afford his own motorbike, so that he can keep all the money he makes from his business.  Christopher already has decided on a particular model available at a downtown retail store, and will use his loan to make a down-payment.  
Christopher is extremely excited about the work that K-MET is doing and wants to recruit new members so that they can benefit from K-MET's work in the community.

loans.use: Down-payment on a motorcycle

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma O. is from the village of Gingoog in Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Erma is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Erma sells seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Erma has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Erma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Erma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Fatuma Nassanga’S Group

texts.en:
Fatuma owns a stall selling plastics. She lives and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. She works seven days a week. She gets 20 customers a day. Fatuma incurs transport costs to and from her suppliers. The major challenges she faces are monthly market dues, medication costs, feeding her family and rising plastic prices. She has been in this business for 6 years.

Fatuma is a 48-year-old married woman with five children between the ages of 10 and 17 years. She also takes care of additional family members. All her children go to school. Fatuma owns a three-roomed house where she lives with six people. There is electricity but no piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

Fatuma has been with MCDT for ten years, now servicing her 20th loan working with the same group mate. She wants to use this loan to buy more plastics. Fatuma is hoping to see her business grow bigger. She wants to own a permanent business structure and to open up another stall.

loans.use: To buy more plastics for resale

loans.name: Lucia's Group

texts.en:
N. Lucia is a 44-year-old lady who is married with five children, three of whom are in school. She also takes care of four dependents.

Lucia is a farmer and is also involved in animal husbandry. Her main challenge is having cattle sickness and the drought and feeding her animals.

In the farming business, she grows food for sale and this helps to bring in a double income. She is able to save 30,000/= a week out of her income and it is this that helps to contribute to her family welfare. She ensures that her produce and cows are of good quality, hence earning a good income.

Lucia has a dream of buying more cows and more land both for cultivation as well as to build a good family house for her children.

Lucia needs a loan to help purchase more feed, drugs and seeds for her farm for improvement and to ensure good quality output products.

loans.use: To buy more feed, drugs and seeds for her farm

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther es una mujer perseverante, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 24 años, es madre de un niño, ella  se dedica a la venta de menús (alimento) durante el día y por las noches vende salchipapas (comida al paso), este negocio funciona en su casa y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, él es cubicador de madera (operario). Esther forma parte del Banco Comunal “Ricardo Palma” desde hace cuatro años. El primer préstamo fue de 300 soles, que invirtió en la compra de escobas para vender.
Actualmente ella necesita un crédito de 2700 soles, que invertirá en la compra de un carrito salchipapero (comida rápida) e insumos para la venta de menús. 
La meta de Esther es tener un restaurante bien implementado.
texts.en:
Esther is a woman who perseveres. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 24, and she has one son. She sells prepared food during the day. In the evenings she sells “salchipapas” (fast food made from fried sausages and fried potatoes). This business is in her house. She has her husband’s support. He is a carpenter (workman). Esther has been a member of the Ricardo Palma Communal Bank for four years. With her first loan of 300 PEN she bought brooms to sell. She currently needs a loan for 2,700 PEN to buy a “carrito salchipapero” (fast food cart) and supplies for her prepared food sales. Esther’s dream is to have a well equipped restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a “carrito salchipapero” (fast food cart) and supplies for prepared food sales

loans.name: Zouheir

texts.en:
Zouheir is a 49-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Zouheir has been repairing cars since 1983. Zouheir is special in his work because of his experience. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase spare parts such as springs and shock absorbers for his work. This is his third loan cycle and he has always paid on time.

Zouheir started his car repair business, nor because he faced difficulties, but because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on enlarging his business.

loans.use: To purchase automobile spare parts.

loans.name: Ateykak

texts.en:
Mrs. Ateykak T., 43 and her husband, Mr. Try Sman, 45, live along National Road Number Six, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1985 and have 3 sons and 4 daughters. Two of their children are married and live with their parents. One son is a fisherman, three other children are attending school, and the youngest stays home.

Her husband catches fish, and Ateykak sells the fish in the village. Mr. Try Sman has been fishing since he was young. He fishes in the Mekong River and the lake near his village. He wants another boat motor; this will make it easier for him to operate the business. 

Hence Ateykak is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase another boat motor for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase another boat motor for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.name: Rezel's Group

texts.en:
Rezel P., from the village of Manaoag, Cauayan City, is the 31-year-old leader of an 11-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Rezel, who is married and has one school-aged child, owns and operates a general store whose income derives primarily from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Rezel has been engaged in her business for over fours years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Rezel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan, her fourth, of 10000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, and plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the store.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Eder

texts.es:
Eder es un joven trabajador de 35 años, es soltero y vive solo en su casa propia.
Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la fabricación de muebles, para lo cual implementó un taller en su vivienda. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingresos, por ello que se dedica a tiempo completo, trabajando todos los días de 5 de la mañana a 5 de la tarde. El trabajo es duro y pesado, pero Eder tiene bien claros sus ideales de hacer crecer su negocio para que en el futuro pueda darle una buena calidad de vida a la familia que piensa conformar. 
A él le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues lo hace sentirse bien y gratificado, por lo que desea hacerlo crecer y en un futuro contratar a otras personas que lo ayuden y así producir más.

Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual en sus pagos, además es muy respetado por sus compañeras de grupo. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará una máquina para facilitar su trabajo en la elaboración de muebles y así aumentará su producción.
texts.en:
Eder, a young worker, age 35, is single and lives alone in his own house. For 5 years he has been involved in making furniture, for which purpose he set up a shop in his home. This activity is his principal source of income because he engages in it full time, working every day from 5:00 in the morning until 5:00 in the afternoon. The work is hard and tiring, but Eder has a clear idea of increasing his business so that in the future he can provide a good quality of life to the family he is thinking of starting. He likes his work a lot since it makes him feel good and gratified, which is why he wants to make it grow and in the future contract with other customers so that he can produce more.

This is his fifth loan with MFP and he has always been characterized by being very punctual with his payments. In addition, he is highly respected by his colleagues in the group. With the money that he is now applying for he will buy a machine in order to assist his work of manufacturing furniture and will, thus, add to his production.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase  of machinery

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Maritza es soltera, tiene 30 años y 1 hijo, Maritza trabaja como asistente de Gerencia, además vende cereales, lácteos, y en asociación con sus papas tienen un restaurante.
Maritza necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lácteos.
Los sueños de Maritza son ampliar sus negocios y tener una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Maritza is a member of the Communal Bank “Amor Divino” (Divine Love). She is 30 years old, single, and has one child.

She works as an assistant manager, but she also sells grains and dairy products. In addition, she and her parents operate a restaurant. Maritza is requesting a loan of 900 soles to purchase dairy products. She dreams of expanding her businesses and opening a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dairy products

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: La señora Verónica y su esposo son clientes confiables de nuestra Institución ya que anteriormente se le otorgaron un crédito para la inversión en su negocio en la etapa difícil de su economía ya que sus ventas habían bajado, pero como son una familia muy unida su negocio jamás se derrumbo gracias al esfuerzo y dedicación de ellos para seguir manteniendo su negocio trabajando, lo cual deja a muy buen criterio la responsabilidad, pero sobretodo la puntualidad de sus pagos. Ahora que su negocio esta dando muy buenos ingresos, tramitan nuevamente pero para la inversión en la compra de mercancía por mayoreo y así obtener un mayor incremento de ganancias para aun mas poderle ofrecer a sus clientes un bajo costo en el producto. Así contribuyen a la economía de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Verónica and her husband are trusted customers of our institution, as they have previously been granted a loan to invest in their business. In a difficult economic phase, their sales decreased. However, being a very united family, their business has never collapsed, thanks to their effort and dedication to keeping their business operating. This is very good evidence of responsibility, but their punctuality in their payments is even more so. Now that their business is making very good profits, they are again applying for a loan, but now to invest in the purchase of merchandise for Mayoreo. They would like to increase their profits, yet still be able to offer their customers their products at a low price. In this way, they help the finances of their customers.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Kurten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in the business

loans.name: Llama De Amor 123 Group

texts.en:
Sixto is the coordinator of her group Llama D. Amor (Call of Love).  Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). Her group is located in the Samana peninsula, a lush but rugged area with a nascent tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home in a simple structure with her husband and their three children.

Sixto is excited to be requesting her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business growing and selling name (yam), plantain, and yuca, all basic staples here in the DR. She will use the profits to invest in her home by remodeling it and purchasing a new floor as well as buying school supplies for her family. Her long term goal is to have her own corner store. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: purchase supplies for plantain, name (yam), and yuca farming

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es: La señora Concepción C. tiene un negocio de elaboración de pan situado en Catarina, ella tiene de experiencia cincuenta y siete años, lleva con este dos créditos con CEPRODEL el cual le ha ayudado para tener mas inventario y por ende mas ganancia porque así no compra la materia prima al crédito, también le ayudara en su hogar y tener un nivel de vida moderado.
texts.en:
Concepción C. has a bread making business, which is located in Catarina. She has 57 years of experience. She has had two loans with Ceprodel. The loans have helped her to have more inventory, and this gave her more income. This way she does not have to buy the raw materials on credit. The loan will also help her to have modest living conditions in her home .

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flour, sugar, leavening, shortening, margarine, firewood, and cheese

loans.name: Emprendedoras 3 Group

texts.en:
Ana, 27, is a borrower who lives in El Seybo, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Emprendedoras (Entrepreneurs), and her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Ana lives with her husband and three children in a simple home in El Seybo, in the heart of the agricultural east of the Dominican Republic. Life in rural areas of the Dominican Republic can be rough, with no potable running water, frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with), and inadequate access to healthcare, among other dangers. Despite these difficulties, Ana runs a successful business running a small fried food stand in her community. With this loan, she will be purchasing a new stove and a gas tank for her food stand.

This is Ana’s third loan with Esperanza International. With continued profits, Ana hopes to continue the growth of her business. Her business has given her the ability to “supply her children with a healthy lifestyle, keeping them educated and well-fed”. Ana is very grateful for her loans, and hopes that with continued profits she will be able to purchase a refrigerator for her home. Ana’s long-term goal is to one day have her own home, and with a successful business she is well on her way.

Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in eleven offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for lending to Ana and the Emprendedoras group!

loans.use: To buy a stove and gas tank for her fried food stand.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.fr: Née en 1972 à Abomey-Calavi, T. Pauline est divorcée de son mari. Pauline a un enfant qui est scolarisé et qui vit avec elle. Il y a seulement deux mois que Pauline s'est installée avec son enfant au quartier Ayélawadjè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Pauline n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Pauline commercialise les produits de soins (pâtes dentifrices, brosses à dents, les médicaments génériques) de façon ambulante. Pauline s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et à Pharmaquick. Pauline exerce cette activité depuis sept ans et a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. Pauline envisage développer et agrandir un peu plus son activité, afin de mieux faire face aux exigences des clients et de se faire plus de revenu. C'est ce qui l'amène à solliciter auprès de ALIDé, un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
Pauline T. was born in 1972 in Abomey-Calavi. She is divorced from her husband. She has one child who lives with her and attends school. Just two months ago, Pauline and her child moved to the Ayélawadjè district of Cotonou, Benin’s economic capital. Pauline did not go to school. To meet her needs, she works hawking personal care products (toothpaste, toothbrushes, generic medicine) from place to place. She buys her stock at Dantokpa, Benin’s international market, and at Pharmaquick. She has been doing this work for seven years, and has already benefitted from two loans with ALIDé, which she successfully paid back. Pauline is planning to develop and expand her business, in order to better meet her clients’ demands and increase her income. This is what brings her to request a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Chelsea Rosendale, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing toothpaste and toothbrushes

loans.name: Achiaa Ahemaa Tb Group

texts.en:
Afua K. is lovely and hard-working young lady. She is married to a commercial driver with two children. She is now thirty-eight years old. Afua lives together with her family in a family house at Goaso, where she also does her trading. She is able to provide support for her family’s financial needs through the sale of vegetables and spices: tomatoes, peppers, onions, garden eggs (small eggplants), etc. 

Selling for the past two years, she has retained quite a number of customers through good customer relations. 

Afua is currently the leader of a trust bank group called “A. Ahemaa” (named after one of the members), made up of six members. The other members are also engaged in businesses such as foodstuff-selling, Kenkey-selling, grocery sales, used clothing sales etc. They are the major breadwinners of their respective families and are requesting a loan to support their businesses. Their common dream is to be financially self-sustaining and to be able to support their children through quality education.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and spices for resale

loans.name: Mammadov

texts.en: Mammadov M. is a 62 year-old man who has breed cattle in the Bilasuvar internally displaced settlement since 1992. M. has three grown sons who are independent adults thanks to his example. He is a hardworking man who works from early morning until late at night looking after his cattle. He would like to increase his numbers of cattle by purchasing three calves and some fodder and is applying for a loan of 1000 AZN.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials for her sewing business

loans.name: Ambika

texts.en:
Ambika K. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishepati in the Lalitpur district. She raises goats and sells goats and goat milk in the local market.  Ambika currently owns five goats. 

She is requesting an Rs 30000.00 loan to buy baby goats for her business.  Ambika lives in a single family home with her husband and two children.  Her husband is an electrician.  Ambika is the mother of one son and one daughter.  Her son is studying in grade 10 and her daughter is in grade 7.

loans.use: Buys baby goats.

loans.name: Evelyn Cristina

texts.es:
la sra. Evelyn Cristina A. F. se dedica al comercio cuenta con  una venta de productos lácteos,  paletas y chorizos, su negocio esta ubicado en el barrio Las Lomitas, del Municipio de El Paraíso, La sra. A. tiene mas de 7 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, a ganado mucha experiencia y por lo tanto buena clientela siendo sus clientes los vecinos de su domicilio y de colonias cercanas a su comunidad.
el credito lo utilizara para surtir su negocio en lo que es la compra de materiales para fabricar las paletas, lácteos y carnes para elaborar chorizos y asi cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ventas y así lograr mejores ganancias para mejorar sus condiciones de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Evelyn Cristina A. F. sells dairy products, popsicles, and chorizo sausages. Her business is located in the neighborhood of Las Lomitas in the city of El Paraíso. Evelyn has been in business for more than seven years and has gained much experience. She has a good customer base that consists of neighbors who live near her home and other people from the areas surrounding her community.

This loan will be used to restock her business. She plans to buy supplies for making popsicles, dairy products, and meats used in making chorizo sausages so that she can meet the demand of her customers. This will allow her to improve her sales and earn more income to provide better living conditions for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits, sugar, disposable cups, popsicle sticks, dairy products, and meats for making chorizo

loans.name: Jhoana Veronica

texts.es:
La Señora. Jhoana C. es socia del banco comunal Buscando el Éxito, vive por el sector de Tototacocha en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por su belleza arquitectónica, sus iglesias, su gastronomía y muchos encantos más que hacen de esta una ciudad especial.

Nuestra socia tiene 23 años es casada y tiene 1 hija de 3 años de edad, su esposo es policía, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora. Jhoana por el momento no trabaja, es ama de casa y se dedica al cuidando de su hija. Se encuentra en su segundo ciclo realizando los créditos en la fundación, fue invitada por su mamá a formar parte de este grupo de mujeres que siempre luchan por sus sueños y objetivos, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su hogar.

Su meta es seguir estudiando para graduarse de profesora.
texts.en:
Ms. Jhoana C. is a memeber of the Banco Comunal Buscando el Éxito (Looking for Success Communal Bank). She lives in the Tototacocha sector of the town of Cuenca. This town is renowned for its architectural beauty, its churches, its gastronomy and many other charms that make this town special. She is 23 years old, she is married and she has a 1 year-old daughter. Her husband is a policeman; they do not have a house of their own and so they rent the one they live in. Ms. Jhoana is temporarily unemployed: she is a housewife and dedicates herself to the caring of her daughter. This is her second cycle of loans with this institution. She was invited by her mother to form part of this group of women always fighting to reach their goals and make their dreams come true; the loan she is requesting will be used to buy provisions for her family. Her goal is to keep on studying to become a professor.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy provisions.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna M. is from the village of Mangcuram. She is 45 years old. Edna is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Edna owns and operates a business growing crops, specifically, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Edna has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Edna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops. Edna is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Edna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary P. is currently in the business of selling maize flour, rice and cassava flour at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of beans and pulses (e.g. groundnuts, peas, cowpeas) to sell.

Mary is 29 years old and is married to a teacher. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop for her goods.

loans.use: To stock bags of beans and pulses to sell

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly B. is a 45-year old married woman who supports her family by operating 3 business ventures:   Food Vending , selling ready-made curtains and hollow blocks production. She lives in Prk Mabuhay, Brgy 3 Poblacion, Roxas, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her 3 business ventures, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 3000. Merly is now borrowing PHP 13000 so that she  could  purchase more ingredients for her food vending business.   This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 13000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Merly aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for food vending

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, de 45 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Pedro de 50 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor vida. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana, Nelly sale a trabajar sus campos, para ella no existen los días de descanso, ya que tiene que trabajar continuamente su chacra, para tener una buena producción. Sus principales productos de siembra son la papa, espinaca y la arveja, los cuales vende al por mayor en la ciudad de Tarma. Lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y aún sigue disfrutando trabajar en el campo y cuidar sus cultivos, sin embargo debe estar atenta para que la plaga de insectos no perjudique su siembra. Para el futuro, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es una persona muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya es muy alegre. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Nelly is 45 years years old. She is a very simple and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her husband Pedro, who is 50 years old, and their 3 children to whom she wishes to give a better life. Every day, very early in the morning, Nelly leaves to go to work in the fields. For her, there are no rest days as she has to continually work her farm in order for it to be productive. Her main crops are potatoes, spinach and peas which she sells wholesale in the city of Tarma. She has been doing this work for 30 years and she still enjoys working in the fields and caring for her crops, however, she has to be vigilant so that the insects don't destroy her crops. In the future, she wants to buy more land to increase her production. This is her seventh loan with MFP. She has been very punctual with her payments and hopes to do the same with this loan. In her communal bank she is very well-liked by her fellow members since she is very cheerful. With the two thousand nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) that she is requesting she will buy more fertilizer for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia G. is from the village of Masilakon I, Lugait, Misamis Oriental. She is 58 years old. Lydia is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Lydia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lydia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fishes to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Lydia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora A. is from the village of Solinog Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old. Aurora is widowed and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Aurora owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste,  salt, sugar, soft drinks, and fruits in the local community. Aurora has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Aurora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aurora is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Aurora from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose M. is 37 years old, married and has six school-aged children. She is from the village of Bal-ason, a part of Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental province on the Mindanao islands. Mary Rose manufactures and sells brooms with her husband to local businesses and community members. Mary Rose has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Mary Rose joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase the materials to manufacture additional brooms. Mary Rose is requesting a new loan, her third from HSPFI, of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional materials to increase broom production. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials to increase broom production

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan N., 58, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean Temples. N. is a vegetable seller in the city, earning an income of USD 3 per day. One of her children is employed at the factory, earning an income of about USD 1 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family has to spend USD 40 on food, USD 5 on electricity supply, and USD 55 on other necessary expenses every month. N. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more vegetable to stock her store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to stock her store

loans.name: Anner

texts.es:
Anner tiene 25 años de edad, estudia IV año de Ingeniería Agropecuaria, vive en Esteli, le encanta esta carrera. 

Actualmente trabaja en el cultivo de Tabaco, tienen el apoyo de sus padres, su Mama es Maestra y su Papa es Contratista.

El realizó este préstamo para invertir en compra de Insumos, para un Proyecto de la Universidad para Producción de Productos Lácteos.

Este proyecto es muy importante porque le ayudara a tener mayores conocimientos y practica en su carrera

Quiere terminar su carrera, y seguir trabajando con el cultivo de Tabaco.
texts.en:
Anner is 25 years old.  He is in his fourth year of studying agricultural engineering. He lives in Esteli.  He really likes this career.

He is currently working with tobacco crops.  His parents help him.  His mother is a teacher, and his father is a contractor.

He used this loan to buy supplies for a university project for the production of dairy products.  This project is very important because it will help him have more knowledge and practice in his career.

He wants to finish his career education and continue working with tobacco crops.

loans.use: Agricultural industry student project for making dairy products

loans.name: Tres Esquinas - El Tambo Group

texts.es:
Luis Alberto M. C., tiene 33 años D. edad, conviviente, 2 hijosy miembro activo D. la Alcancia Comunal: " Las Tres Esquinas - El Tambo" D. la cuidad incontrastable D. Huancayo. 
(En la foto esta D. pie y viste un guardapolvo color gris y tiene puesto unas gafas).

Luis Alberto anteriormente trabajaba como maestro panadero en una empresa D. la ciudad D. Huancayo. 

Cuando empezò a convivir con su esposa no era muy aceptado por la familia D. ella, por que ellos vivian en un cuarto en la casa D. su suegra; al sentir que necesitaba sugir para poder darles una mejor calidad D. vida para sus hijos D. 06 y 02 años respectivamente. él decidió salir D. la casa D. su suegra e independizarse y tambièn iniciar el negocio D. la panaderìa; pero el dinero no alcanzaba. 

El inicio no fue fàcil, ya que con poco capital que tenìan, que era el ahorro D. sus sueldos no cubria los gastos iniciales D. este negocio. 

Posteriormente se decidieron empezar con la ayuda D. su esposa y salieron D. la casa D. su suegra y alquilaron una casa en la cual ahora funciona su propia panaderia y bodega. Luis Alberto siente el apoyo D. su esposa ya que èl prepara los panes, y ella sale a vender por las tardes; es así que actualmente cuenta con una pequeña bodeguita en su panaderia; por ello necesitan màs capital D. trabajo para poder abastecer su bodeguita.

Uso del crédito: Comprar mercaderìa para la bodega que funciona en la panaderia. 

** la foto pequeña corresponD. al Sr. Jose Antonio S. R., quien no esta en la foto principal **
texts.en:
Luis Alberto M. C., 33, has a life partner and two children.  (In the photo he is standing and is wearing a gray windbreaker and is wearing glasses).

He used to work as a master baker in a firm in the city of Huancayo.

When he started living with his wife he wasn’t very well accepted by her family because they lived in a room in his mother-in-law’s house.  As he felt the need to leap forward in order to proviD. a better quality of life for his two children, who are 6 and 2 years of age respectively, he decided to leave his mother-in-law’s house and start a bakery.  However, money was insufficient.

The start wasn’t easy because he had very little capital, which was savings from his salary.  It wasn’t enough to cover the start up costs of the business.

Later they decided to start with help from his wife.  They left his mother-in-law’s house and rented a house in which his bakery and a grocery store nor operate.  Luis Alberto is mindful of his wife’s support because he prepares the bread and she goes out in the afternoon to sell it.  He has a small grocery store in the bakery and they need more working capital to stock the little store.

Loan’s Purpose: To buy merchandise for the grocery store that operates in the bakery.

**The small photo is Mr. José Antonio S. R., who does not appear in the main group photo**

loans.use: To buy merchandise for the store that operates in the bakery.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Jocelyn P. is from the barangay of P3 Gotokan Daku, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old, married to Alejandro P., and is blessed with 2 children, both of whom are now studying in college. To make a living, she is presently engaged in farming activity, particularly in corn culture and production. She has been engaged in this kind of agriculture activity for 10 years. She is also receiving regular support from her husband as a farmer. She earns an average amount of not less than Php 3,000.00 a month from this kind of agricultural activity. 

In August 16, 2007, Jocelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn is active member of Paglaum MPC under the PDP-LP, a microfinance program that reached out to rural communities.  She has successfully repaid a loan amount of Php 10,000.00. She is now requesting a loan of Php 14,900.00 as her 6th loan, which will be used to pay her daughter’s tuition fees. She plans to use the revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments, children’s education, and possible business expansions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay daughter's tuition

location.town: Ozamis-P3 Gotokan Daku, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occid

loans.name: Neak

texts.en: Neak S., age 41, sells both used and new clothes in and around the city of Phnom Penh. From that she is able to earn $4 a day to support her family. She doesn’t have a life partner as her husband divorced her when her two children were very small. Now her children are grown and can support the family by working in factory as a worker. Recently, Neak S. sold nearly all her inventory to her buyers and she wants to replenish her stock but she lacks capital. She is therefore asking for a loan in order to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Ganchimeg

texts.en: Ganchimeg is 40 years old and lives with her two children in the Chingeltey district of Ulaanbaatar, the largest city and capital of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent. Her two children both attend a local secondary school. Ganchimeg operates a silver and gold items trading business out of a stall in a large store in the city. She started her business in 1998 with help of her sister and has since built a stable and successful operation. She usually purchases her products from individuals and imports small items such as pearls, beads and coral etc from China. Her main customers are the jewelery makers. Ganchimeg is a clever and talkative woman who is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to increase her working capital which was decreased due to repairs on her house in the fall.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
Simón tiene 25 años de edad y vive en la ciudad del Cusco departamento del Cusco, Perú. Simón trabaja en la institución privada ABC de PRODEIN como vigilante, él socio viaja a la ciudad de Oropesa donde cuida el local de la institución, él empieza su jornada laboral a partir de las 7 de la mañana hasta el otro día pero el trabajo es inter diario. El socio nos cuenta que su papá Martin vive en la ciudad de Paruro donde se dedica agricultura y ganadería, simon está pensando invertir dinero en el negocio, el socio Simón con el préstamo está pensando comprar herramientas para ayudar a su padre en el cultivo y la cosecha.

Simón pertenece al banco comunal “Hijas de María” de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Simón is 25 years old and lives in the city of Cusco, in Cusco department, Peru.  Simón works as a security guard for the private institution ABC which is operated by PRODEIN (the human rights branch of the Catholic Order, Lumen Dei).  He travels to the city of Oropesa where he looks after the institution.  His work day starts at 7.00am and lasts until the following day but he only works every second day.  He tells us that his dad Martin lives in the city of Paruro where he grows crops and raises livestock.  Simón is thinking of investing money in the business.  Simón is planning to buy tools to help his father with his crop farming.

Simón is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “Hijas de María” (Daughters of María) community bank, in Cusco, Peru.  The community bank is in its third year and is working very well for all its members.

loans.use: To buy tools

loans.name: Hugo Cesar

texts.es:
Hugo es un padre de familia de 35 años de edad, que reside junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Catacaos, un lugar donde los alrededores son de viviendas de material rustico, además es  una zona turística que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

El tiene un Bar Picantería donde  ofrece la venta de comida, piqueos, bebidas como cerveza y chicha, esta actividad la realiza hace 4 años,  en su  domicilio Ampliación José Cayetano Heredia – Catacaos,  conoce a la perfección el rubro. El negocio goza de muy buena acogida por parte de sus clientes debido a la buena sazón con la que prepara su comida. 

Hugo desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de materiales para mejorar su negocio como: mesas sillas, etc. También realizar algunos cambios en su vivienda. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Hugo is a 35 year old father.  He lives with his wife and their two children in the Catacaos district.  It is a place where the surrounding areas are comprised of houses made from austere materials.  It is also a tourist zone, which is located in the Piura province in the region with the same name.  It is over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.
