He has a pub where he sells meals, appetizers, and drinks like beer and “chicha” (chicha de jora is an ancestral Peruvian and American beverage made from jora, fermented corn).  He has been doing this for four years in his home, which is in Ampliación José Cayetano Heredia – Catacaos.  He knows this line of work to perfection.  The business is very well received by his customers because of the good seasoning with which he prepares his food.

Hugo wishes to expand his business by purchasing materials to improve his business.   He will buy things like tables, and chairs, etc.  He also wants to make some changes to his home.  That is why he believes it is advisable to request a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy chairs, tables, and other materials to expand his business

loans.name: Chick

texts.en:
Chick B. S. E. 48 years old, widowed, and has four children, three of whom are below the age of 15. She lives with her children in Azire New Church Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.  Chick B. S. E. has faced some challenges in life. She has been struggling to raise her children all by herself since the death of her husband. She faces difficulties providing for their school needs, especially payment of their school fees on time. She plans to invest this loan in a provision store which sells omo, salt, rice, beans, palm oil, nut oils, savon, magi, salt, and firewood. She has been in this business for a long time and  success is her watchword.   Chick B. S. E. will plow her profit back into her business and use part to care for her family. Her children’s school needs will be taken care of. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the method of obtaining and repaying the loan.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase salt, rice, nut oils, savon, omo, and magi

loans.name: Humphrey

texts.en:
Humphrey M. Z. is 53 years old and married. They have three children, aged between 19 years old and 4 years old, whom they hope to give good education to the university level. His business is located at Majengo estate in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many, many tourist attraction sites – not forgetting the Indian Ocean white beaches. 

Humphrey has been selling fish to the local people for the last 17 years and has managed to give employment to two people. He says that this business is profitable and his major challenges are financial constraints and the perishable nature of his products. However, he works hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to increase his stock of fish to meet the high demand of customers. He hopes to be a wholesaler in the future. He also sees himself becoming a landlord some day. He describes himself as customer-friendly and a person who loves his work.

loans.use: to increase stock of fish.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius B. is a 42-year-old married man with five children. He has been operating a retail shop in Marereni town in Malindi for the past 10 years now. Julius earns a monthly income of about KES 10,000 that he uses to take care of his family. 

He has been loaned KES 30,000 by KADET Ltd., and this serves as his third loan cycle from the company. He intends to use his loan to add stock such as toothpastes, soft drinks, bottled drinking water, tooth brushes, cooking flour, cooking oil and other things that are running low in the shop.

He wishes to use the anticipated profits from the business to continue taking care of his family and educating his children as well as saving some of the money for future investments.

loans.use: to add stock to his retail shop

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto  tiene 53 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su familia en el caserío Laynas, una localidad rural de pobladores humildes y trabajadores que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito agrícola de Morropón, que se encuentra en la Región Piura que esta a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El cuenta con un terreno agrícola en la zona donde reside. El ya cuenta con más de quince años dedicándose a esta actividad, la misma que aprendió de su padre y debido a ello conoce mucho del manejo de estos cultivos. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad se encarga de sacar adelante a la economía de su familia.
 
Humberto  desea adquirir fertilizantes para su cultivo de plátano y poder asegurarse una buena producción de su cultivo, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1400 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Humberto is 53 years old, single, and lives with his family in Laynas, a rural village of humble and hard-working people which is located in the agricultural district of Morropón, in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Humberto owns farmland in his area.  He has been farming for more than 15 years.  He learned the business from his father and, thanks to his father, he knows a lot about growing his crops.  He uses the income from his business to get his family ahead in life financially.

Humberto would like to buy fertilizers for his banana crop so that he can ensure a good production.  For this reason, he has requested a loan for 1,400 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help him achieve his goal.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his banana crop

loans.name: Serapio

texts.en: Serapio is 75 years old. He is a married man from Trinidad, Bohol. He is engaged in farming. Serapio primarily grows rice crops to sell. He earns 5000 PHP per month from this farming. Serapio wants to improve his earnings. He requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. He hopes for his business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is a married woman with four children. She is 49 years old and has had a fish selling business for six years already. She is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy fish and new products like frozen goods and native chickens to sell and earn additional profits.

Her husband, on the other hand, drives a transport motorcycle to add to their daily income. Each month, Fely as she is commonly called, earns PHP 8,000 net income. This helps her support their daily needs, especially her children's education.

She dreams that her business will become more productive so she can continue to send her children to school and to give her family a progressive standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fish and new products to sell like frozen goods and native chickens

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
This is Epifania, 61, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She has five children. Two of the children are already enrolled in college and three stay at home managing the household and helping her with the business. By the grace of God, Epifania has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to provide continuous income for their everyday expenses.

Epifania operates a computer rental shop. In the Philippines, very few people own their own computers. Thus, there is a need for them, especially for students who need to do their research and papers. She rents out computers by the hour and offers printing and typing services. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 250 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy additional set of computer parts & accessories needed for the shop. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Epifania dreams of being able to renovate her house soon, with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and were she draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for an additional set of computer parts & accessories

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan  tiene 54 años, esta casado con Marcelina de 38 años, juntos tienen 2 hijos, Juan de 18 y Amílcar de 14 años. Juan y su familia viven en su casa propia ubicada en el anexo  de natividad del distrito de Pichari. Juan desde muy joven viene labrando la tierra con un entusiasmo persistente, hasta alcanzar sus metas trazadas, junto a él esta Marcelina que le brinda su apoyo constante para el mejor bienestar de su entorno familiar. Juan esta lleno de mucha satisfacción  al ver que los cultivos que tiene le brindan buenos frutos, además de una rentabilidad efectiva. Agradece al buen manejo agronómico que realiza, el único problema que tiene es, el no contar con suficiente mano de obra de los jornaleros, pese a ello trata de salir adelante, para brindar bienestar a sus hijos ya que ellos se encuentran estudiando en la provincia de huamanga y necesitan apoyo económico para así concluir sus estudios y convertirse en profesionales. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que el esta comprometido en realizar sus pagos muy puntualmente, con los  2.000 nuevos soles Juan comprará algunos equipos para el mantenimiento de sus plantas. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que esta comprometido en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Juan esta contento por ser parte de su banco comunal  por que todos son muy solidarios. Con los 2.000 nuevos soles Juan comprará equipos y herramientas para el mantenimiento de su parcela de cacao.
texts.en:
Juan is 54 years old and married to 38 year-old Marcelina.  They have two children: 18 year-old Juan and 14 year-old Amílcar.  Juan and his family live in their own home which is located in the small village of Natividad, in Pichari district.

Juan has been working the land since he was very young.  He has worked with persistent enthusiasm and managed to reach his goals.  Marcelina works alongside him, providing her constant support in improving their family's well-being.  Juan is full of satisfaction when he sees that his crops are providing good fruit and a real profit.  He puts this all down to the good agronomic management that he provides.  The only problem that he has is that he doesn't have enough help from laborers.  In spite of this, however, he tries to get ahead so that he can provide for his children's well-being.  His children are studying in Huamanga province and need financial support in order to finish their studies and become professionals.

This is Juan's second loan from MFP and he pledges to make his repayments punctually.  He is happy to be a member of his community bank because all of the bank's members are very supportive of each other.  Juan will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles he has requested to buy some equipment and tools which he will use to care for his cacao crops.

loans.use: to buy equipment and tools to care for his cacao plants

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en: Speciose is 45 years old. She has four children who are aged 10-25 years old, and they are all in school. She is a widow. Speciose sells charcoal and she has been selling charcoal for the past eight years. This charcoal business has enabled her to bring up her children, meet their needs and feed them as well. She needs a loan to reinvest in her charcoal business by buying more charcoal.With the profits she plans to install water pipes in her house and have water come to her house.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 37 years old and lives in Lam-an, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of three school-age children. Mary Grace has a food vending business to earn a living. She has a small food stall at the market where she sells viands, snacks, and refreshments. She has been running her business for over two years. She earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month from this business. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 from GDMPC to purchase kitchen utensils and raw ingredients.

Mary Grace has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Mary Grace hopes to have a food court in the city and gain more income.

loans.use: To purchase kitchen utensils and raw ingredients.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Gloria tiene 35 años y es soltera. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de coco y maíz en forma ambulante en unos de los mercados mas grandes de la zona central. En el año 1995 con los ahorros que pudo obtener de la venta de sus mercaderías pudo abrir un pequeño almacencito en su propiedad.
Actualmente solo se dedica a atender su pequeña despensa, comenta que ya tiene una clientela bien formada. La mayoría de sus vecinos van a comprar de ella. La Sra. Gloria se define como una mujer muy luchadora, ya que todo lo que tiene, lo consiguió por medio de su esfuerzo. Uno de sus sueños es poder tener una despensa un poco más grande donde pueda tener mas mercaderías y así poder atraer a más clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para el abastecimiento de su local, por medio de la compra de comestibles, bebidas, fideos y demás, ya que con eso podrá satisfacer las demandas de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gloria is 35 years old and single.  She used to sell coconuts and corn on foot at one of the largest markets in the central zone.  In 1995 she was able to use her savings to open a small store within her home.

Now she manages her small store and has steady customers.  Most of her neighbors buy from her.  Gloria is characterized as one who puts forth a lot of effort and this is how she obtained everything she has.  One of her dreams is to have a bit larger store where she can have more merchandise and can attract more customers.

She is asking for this loan in order to stock her store with food, drinks, noodles, and various other items in order to satisfy her customer demand.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Amir

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 22 years old, married and has two children.

Amir has been an owner of a workshop since 2008 where he sells and repairs auto electrical parts. He has a good experience in this field and a good reputation and he is becoming well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $2400 loan in order purchase electric-car equipement and to add more inventories. He is aiming to earn more profit to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to purchase an electric-car equipment and to add more inventories.

loans.name: Tugirubukire B / Rbv Group

texts.fr: Wellars est né  au Rwanda.et il est membre du groupe Tugirubukire. Il est marié, il  a   26 ans, il a 1enfant de 5 mois. Il  a deux ans des études secondaires. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter 1 hectare de champ ,200 kgs de pommes de terre, 8kgs d’engrais et payer la main d’œuvre. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’augmenter la production en utilisant des engrais chimique pour récolte plus beaucoup en fin de satisfaire le marché. Pour ses ambitions il voudrait être un grand agriculteur connu dans sa région, et bâtir sa propre maison d’habitation et sa famille.
texts.en: Wellars is born in Rwanda. He is a member of the Tugirubukire group. He is married. He is 26 years old. He has one 5-month old child. He has finished two years of secondary studies. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use his credit to purchase 1 ha [about 2.5 acres] of land, 200 kgs [440 lbs] of potatoes, 8 kg [18 lbs] of fertilizers and pay for labor. His business strategy is increasing the production and using chemical fertilizers in order to have a much larger harvest and meet the demand. As to his goals, he would like to become a regionally known farmer and build his own house for his family to live in.

loans.use: to pay for 1 ha [about 2.5 acres] of land, 200 kgs [440 lbs] of potatoes, 8 kg [18 lbs] of fertilizers  and the cost of labor.

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.en:
Being a father, Leoncio Jr. is responsible to provide for all his family's needs and prepare for the future of his children. Likewise, Leoncio Jr. is responsible for feeding his family and sending his children to school. He is now 51 years old and has three children. One of them is still in college while the rest are already married. They own and manage a small eatery inside the public market cooking and selling food for meals and snacks. Together with his wife, they continuously manage the business for almost 10 years now earning profits of 8,000 PHP a month which they utilize for their food and allowances for their children.

They plan to improve the business to satisfy their customers' needs and to also increase their income, but due to inadequate capital, he is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients, pork, fish, vegetables and spices to cook and sell in the market. He hopes that the loan will help to improve the business, as they work hard for improvement.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients (pork, fish, vegetables and spices) to cook and sell in the market.

location.town: Sto.Domingo St. DMP, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: El señor Guillermo, está empleado como auxiliar de oficina en una Institución religiosa de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo requiere para la cubrir gastos de exámenes médicos personales. Vive en alquiler en una casa ubicada en la zona  central en la ciudad de La Paz;  es casado  y  tiene  un hijo. Es  la primera vez que Guillermo tiene un crédito en IMPRO y por el carácter social de ayuda se lo canaliza a través de Kiva y sus financiadores.
texts.en: Guillermo is employed as an office assistant in a religious institution in the city of La Paz.  He needs the loan to cover some personal medical expenses.  He lives in a rented house located in the central zone of the city of La Paz.  He’s married and has a son.  This is the first time that Guillermo has an IMPRO loan and because of its social characteristics it’s being channeled through Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: to pay for some needed medical tests.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 21 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, with one of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Lilian has been working hard to manage her salon, which does specialty cuts and hairdressing for local women. 

To help expand her business, Lilian has requested a loan of 350,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy supplies for hair extensions and braids, and will help Lilian to generate greater profits and take care of herself. Lilian hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Lilian is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Lilian's future prospects by helping her to improve her business knowledge.

loans.use: to buy supplies for hair extensions and braids

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
La señora Maria tiene 44 años y tres hijos.

Ella tiene 12 años de ser comerciante, inicio vendiendo pupusas, mariscos y hoy en día comercializa con ropa, ya que obtiene mayores ganancias. Fue su hermano quien le enseño este negocio.

La señora Maria, vende ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Ella debe viajar mucho ya que recorre durante la semana tres ciudades, ya que los vende en un mercado de una ciudad dos veces a la semana, luego se traslada una vez por semana a otra ciudad a vender y los otros dos días va hacia otra ciudad del oriente del país. Ella sale desde las 6:00 de la  mañana con uno de sus hijos quien le ayuda a vender y regresan hasta la tarde, para salir de nuevo a vender la ropa a los caseríos aledaños y a sus amigas, ella va de casa en casa a pie, cargando la mercadería para irla ofreciendo, ya que no cuenta con un medio de transporte.

Ella solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar más ropa y de diferentes estilos y también comprara calzado, para revenderlo ya que lo demandan mucho sus clientes y deja buena ganancia y su hijo podrá andar una parte de la mercadería.

De esta forma, ella podrá ofrecer mayores opciones a su clientes teniendo mas estilos y tallas, ya que su inventario es muy poco y lo vende rápido, además podrá llegar a más caseríos cercanos a su comunidad. La señora Maria espera obtener más ingresos y cancelar el crédito, así como el llevar alimentación a su familia.

Ella esta en proceso de negociar un puesto de venta en el mercado. Para tener  un lugar más estable, sin necesidad de trasladarse a pie casa por casa para vender la mercadería, también desea que sus hijos puedan tener su propio negocio.
texts.en:
María, 44, has three children.  She’s been a merchant selling pupusas and seafood for the last 12 years.  At present, though, she sells clothes because they produce higher profits.  Her brother taught her this business.

María sell clothes for women, men and children.  She must travel long distances during the week to three cities because she sells in one of the city’s markets twice a week then goes once a week to another city to sell and the remaining days she goes to another city in the east of the country.  She leaves home at 6am with one of her children who helps her sell and they return in the late afternoon to then go out again to sell clothes in the adjacent hamlets and to her girlfriends.  She goes house to house on foot carrying the merchandise to offer it since she does not have any means of transportation.

She asks Fundación Campo for a loan to buy more clothes in assorted styles and also to buy footwear to resell since many customers are asking for it and it produces good profits and her son can sell some of the merchandise.  In this way, she can offer more options to her customers having more styles and sizes available since her inventory is small and she sells out quickly.  Besides, she’ll be able to reach more nearby settlements.  María hopes to earn more income and repay the loan as well as provide food for her family.

She’s in the process of negotiating for a sales stand in the market to have a more stable place and not have to go on foot door to door to sell her merchandise; she also wants her children to have their own business.

loans.use: to buy assorted clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.es:
Genesis es un grupo solidario muy independiente y responsable y se encuentra en su 1° ciclo. Esta conformado por 6 mujeres muy inteligentes, las cuales se dedican al comercio y de esa manera ayudan a sus familias a salir adelante. Ellas le pusieron al grupo Genesis, ya que todas están de acuerdo en que  era un nombre bonito. Sus reuniones estan ubicadas en el municipio de Monterrey, N.L. 
Xochitl es una joven y astuta integrante del grupo, tiene 39 años, es soltera, y se dedíca a la venta de diversos artículos como ropa, calzado y juguetes en el mercado rodante. Ella eligió esta actividad porque le gusta y es muy buena vendedora, además de ser un gran apoyo para ella con los gastos que tiene en su casa y con su familia.
Con el prestamo que resivió Xochitl desea seguir invirtiendo en mercancía y así poder elevar mas sus  ventas.
Una de las metas de Xochitl es triunfar en la venta de sus productos y mejorar su puesto y de esa manera sobresalir en la vida.
texts.en:
“Genesis” is a solidarity group that is starting its first loan cycle. This independent and responsible group consists of six intelligent women who engage in the retail trade in order to help their families get ahead. The members decided to call their group “Genesis” because they were all in agreement that it was a beautiful name. Their meetings are conducted in the town of Monterrey, Nuevo Leon.

Xochitl is a young woman who is an astute member of the group. She is 39 years old, single, and sells different products such as clothing, shoes, and toys at the flea market. Xochitl chose this business because she enjoys it and is very good saleswoman. In addition, it helps her with paying for the household and family expenses.

The loan reserved for Xochitl will be invested in merchandise so that she can increase her sales even more. One of the goals she has is to successfully sell her products so that she can improve her vending post and move forward in life.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and toys.

loans.name: Jason

texts.en: Jason is married with one kid. He is 25 years old, residing in Poblacion Panaon, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, Jason operates his own motor cab in his barangay (village). He has had this business for more than 4 years. Each month, he earns 6,000 PHP doing this type of work. Jason has requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and for maintenance. Jason has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, he hopes to finish educating his child.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and for maintenance

loans.name: Tawopaneh Ii Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you members of the “Tawopaneh II” group from Magburaka. They are small-business people who are based in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of 700,000.00 SLL for each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Osman. Osman is age 30 and was born in a small town called Mile-Ninety-One. He is married to a businesswoman and they have two children – one is in primary school and the other is not of school age.  

Osman sells fish. He has been running this business for 10 years now. He will use his share of this loan to buy several baskets of fish for sale.

loans.use: to buy several baskets of fish for sale.

loans.name: Elsa Evangelina

texts.es:
La señora Elsa y su esposo tienen tres hijos los cuales ya están creciendo y necesitan su espacio. Tiene una niña que desean que ella tenga su privacidad en la casa, además de que una parte de la casa es de madera y quieren reforzarla porque en la temporada de lluvia se les ocasionan ciertos problemas. Desean proteger a su familia de enfermedades y que tengan su patrimonio mejor y seguro para ello. 
Dona Elsa esta estudiando un curso de belleza para después iniciar un negocio y su esposo es empleado de una tienda.
texts.en: Señora Elsa and her husband have 3 children who are growing up and need their own space. They want their daughter to have some privacy in the house. In addition, part of the house is made of wood and they want to reinforce it as during the rainy season it causes them problems. They want to protect their family from disease as well as improve and make secure their children's inheritance for them. Don Elsa is studying a beauty course in order to start a business and her husband works in a store.

loans.use: to extend the ground floor and start on the construction of a bedroom.

loans.name: Betza Betzabe

texts.es: La señora Betza es una cliente nueva se dedica al ensamblado de computadoras como también al cableado de red de distintas oficinas,  solicita crédito para la compra de cables y partes para realizar su trabajo de ensamblado de computadoras, la Sra. Betza es casada y tiene una hija pequeña, su esposo también se dedica a lo que es el cableado y armado de computadoras, pero su esposo esta en otro departamento realizando este trabajo por contrato para una institución , viven en casa familiar y tienen su oficina en un lugar céntrico de la ciudad de La Paz, La Sra. Betza es una persona joven con ganas de superación desea con el tiempo crecer en su negocio y de esta manera incrementar sus ganancias, se siente muy feliz y agradecida por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Betza is a new member that works assembling computers and installing network cables at different offices, she requests a loan to purchase cables and parts for computers, Betza is married and has a small daughter, her husband also works setting up network cables and assembling computers, but he is in a different department working on a contract with a different institution, they live at home and have their office in a central location of the city of La Paz, Betza is a young person with hopes to improve and wishes to grow her business over time and this way increase her income, she is very happy and thankful for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy cables for network connections

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita is a 60 year old widow, and a mother of five children. She lives in Labo, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. She owns and operates a farm where she plants, harvests and sells corn to earn a living.  She has been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP. 

Leonita has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. She has been a member of GDMPC for almost five years. In the future, she wants to purchase general farm supplies & equipment for the improvement of her farm land.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Javzandulam

texts.en:
Javzandulam, 38, sells beautification commodities such as bandeaux, earrings, etc. She has been doing her business since 2003 and has gained a lot of experience in her business field. 

She lives with her mother and her younger daughter in a boundary district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her business has been running during the last several years and she has bought a car from her earnings in the last year. Now this car is used as a taxi by her husband’s business. 

Now Javzandulam needs some money to purchase more beautification commodities from her suppliers for sale during the coming holidays because during the coming traditional celebrations, there will be much more sales activity in the markets of Mongolia. It is a beneficial and big chance to increase her income for the year. 

The loan she is taking will be dedicated to purchasing a large number of commodities for increasing her sales.

loans.use: To purchase a large number of commodities for increasing her sales.

loans.name: Melati Group

texts.en:
This is the fourth loan for the Melati group. Two of the members couldn’t attend the meeting because they had to attend a ceremony at the temple. 

The group is taking out a new loan to continue their businesses. Although in the last period their pigs were attacked by diseases, they still keep their spirit to run this business. They hope this period will be better. The vet suggested how to give more nutritious feed and vitamins. 

Ni Ketut will use the loan to purchase two superior piglets. She hopes she can earn more profit this time and  will use all of it to support her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase two superior piglets.

loans.name: Sofia Esther

texts.es:
La señora Sofía tiene 30 años, ella vive en la zona sur de Honduras, junto con ella vive sus 2 hijos y su esposo quien le apoya en su actividad, trabajo que viene realizando desde hace 3 años. Su negocio lo hace de manera ambulante, en su aldea como también en aldeas aledañas, ya que tiene muchas personas con las que trabaja desde hace muchos años. El crédito lo necesita para la compra de: pantalones, blusas, camisas, camisetas, bóxer, calzonetas, cortinas, faldas etc. el impacto esperado con el financiamiento, es incrementar sus venta ya que comprara una variedad de productos para satisfacer a demanda de sus clientes, y así poder generarse mejores ingresos.
Los planes a futuro de Sofía son seguir creciendo en su actividad, como también darles una buena educación a sus hijos y enviarlos a la universidad.
Choluteca, Honduras – Mayo del 2012.

loans.use: Para la compra de pantalones, blusas, camisas, camisetas, bóxer, calzonetas, cortinas, faldas etc. para su negocio

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua sells maize porridge. She lives together with her 4 children in Nyame Bekyere. Ekua has been selling maize porridge for 4 years now. She uses her income to feed and clothe their children.

Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize to prepare her porridge for sale. With the new profit, Ekua will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to prepare her porridge for sale

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Meet Agnes, a mother of two who has been farming in a small village in Kerugoya, Kenya, for the last seven years. She generates income selling milk, eggs, and tea, produced at her farm. Over the years, Agnes has found that the most enjoyable thing about her work is making her clients happy with her good quality products,  while generating income in the process.  However, lack of sufficient capital is the biggest challenge that bars her from attaining the pinnacles she plans to reach.  

Agnes is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. A typical cow, she is looking to buy, produces an average of 15 to 20 litres every  day. This amount of milk will greatly boost her sales volume. The money from the sales of the additional milk will enable her to pay her loan obligation without any trouble, and still manage to save some money for other uses. Your loan will help Agnes generate enough income to comfortably deal with farming expenses, which currently constitute the highest of her monthly expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Jesus'mide 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUS'MIDE 1 est composé de six personnes qui sont des amies. Martine, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 44 ans est mariée à un maçon du nom de Thomas. Le couple a six enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par Martine et son mari. Martine n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour y arriver, Martine vend des du riz et du pain à son domiclie depuis quinze ans. Martine vend également des boissons de façon secondaire, ce qui lui permet de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa famille. Martine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Martine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUS'MIDE 1, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du pain, du riz et des boissons.

loans.name: Bidossessi Group

texts.fr: BIDOSSESSI est un groupe composé de quatre  personnes qui vivent dans le même quater. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Matilde Patricia est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Matilde Patricia est âgée de 45 ans a très fréquenté l’école. Matilde Patricia est mariée à certain Alphonse. Le couple a deux enfants, tous  scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Matilde Patricia et son mari. Pour cette raison, Matilde Patricia vend du maïs etdu sorgho dans sa région depuis dix ans environ ; ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Matilde Patricia s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Matilde Patricia sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe BIDOSSESSI, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs et du sorgho.

loans.name: Léa Amélévi

texts.fr: LEA est une femme âgée de 41 ans, mariée et mère de quatre enfants vivant tous au quartier Zanguéra situé à l’extrême sud d’Adidogomé. Depuis 2010,elle a entamé la vente de boule d’akassa et de boisson alcoolisée qu’elle a abandonné au profit de la vente des éponges et des chaussures jugés plus rentables, et donc s’approvisionne une fois par mois.LEA sollicite un crédit pour augmenter son stock afin d’être plus compétitive vue que sur son lieu d’activité génératrice de revenue d’autres personnes aussi se battent pour mieux faire plus qu’elle ;sur ce elle compte gagner plus de bénéfices pour aider son foyer à mieux s’épanouir.
texts.en: Léa is a 41-year-old married mother to four children. They all live within Zanguéra district to the far south of Adidogomé. In 2010, she started selling bowls of akassa (a thick cornmeal porridge) and alcoholic beverages which she later abandoned in favour of selling sponges and shoes, which are more profitable. She purchases her supplies once per month. Léa is requesting this loan in order to increase her stock so that she can better compete alongside the other vendors who are trying to outdo her. She plans on earning larger profits so that she can better support her household.

loans.use: to purchase nine hair rollers and 10 dozen flyswatters

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 32 years old. He is married to Martha who is also a farmer, and they are blessed with 1 child, called Anna who is 5 years old. 

He has had a dairy business for 3 years, currently earning a monthly income of KES. 15,000. He has borrowed KES. 40,000 from VisionFund Kenya, as his second loan after paying the previous loan successful. 

He will be using the loan to purchase animal feeds. Therefore he hopes that the anticipated profit, will help him to buy food for his family, pay school fees for his kids, cater for medical care.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to enjoy an improved life with his wife and kids.

loans.use: to purchase animal feeds

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli, her husband and their three children live in Monclova, Coahuila. With the prime goal of helping her husband with the family costs she opened a shoe and clothing store some 12 years ago, a good match for her because she loves sales and is a proficient saleswoman. Throughout the years Araceli has kept up her business with much effort and dedication. And through this business she has been able to provide education for her three children.

In order to keep the business growing she needs a loan of $925 to purchase seasonal clothing and shoes. She plans to repay the loan within three months. It is important for Araceli and her family to have your support.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Araceli, su esposo y sus tres hijos, viven en la localidad de Monclova, Coahuila. Con él propósito fundamental de ayudar a su esposo con el gasto familiar, hace 12 años que ella comenzó con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa y calzado, aprovechando el tener gusto y facilidad para las ventas. A lo largo de estos años Araceli con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha mantenido su negocio, y de ésta manera también ha logrado costear el estudio de sus hijos, pues los tres son estudiantes.

Para seguir creciendo ella requiere de un préstamo de $925 dólares para poder comprar ropa y zapatos de temporada, planeando cubrirlo en su totalidad en un plazo de 3 meses. Es importante para Araceli y su familia el apoyo que tú puedes brindarles, vuélvete parte de sus logros.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys has had experience in this business for the past eight years. With the help of a small loan she opened a store inside her home and started to add office and school supplies bit by bit. She had to dedicate more time to her newly born daughter and then to school. Currently Gladys works from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. every day of the week.

Gladys wants to use her loan to buy school supplies to meet the demand of the people in the neighborhood. This will also increase her income and the wellbeing of her family.

Gladys is 28 years old and is married with two daughters, one of whom goes to school. Her husband is a collector for a company that sells home products outside of the city. He helps her with the business in his free time. They are a very united couple ready to work in order to give their children a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Ari Þór Vilhjálmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Gladys tiene una experiencia en el comercio desde hace ocho años. Con un préstamo pequeño que realizó inicio una tienda en su misma casa la cual tuvo que poco a poco fue incluyendo productos de oficina y escolares. Ella tuvo que dedicar más tiempo a su hija que recién nació y luego a la escuela. Actualmente doña Gladys labora desde las 7AM hasta las 22PM todos los días de la semana

Gladys desea invertir su préstamo en la compra de útiles escolares y así cumplir con las necesidades de la gente del sector. Además esto le significaría mayores ingresos para bienestar de su familia y seguridad de su local.

Gladys es casada tiene 28 años y dos niñas de las cuales una estudia. Su esposo es recaudador de una empresa de venta de artículos para el hogar fuera de la ciudad y en sus ratos libres el la apoya en su negocio. Ellos son una pareja muy unida dispuesta a trabajar para poder darles a sus hijos un mejor bienestar

loans.use: Purchase school supplies

loans.name: Me

texts.en: Me is a thirty-six year old woman and is happily married.  She has three children. In order to support her family financially, Me’s husband works at his small plantation while Me runs a small shop in front of her house where she supplies basic household items and snacks to the local villagers.  Profits from Me’s shop have had to be used to buy basic tools and seeds for her husband’s plantation, so Me sometimes relies on micro-loan facilities to be able to finance an inventory purchase.  With a strong history of repayment in full, Me is again applying for a small loan to re-stock her shop so that she can maintain a consistent supply for the local villagers.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to re-stock her shop

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La Sra. Patricia C. se dedica a la oficio de corte y confesión: Tengo ya más de un año en este trabajo de costurera cuando tengo mas trabajo es en el regreso a clases ya que tengo varios contratos en varias escuelas para hacer los uniformes. Gracias a dios este año he tenido suficiente trabajo pero me esta haciendo falta una maquina de coser. y así contratar a alguien para sacar los pedidos que tengo de uniformes. Solicito un préstamo de $1,000.00 Dlls. Para la compra de una maquina de coser.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Ms. Patricia C. works hard as a dressmaker: I have already been in this dressmaking job more than a year. When I have more work it is when I go to the classrooms since I have contracts in various schools to make uniforms. Thanks to the Lord this year I’ve had enough work but what I need is a sewing machine; I hire someone to take the orders I have for the uniforms. I’m looking for $1000 to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase Shop Stocks

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a 27-year-old mother of one and a resident of the Kisiwani area in Dar es Salaam city. She has been running a salon for the past three years. She now wants to expand her quite small salon, so as to cater to more customers at a time. She wants to buy more dryers, chairs, and other hair treatment equipment. She is in need of U.S. $375 to help accomplish at least part of this.

loans.use: To buy equipment to expand her beauty salon

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Jeannette S. E., 52, is a widow. She lives in Sassandra, a rural town on the south-west coast of Cote d'Ivoire and sells used clothes in Sassandra market. Jeannette lives alone as all her 3 children have left Sassandra and live in other towns. She runs this business to provide for herself and pay for her daily needs.

Jeannette has been in the AE&I microcredit program for 2 years and has performed very well. She is well-organized and attentive to detail in running her business.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to re-sell in the market

loans.name: Khatin

texts.en: Khatin I. is a 51-year-old woman, who owns her small business in the Imishli region. She sells dairy products and breeds calves for meat production. She has seven years of experience in this field. She is married and has four children. Khatin says her one dairy cow and one calf do not generate enough income to care for her family. She is requesting a loan of $1000 so she can purchase 3 calves and fodder and increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase three calves

loans.name: Abdurauf

texts.en:
A. Abdurauf is 29 years old. He is married with three kids.

Abdurauf provides transportation services for passengers. Initially he started as a driver. Over time he saved sufficient funds and purchased a minivan that he has used until now for providing services. Having the stable business Abdurauf is working hard in order to support his family and make savings.

Abdurauf needs to purchase spare parts for his minivan. At the same time Abdurauf needs some additional funds for purchasing one more minivan. In order to achieve all this Abdurauf requests 800.00 US dollars for the term of 12 months. A previous loan by Abdurauf was paid back in a timely manner, and now he promises to manage the loan with accuracy and thanks all for support.

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts for repair and also purchasing of one more minivan.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Eusebio has had his grocery store for more than forty years. He has dedicated over half of his life to running this business. Luckily, he has always been able to count on the support and help of his wife and children. When Eusebio moved to Matucana he could not find a stable job, which is why he chose to open a shop in his home so that he could support the future and education of his two children, who were still young at the time. He invests part of his profits back into the business and the rest goes towards him and his wife, now that his children have their own families and have moved out of the family home. Eusebio would like to develop his store in order to achieve greater sales and in the future, take on an employee to run the shop.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Hace más de cuarenta años que Eusebio tiene su bodega. Ha dedicado más de la mitad de su vida al manejo de este negocio. Felizmente ha contado siempre con la ayuda de su esposa y de sus hijos. Al mudarse a Matucana no encontró un trabajo estable, fue por esto que se animó a abrir una tienda en su casa para poder mantenerla y para poder también darle educación a sus dos hijos, en ese entonces pequeños aún. Una parte de lo que gana de su trabajo lo vuelve a invertir y otra parte lo destina para el y su esposa, ya que sus hijos han formado una familia y son independientes. Lo que le gustaría a Eusebio es implementar más su bodega para lograr tener más ventas y en el futuro poder contratar una persona que trabaje encargándose de la tienda.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Amina's Sele Bosi Group

texts.en:
Amina is 35 years old and is a married woman with 1child, age 15 years old. She and her husband also take care of 2 other people, ages 40 and 50 years old. Amina owns a small grocery store that she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 11am to 1pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Amina S., who sells food.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria is separated from her husband and has three children. She began her business to keep herself busy and active when she found herself sad and depressed due to her separation, as well as in order to have an independent income. She decided to sell cosmetic products approximately eight years ago after an invitation from a friend.

Now, she needs a loan of US $900 which she will repay in 5 months in order to purchase merchandise and increase her inventory, and therefore increase her sales. With your support, Maria will continue to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

María esta separada de su esposo, y tiene 3 hijos. Inició el negocio por tristeza, por depresión, después de la separación con su aun esposo, para mantenerse ocupada en algo, para mantenerse activa y tener su ingreso independiente . Comenzó hace 8 años aproximadamente, mediante la invitación de una amiga, así fue como se decidió a vender productos cosméticos.

Ahora ella necesita un préstamo por US $900 que pagara en 6 meses, para comprar mercancía e incrementar su inventario y así aumentar sus ventas. Con tu apoyo María seguirá progresando.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Yawotse

texts.fr:
Yawotse D. is 29 years old, married and father of two children. He buys and resells gas in Adeta, a village located about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. With this second loan from FECECAV, Yawotse would like to buy more gas to resell given that demand is constantly growing. The profits from his business will allow him to manage the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Yawotse D. est âgé de 29 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il achète et revend de l’essence à Adeta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Avec ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV, Yawotse souhaite acheter plus d’essence pour la revente étant donné que la demande ne cesse de croître. Les bénéfices de son commerce lui permettront de supporter les besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase fuel for resale

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T., aged 40, is the owner of a wedding-dress and makeup service shop in Hung Yen Town, Nghe An Province. She has two children, both of whom are still in school. Mrs. T. joined TYM Fund in 1997 and has been investing all the loans since the first round in her shop. For ten years, due to Mrs. T.’s effective investment, her shop has become very well-known in the area. Besides the wedding service, Mrs T. and her husband also provide photocopy and photo services. As a result, their average income has increased and become much more stable than ever. In the next round of loan, Mrs. T. hopes for a loan of 10.000.000 VND ($600) to purchase more wedding dresses and cosmetic products for her shop to meet customers’ demand. Her family’s monthly income is 4.000.000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Ngô Thị Tuyến năm nay 40 tuổi, chị hiện là chủ của hàng cho thuê váy cưới và dịch vụ trang điểm cô dâu tại huyện Hưng Nguyên Tỉnh Nghệ an. Gia đình chị hiện có 2 con đang tuổi đi học.Chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1997. Từ vòng vốn đầu tiên đến nay gia đình chị đều đầu tư vào cửa hàng. Qua 10 năm sử dụng vốn vay có hiệu quả gia đình chị hiện có 1 cửa hàng phục vụ các dịch vụ cưới hỏi rất quy mô tại địa phương. Ngoài thời gian làm dịch vụ cưới hỏi anh chị còn làm thêm nghề phôtcoppy và chụp ảnh vì thế thu nhập của gia đình luôn ổn định và ngày càng phát triển. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay thêm 10.000.000đ để mua thêm váy cưới mới và các dụng cụ phục vụ cho công việc đáp ứng tốt hơn nhu cầu của khách hàng trong mùa cưới năm nay.

Thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Invest in beauty salon

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida is a forty-two-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She rears kuku for sale. Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. What are kuku, you may ask? Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular because they require little startup capital, require little space, and their eggs can be sold or eaten. Saida is assisted in her poultry business by one employee, her husband, and her children. Her monthly profit is approximately 120 USD. She is seeking a 275 USD loan to purchase additional chicks and feed that she hopes will help her breed more chickens for sale.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; because of this, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan, a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional chicks and feed

loans.name: Thi Thanh's Group

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn thị Thanh Ms 09020033 năm nay 57 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng bố mẹ chồng, chồng, 2 con. Để nuôi dạy các con ăn học 2 vợ chồng chị rất vất vả : làm ruộng, nuôi lợn, bò, gà, đi chợ thu mua phế liệu.... Chính vì vậy mà chị rất thích hình thức vay, trả của Bình Minh cdc nên chị đăng ký tham gia và hoàn trả rất tốt. Chu kỳ II này chị lại tiếp tục đăng ký vay mức 3.808.000 VND để mua gà giống, hàng ngày chị đi chợ sắt vụn và chồng chị chăn nuôi nên thu nhập bình quân từ 120.000 VND đến 150.000 VND/ ngày. Các thành viên khác trong nhóm :

  • chị D. thị Bình Ms 09020028 vay mức 3.808.000 VND để đi chợ thịt
  • chị Trần thị Lan Ms 09020037 vay mức 2.242.000 VND để mua cám lợn và đi chợ ( Trả trong 25 tuần )
    • chị Nguyễn thị Tảo Ms 09020038 vay mức 1.534.000 VND để thêm vốn mua cám lợn ( Trả trong 25 tuần )
  • chị Nguyễn thị Tình Ms 09020032 vay mức 3.808.000 VND để kinh doanh vật liệu xây dựng
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi Thanh (ID: 09020033), aged 57, is currently living with her parents-in-law and her two children. To support her two children who are still in school, she and her husband have to do a wide range of work- from farming, breeding pigs, cows, and chickens to collecting wastes. Mrs. Thanh is very interested in the loan method, so she joined the program. And she has been very on time in paying back the loans. In the next round of loan, Mrs. Thanh would like to borrow 3.808.000 VND to buy chickens and breed them. Collecting wastes and raising poultries help her family earn about 120.000 VND-150.000 VND per day. Other members in her group include: -Mrs. Duong Thi Binh (ID: 09020028) would like to borrow 3.808.000 VND to buy meat and sell it in the farmer market. -Mrs. T. Thi Lan (ID: 09020037) would like to borrow 2.242.000 VND to buy food for the pigs and go to the farmer market (paying back in 25 weeks) -Mrs. Nguyen Thi Tao (ID: 09020038) would like to borrow 1.534.000 VND to buy food for the pigs (paying back in 25 weeks) -Mrs. Nguyen Thi Tinh (ID: 09020032) would like to borrow 3.808.000 VND to buy and sell construction materials.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: vốn chăn nuôi

loans.name: Vaitoa

texts.en: Vaitoa T., 27, is married with 2 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the taxi business. She sells to the public 6 days a week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).  SPBD loans are Vaitoa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used to repair the front rear window of the taxi, and to purchase tires, paint and car fuel. Her husband helps her in operating the business.

loans.use: to repair the front rear window of the taxi, and to purchase tires, paint and car fuel

loans.name: Lilia Magaly

texts.es: Con todo este año de experiencia en la venta de ropa por pedido, la señora Lilia, de 37 años, es la madre de 3 pequeños niños, de 16, 12 y 7 años de edad. Al cursar todos sus hijos el colegio, son su fortaleza para no claudicar a pesar de la dura competencia en el rubro. Ella sabe que parte esencial de un eventual éxito es con cuánto capital puede contar para su abastecimiento de ropa y posterior venta, teniendo como clara meta darle a sus hijos una sólida educación, de la mano con su esposo en casa, para lo cual lucha día a día en pos de lograrlo.nnPara ello, necesita de un préstamo de 400 soles, porque su sueño es llevado por la perseverancia y responsabilidad, gran legado que deja explícito hacia sus hijos.n
texts.en:
For the last year, Lilia, 37 years old and the mother of three children (ages 16, 12, and 7), has sold clothing. Because she is committed to sending her children to school, she has persevered despite tough competition in her field. She knows that an essential part of her future success depends on how much capital she has to invest in maintaining a supply of clothes. She and her husband have a clear goal of giving their children a solid education, and they work hard every day in order to achieve it. To help them accomplish their goal, she requests a loan of $150. Fulfilling her dream will take perseverance and responsibility, values that she will pass on to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on clothing for the upcoming Christmas season

loans.name: Kholiskhon

texts.en:
Kholiskhon I. is 40 years old. She is married with two children. She started her own business 10 years ago because her husband’s salary was not enough to meet their family's expenses. 

Kholiskhon sells candies, cookies and pastries in the local market. The income she generates allows Kholiskhon to support her large family, including her husband's parents, who live with her family. Kholiskhon dreams about providing all of her children with higher education. 

Today she is requesting 3600 Somoni for 12 months. She is going to spend the loan to expand the range of goods in her confectionary store. She is planning to spend the income to buy a private store, as well as for educating her children. 

Kholiskhon thanks everyone for their support and promises to repay the loan in time, as she has with her previous loan.

loans.use: Enlarge the range of goods purchase a private store

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas A. is married and has 6 dependents. He has received schooling up until the end of junior high. Since 1998, Thomas has been a taxi driver who uses his own vehicle to pick up passengers in Shama. Thomas uses his income to meet his family's financial needs. He will use the loan to buy a few spare parts to repair and maintain his vehicle. With the new profits from his expanded business, Thomas hopes to improve his children's education and also do things he has not been able to do because of his financial constraints.

loans.use: To buy spare vehicle parts

loans.name: Ni Luh Juliasih

texts.id: Memelihara babi merupakan pekerjaan sampingan yang memang dijalankan sebagian besar ibu-ibu di desa Perancak. Begitu pula dengan Luh Juliasih yang kesehariannya sebagai ibu rumah tangga juga memelihara babi di rumahnya sudah sejak lama. Hal ini tentu saja untuk menambah penghasilan keluarga disamping tentunya membantu suami di ladang. Penghasilan suaminya yang tidak menentu mengharuskan Luh Juliasih lebih giat lagi beternak babi sehingga kebutuhan keluarga bisa terpenuhi. Setelah mengikuti sosialisasi dari staf DINARI akhirnya Luh Juliasih memutuskan meminjam ke DINARI untuk meningkatkan modal usaha ternak babinya. Pinjaman pertama ini berjumlah Rp.3.750.000,- dengan jangka waktu 6 bulan dan pembayaran kembali akan dilakukan pada akhir periode pinjaman setelah babi dipanen. Untuk mengawali, Luh Juliasih berencana membeli 2 ekor bibit babi penggemukan dengan harga Rp.350.000,- per ekornya. Sedangkan sisa pinjaman akan digunakan untuk cadangan biaya pakan selama enam bulan kedepan. Setelah 5 bulan nanti Luh Juliasih berharap mendapatkan keuntungan Rp.500.000,- dari penjualan babinya termasuk babi yang dibelinya dengan modal sendiri. Hasil dari beternak babi ini memang cukup lumayan bisa memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga dan sekolah anak-anaknya.
texts.en:
Raising pigs are side job that is done by the majority of women in Perancak village. Same with Luh Juliasih who is regularly a housewife who also raised pigs around her house since a long time. This certainly helps the family income, besides helping her husband in the field. Her husband's income is uncertain, and that forced Luh Juliasih to work harder raising pigs, so that family needs could be fulfilled. After attending socialisation from DINARI staff, finally Luh Juliasih decided to borrow from DINARI to increase the capital of her pig farming. First loan was for Rp.3,750,000,- (translator's note: 1US$ fluctuates between Rp 10,000-12,000) for a 6 months period, and payment would be done at period end, after the pigs were sold. To start, Luh Juliasih plans to buy 2 piglets to fatten at Rp.350.000,- per piglet. The rest of the loan would be used as feed expenses for the next six months. After 5 months Luh Juliasih hopes to profit Rp.500,000,- from pig sales, including pigs bought with own funds. Profit from pig farming is sufficient to meet family needs and children schooling.

Translated from Indonesian by Gwan Ang, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pigs and it's feed

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is managing a sari-sari store (a community based store) business in their village.  Through her store, she was able to provide the basic needs of their family.  She wants her business to grow to further meet the needs of her family.  With this, she would like to ask for financial assistance amounting to PHP7,000.00.  This amount will be of great help in increasing her merchandise and in maintaining her electronic loading business.  Believing that through hard work and perseverance she will able to sustain her business and support all their needs someday.  She enjoys what she is doing right now and treasure every moment towards the development of her village store.        

Elena is 47 years old and still single.  She is the bread winner of the family and they live in a peaceful village and most of the people are hospitable and friendly.

loans.use: Increase in merchandise

loans.name: Tofig

texts.en: Tofig is 33 years old. He lives in the Khachmaz region in the Ashagi-Zeyid village. He is married and has two children. Five years ago he started a cattle breeding business. Now he needs a loan of 950 AZN to buy two calves to improve his cattle breeding business.

loans.use: To buy two calves.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama Y. has been a baker since 1997. She sells bread at Agona, near Elmina. Ama is married with two children and has received no formal education.

Her husband is currently on a pension. She is responsible for helping to financially support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family.

Her loan will be used to buy flour and other ingredients for the baking of bread. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest, in order to promote expansion of her trade.

loans.use: Buy flour to bake more bread.

loans.name: Vicente Manuel

texts.es: El Señor Vicente Manuel Álvarez tiene la edad de 40 años, su estado civil es soltero. Don Vicente tiene 1 hijo. La actividad económica de Don Vicente es la venta de mariscos. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio, Don Vicente inicio este negocio por que no conseguía un trabajo y decide realizar la venta de estos productos de manera ambulante. Los propósitos de Don Vicente son de mantener activo su negocio para darles la satisfacción necesaria a sus clientes. El financiamiento esta destinado para capital de trabajo por lo que podrá comprar conchas, camarones, pescados y los productos para la presentación de su venta. Los sueños de Vicente son de establecer su un local propio y brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Vicente Manuel Álvarez is 40-years old and single. He has one son. Vicente works selling seafood. He has done this for more than nine years. Vicente started his business because he couldn't find work and decided to start selling these products as a street vendor. Vicente's intentions are to keep his business growing to provide customer satisfaction. The loan funds will be used as working capital to buy shellfish, shrimp, fish and other items to sell. Vicente dreams of establishing his business in his own store and providing a better service.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Cette dame a appris le métier de la couture, elle confectionne des habits qu’elle vend, elle est mariée à un monsieur qui est maçon, elle a 02 enfants. L’activité qu’elle exerce lui permet d’aider son mari dans les charges du foyer. Ne disposant de machine pour pleinte, elle voudrait en acheter et demande à WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter  une machine pour pleinte.
texts.en:
This is a woman who learned how to sew as a trade, and she makes clothing that she sells. She is married to a gentleman who is a mason. She has two children. Her work enables her to assist her husband with household expenses. Lacking a "plinthe" sewing machine, she would like to buy one and is asking WAGES for her first loan to do so.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Elena, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Abiseo”, vive en el Jr. Soplin Vargas  Nº 260, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 42 años y es madre de 02 hijos estudiantes que aun dependen de ella.

Rosita, como le dicen de cariño, se inicio con un primer préstamo de S/. 400.00 y con el apoyo de su esposo, decidieron implementar su negocio de ventas de repuestos, también se dedican a arreglar motos, nos cuenta Rosita que sus ventas le va muy bien y no se equivocaron en escoger el rubro de ventas de repuestos que lo combinan muy bien con la venta de agua tratada para beber.
En la actualidad continua ejerciendo el mismo negocio, esta ubicado en un ambiente acondicionado en su propia casa, siendo sus principales clientes sus amigos, motocarristas y vecinos. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, comprara más repuestos de motos, aceites y lubricantes e insumos que le van a permitir atender con calidad y eficiencia a sus clientes. 

Ella y su esposo, toman las decisiones en las compras y  ganancias de su negocio, se siente más segura al ofrecer sus productos, se considera una mujer luchadora, constante y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.

Rosa Aurora, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Rosa Elena is a member of the Abiseo community bank. She lives at Jr. Soplin Vargas Nº 260, Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, Martín department. She is 42, married, and she has two dependent children who go to school. Rosita, as she is affectionately called, started with her first loan for 400 PEN and her husband’s help. They decided to start a business of selling replacement parts. They also fix motorcycles. Sales are going very well. They did not make a mistake in choosing to sell replacement parts, which goes very well with selling drinking water. They are still in the same business, which is located in a specially converted space in her home. Her primary customers are her friends, motorcycle drivers, and neighbors. With this loan for 2,000 PEN, she will buy more motorcycle replacement parts, oils, lubricants, and supplies that will allow her to tend to her customers with quality and efficiency. She and her husband make the decisions about purchases and earnings in her business. She feels very confident about offering her products. She is considered to be a fighter who is steadfast and responsible with her payments. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a businesswoman and a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy replacement part to augment her stock

loans.name: Olubisi

texts.en: Olubisi is 48 years old and married with a child. She sells medicine to make a living. She is requesting for a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther F. is 30 years old. She is married and the mother of two children. Both of her children are in school. She has been trading from a tabletop for five years. She prepares and sells corn dough, cassava dough, spices, vegetables and other food ingredients in the community market where she lives. She also sells dried fish and smoked fish. 

Esther purchases most of her goods from the main market of Kumasi and resells them at the community market. She has been struggling to buy more from the market. She requests a loan to buy foodstuffs like maize, cassava for the preparation of the dough, tomatoes, spices, etc. She hopes to turn her current business situation around. Esther belongs to a village bank called Prayer is the Key.

loans.use: To buy cassava, maize, spices, smoked fish, etc.

loans.name: Bakhtiniso

texts.en:
Bakhtiniso is a hard-working entrepreneur from Shahrituz, Tajikistan. Together with her husband, she has two children. She runs a business where she sells men’s shirts and clothing. Bakhtiniso started her business seven years ago and has run it with both extreme care and seriousness. Her daughters help Bakhtiniso with her business. It is an important source of income for her family of five considering that her husband does not earn enough money. 

Bakhtiniso has requested a loan of 3000 Somoni so that she can purchase more clothing. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to grow her business further and help feed her family.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing clothing for expanding the business

loans.name: Mrs. Kung Nhoem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-nine people living in Ta Reab DoU. S. village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan group, and they will use their loans for various purposes. Mrs. K. N. is the 48-year-old village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates both rice and vegetables. In her rice cultivation, she has some problems because she does not have rice seed and her field is infertile which affects her crop. In order to deal with these problems, she decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticides to support the rice field. Her husband, Mr. Sao Chhin, is a fisherman. This couple has five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school.

One member in this group has an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. EoT borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticides to support the rice field

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 40 year old married man and the father of 2 children. He has owned a phone sales shop since 2008 to earn income to help satisfy the needs of his family. Today, Hussein is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more supplies for his shop in order to attract new clients.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: P. makes rattan furniture. She is 29 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province, which is located about 200 km from the capital, Phnom Penh. She has two teenage children. She works hard every day to earn income. P. takes time two or three days each week to weave a set of rattan cupboards, which she sells when she is done. Her husband, who is a local fisherman, helps her to transport the finished products to customers' houses. P. also grows crops on her farm each year. She will use her loan as capital to plant various crops.

loans.use: To plant various crops

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Elena.
Maximiliana es casada, tiene 58 años y 6 hijos, Maximiliana tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hija mayor, además Maximiliana lleva panes, mantas a las minas.
Maximiliana necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pan y mantas.
Los sueños de Maximiliana son surtir su tienda y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is a client of the Banco Comunal Santa Elena. She is 58 years old, married and has six children. With the help of her oldest son, Maximiliana runs a store out of her home where she sells groceries such as fruits and vegetables. Additionally, she sells bread and cloaks in the mines.

Maximiliana needs a lone of 1050 soles in order to invest in more bread and cloaks. Her dream is to fully stock her store and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Shereef Zaki, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de pan y mantas.

loans.name: Justine's Group

texts.en:
Justine N. leads her lending group in Lugazi. She's hard working, determined and married with five children, who are in school. She also takes care of two siblings.

Justine sells fish and has done so from Busaana for five years. Her major challenge is catching enough fish. She is able to make 200,000 a month because of the quality of the fish she sells. She hopes to expand her business, provide a good education, health care and housing for her children. She needs a loan to buy more fish for resale.

loans.use: Buy more fish to resale.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en: Merlie G. is from the village of Manticao, Iligan City. She is 49 years old, is married, and has eight adult children. Merlie owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling bananas in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Merlie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita C. lives in the village of Brgy. Canmoros, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She is 59 years old, married and has three children who are 32 to 37 years old. Because of her determination, hard work and dedication to help her children finish their college education, she finally achieved this aspiration. Now she dreams to continue improving their quality of life, her most immediate objective being to buy one more motorcycle as a business asset and to repair their house in the future.

Once upon a time, Teresita was not sure if she and her husband would be able to provide well for their family. This was because she knew that her husband's income was just not enough to cover all the expenses of their family, which included the school expenses of their three children. This is why in January of 1991, Teresita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon so that she could borrow capital to start a business that could supplement her husband's earnings. She went through the necessary training seminar so that she could understand what was expected of her as an PD member. When she received her first loan, she started a general store adjacent to their family home. Because of its good location, it was able to earn a good income for her and her family.
