At the next opportunity to start another business, Teresita went into rice retailing, sold dried fish and even charcoal to expand her product offerings and increase her income potential. She even bought a motorcycle as another source of income. Now she earns an average of 20,000 Philippine pesos per month, which is really a respectable income for a rural location.

For her previous loan, she borrowed Php 20,000, which she used as additional capital for her businesses. Having paid that, while maintaining her good credit standing, Teresita is now borrowing for her 17th cycle loan the same amount, Php 20,000, to be used as revolving capital for her business. Any income will used to buy the new motorcycle that she dreams to add to her ever-growing income sources.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Phallin

texts.en:
Mrs. Phallin Y., 26, and her husband, Mr. Sokhom Noun, 38, have been married since 1996. They have three sons and one daughter, three of whom are in school; the youngest stays at home. The family lives in a small village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Phallin has been selling groceries from in front of her house for ten years. Her husband assists his wife in the business. Because their house is located near a garment factory, they also rent rooms in their house to garment factory workers.

In response to these workers’ needs, Phallin is requesting her first loan, 500 USD, to build more rooms to rent.

loans.use: To build more rooms to rent.

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Mrs. Sami O., 37, and her husband Mr. Sary Chren, 42 (pictured together), live in a small village outside Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They married in 1986 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. One of their children is married and lives in his own home while the other three currently attend school. 

Sami has been a garment factory worker for almost three years, while her husband has been a construction worker for five years. Sami would like to supplement her job by starting a business to raise cows. She will be able to earn extra income by selling the cows when they grow big enough. 
 
Sami is thus requesting her first loan of US$ 600 to purchase cows to raise.

loans.use: To purchase cows to raise.

loans.name: Oscar Javier

texts.es: Oscar Javier es un hombre que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. El tiene 39 años y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo, por lo que su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de mantenimiento y reparación de aires acondicionados,  el comenzó su negocio con un pequeño taller de refrigeración en su humilde vivienda ofreciendo sus servicios de mantenimiento de refrigeradora ciertos vecinos y algunas amistades, es así que poco a poco fue adquiriendo experiencia y obteniendo muchos clientes. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento porque instalara un equipo de refrigeración por lo que necesita ciertas herramientas necesarias. El sueña con establecer un taller y pueda proporcionar capacitación a personas que deseen aprender este medio de vida.
texts.en:
Oscar Javier is a man who really wants to get ahead. He is 39 years old and has 2 children in his care, his business provides maintenance and repair of air conditioners, he started his business with a small airconditioning workshop in his humble home offering his maintenance services for cooling units to certain neighbours and some friends, in this way little by little he gained experience and won many customers. At present he is asking for this financing because he is installing air conditioning equipment for which he needs certain necessary tools. He dreams about establishing a workshop and be able to provide training to people who want to learn this way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Marli

texts.es:
La señora Marli, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Gran Pajaten”, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 56 años y es madre de 02 hijos, 01 que aun dependen de ella y por los que cada día se empeña en seguir adelante.

Marli, se dedica a la venta de chorizos y cecinas, lleva 20 años trabajando con este negocio, se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Central de su Distrito, le va muy bien ya que tiene bastante acogida y sus clientes ya la conocen. Nos cuenta que a diario, tiene muy buenas ventas. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, comprará kilos de cecinas, chorizos y cecinas, para luego venderlos por kilos. 

Marli, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por haberme ayudado a salir adelante y a iniciar mi negocio con un capital, ahora me siento una mujer realizada y capaz”.
texts.en:
Marli belongs to the El Gran Pajaten Communal Bank in the San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 56, single, and has two children. One is still dependent upon her. It is for them that she makes the effort everyday to get ahead. Marli sells sausages and beef jerky. She has been working in this business for 20 years. It is located in the Central Market in her district. It is going very well for her, it is well received, and she is well known to the customers. She tells us that she has very good sales everyday. She currently continues with the same business. She personally waits on her customers with her characteristic charisma. She will use this loan for 3,000 PEN to buy kilos of jerky and sausage to later sell by the kilo. Marli is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for, “Having helped me get ahead and have some capital to start my business. I now feel like a capable and fulfilled woman.”

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy jerky and sausage

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita S.'s main source of income comes from making and selling snacks and delicacies in her community. She is 50 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin province. Carmelita has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Carmelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to to purchase ingredients needed to make products for sale. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of sheet metal

loans.name: Hâm

texts.en:
Mrs. S., 41, has established a medium-sized stone house, where she lives with other family members. It is located in Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She currently stays at home to either care for the kids or to do housework.

S. is a widow and the mother of three teenage children, two of whom are learning in school and the other one is employed. The entire family is dependent on S.’s daughter, who is an employee in the Casino Club, earning $250 per month.

S.’s daughter always finds it hard commuting to work because she doesn’t have a vehicle. Because of this, S. is asking for a loan to be used to purchase a motorcycle, which will allow her daughter to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her daughter to use for commuting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more beans, rice, sugar and salt in bulk.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a 42-year-old single mother of two children. She is the breadwinner for her family and looks after the four people she lives with. Currently, she resides in a rented house in Hoima town, Uganda where she operates a bar.

Annet has been in her business for ten years and, over the years, it has grown with the help of the loan facilities from HOFOKAM and contributions from her farming and she has been able to construct a house in her village. Even then she says she hopes to set up a grocery as she grows older which, she says, would suit her advancing age.

The purpose of the loan is to buy alcohol and soft drinks to sell in her bar.

loans.use: To buy more alcohol and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Melvin Leonel

texts.es:
El señor Melvin Leonel C. V., es propietario de una panadería ubicada en el barrio la Florida, tiene dos trabajadores los cuales le elaboran el pan y el se encarga de la entrega del pan en las diferentes pulperías en una camionetita de su propiedad.

El señor Melvin C. es casado con cuatro hijos de los cuales solo dos dependen de él, los otros dos ya son independientes.
texts.en:
El señor Melvin Leonel C. V., es propietario de una panadería ubicada en el barrio la Florida, tiene dos trabajadores los cuales le elaboran el pan y el se encarga de la entrega del pan en las diferentes pulperías en una camionetita de su propiedad. El señor Melvin C. es casado con cuatro hijos de los cuales solo dos dependen de él, los otros dos ya son independientes.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de materia para la elaboración del pan

loans.name: Zesar

texts.es: EL SR. ZESAR  ES CASADO, ES COCHABAMBINO NACIO EL 30 DE JULIO DE 1978, EN COCHABAMBA,  TIENE SU PARSELA EN SAN LUIS EN LA BANDA DEL RIO EN LA CUAL SIEMBRA PAPA,Y AJI Y EL PERSONALMENTE LO LLEVA A VENDER A SUCRE, EL AJI PICANTE ES UN PRODUCTO MUY CONSUMIDO EN SUCRE PARA LA ELABORACION DE SUS COMIDAS YA QUE LE PONEN MUCHO AJI PICANTE EN LA MAYORIA DE SUS PLATILLOS TRADICIONALES COMO EL PICANTE MIXTO, SALTEÑAS MONDONGO Y LA FRITANGA. HACE 3 AÑOS QUE VIENE TRABAJANDO CON EMPRENDER EL ES UN BUEN CLIENTE PAGA PUNTUAL SUS CUOTAS, PORQUE ELLOS SON 3 HERMANOS Y SE AYUDAN ENTRE ELLOS PARA NO TENER ATRAZOS, LOS TRES HERMANOS TRABAJAN EN LA AGRICULTURA, EL SR. CESAR ESTA CASADO Y TIENE HIJOS PEQUEÑOS, ES MUY TRABAJADOR Y SIEMPRE ESTA PENSANDO QUE PRODUCTOS SEMBRAR SEGUN A LA TEMPORADA DE SIEMBRA, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA SEMILLAS PARA LA SIEMBRA DE PAPA ESTE PRODUCTO  TIENE MUCHA DEMANDA EN LA CIUDAD DE SANTA CRUZ DONDE EL VIVE, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Zesar is married and from Cochabamba. He was born on July 30th of 1978 in Cochabamba. He has a land parcel in San Luis on the riverbank. He plants potatoes and peppers and takes them personally to sell in Sucre. Spicy peppers is a very popular product in Sucre for food preparation. It is used in most of the traditional dishes, such as picante mixto, salteñas, mondongo and fritanga. He has been working with Emprender for three years and he is a good client. He makes his payments on time, because he is one of three brothers and they all help each other so as not to fall behind. All three brothers work in agriculture. Zesar is married and has three small children. He is very hardworking and he is always thinking of what products to plant according to the planting season. With the money from the loan, he will buy seeds to plant potatoes. This product is in high demand in the city of Santa Cruz where he lives. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they have put in him with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds to plant potatoes

loans.name: Shomirzo

texts.ru: Каршиев Шомирзо проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 42 года. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Шомирзо имеет средне - специальное образование, "Водитель". Работает по специальности. Предоставляет услугу, такси. В этой области более 10 лет. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en:
Shomirzo K. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 42 years old, married and has 6 children. His wife is a homemaker. Shomirzo has a secondary-specialized education as a driver. He works in his field and provides a taxi service. He has been in this business for over 10 years. Shomirzo is requesting this loan for car repairs.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car repairs

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Modesta F. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 46 years old. To make a living, Modesta owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Modesta has been engaged in her business for over 30 years.

In 2007, Modesta joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Modesta is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her fourth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Carlos Adolfo

texts.es:
A sus 40 años de edad el señor Carlos Adolfo E. M., dedica la mayor parte de su tiempo a desarrollar actividades agropecuarias como la siembra y manejo de cultivos agrícolas como granos básicos ( maíz, sorgo, ajonjolí ) también se dedica a la crianza de ganado bobino, porcino, y aviar los que constituyen su principal fuente de ingresos, con los que mantiene a su familia y utiliza para financiar sus demás actividades productivas dichas actividades como hice mención ocupan la mayor parte de su tiempo durante el día, su esposa quien le ayuda a percibir cierta cantidad de ingresos al realizar trabajos de costura y vender ropa usada en su comunidad le constituye una gran ayuda para este cliente.
Ambos tienen un sueño el cual es llagar mejorar su casa y poder ayudar a sus dos pequeños hijos a terminar su estudios de secundaria y si es posible universitarios.
texts.en:
At 40 years of age, Sr. Carlos Adolfo E. M. devotes most of his time to farming activities. These include cultivating grains (corn, sorghum, and sesame) as well as raising cattle, pigs, and chickens which comprise the main source of income to support his family and invest in other activities. Farming takes up most of his day. His wife helps earn additional income by sewing and selling used clothing in their community. They both dream of making improvements to their home and helping their two children finish their high school studies and, if possible, move on to university.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other supplies

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely J. is from the village of Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. She is 30 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Emely owns and operates a business providing motorcycle services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Emely joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Pan

texts.en:
Pan S., 45, is widowed and resides with her three children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known for the most populated area in the country. S. is a tailor, earning an income of USD 2 per day. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for the family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan C.  is currently in the business of selling tomatoes, bread, and groundnut paste at the market and is requesting a loan to stock fresh fish to fry and sell.  Susan is 35 years old and is married to a husband who is a watchman. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: Stock fresh fish to fry and sell

loans.name: Narciso

texts.en:
Narciso C. is from the village of Sta. Isabel Norte. He is 41 years old. Narciso is married and has two children. To make a living, Narciso owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Narciso has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Narciso joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Narciso is requesting a loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Narciso from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Los Naranjos Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Los Naranjos lo integran Abimal Arsenio M., Francisca Teodora V. y Lino Nemecio M.. Abimal, quien es el coordinador del grupo se dedica desde hace 10 años a la profesión de sastre en su casa de habitación, el utilizará el crédito en la compra de tela y materiales para la elaboración de uniformes y demás productos. Fancisca y Lino se dedican a la venta de frutas y verduras en el M. municipal de Masaya.
texts.en:
Abimal Arsenio M., Francisca Teodora Velásquez and Lino Nemecio M. are the members of the “Los Naranjos” (The Orange Trees) communal bank. Abimal, who is group Coordinator, has been a tailor for the last 10 years. His shop is in his house. He will use the loan to buy fabric and supplies to make uniforms and other products. Francisca and Lino are fruit and vegetable merchants in Masaya’s Municipal Market.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Fadeda

texts.en: Fadeda S. is currently in the business of selling wax and shoes  and is requesting a loan to stock more shoes to sell.  Fadeda is 24 years old and is married to a husband who is a driver. She has three children and one of her children goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

loans.use: Stock more shoes to sell

loans.name: Belenda

texts.en:
Belenda D. is a 48-year old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: a general store and a frozen foods business. She lives in Purok Salmon within Barangay Zone VI, a part of Cadiz City within Negros Occidental province on the Visayas islands. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and frozen foods business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 5000 PHP.

Belenda is borrowing 16,000 PHP so that she can purchase more inventory to sell. This will be her eighteenth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 13,500 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Belenda aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more inventory to sell

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en: Natalya V. is divorced with a four-year-old son. She lives in a small apartment with her father and son.  She sells clothing at an open market in Ivano-Frankovsk town. Her monthly income is 5,000 Grivnas.  Natalya started this business three years ago. She used to work at the same market as a sales person, but then decided she could open her own business. Today Natalya has many repeat clients who buy from her. This business is the only source of income for Natalya. Natalya would like to increase the assortment of her inventories. She hopes to receive additional income and use it for her family's current needs.

loans.use: To increase the clothing assortment

loans.name: Air Force Group

texts.en:
Jane K. is in her late 20s and is married with two children. Jane runs a small food stall where she sells several basic food products such as flour, rice and sugar. The stall has been open since 2004 and is open daily between 8 am and 7 pm. The stall earns Jane a low monthly income. 

This will be Jane's first Motisha loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. Jane aims to use this loan to improve the quality of her stall and to have more available capital should a product run out. Jane's dream is to one day open a big shop where she can sell clothes and shoes.

Jane will share this loan with her loan group Air Force, which totals 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Jane can be seen second from right in a white blouse.

loans.use: To improve the condition of her food stall.

loans.name: Martín

texts.en:
Martin, a 53-year-old single man with no children, lives in his own home in the town of Tambogrande in northern Peru. The region is relatively tropical and primarily populated by individuals who grow fruit and raise animals.

For over ten years now, Martin has sold newspapers and magazines. He sells the newspapers in the streets of the cities, providing the populace with easy access to their news and events of the world. He is proud of his work and glad to be able to play a role in the ongoing education of his people. He has a good number of loyal and consistent clients.

This will be Martin’s first credit with our institution. He plans to use the funds to purchase additional merchandise for his shop, since demand has been increasing for magazines and other items. He needs the loan in order to expand his inventory of those items and to meet his clients' requests.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Bienvinida

texts.en:
Bienvinida V. is 64 years old, married and supports her family by operating 2 businesses: a variety store and a rice trading business. She lives in Brgy. Binalbagan, Canlaon City, Negros Oriental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of PHP 16,000. 

Bienvinida is now borrowing PHP 13,000 to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Bienvinida aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and to ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase more stock

loans.name: Lydia Villarubia's Group

texts.en:
Lydia V. is from the village of Catadman, city of Ozamis. She is 55 years old, married and has 1 school-aged and 3 adult-aged children. Lydia is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Lydia V.’s Group.

To make a living, Lydia owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for ten years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month. 

In 2006, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. Lydia is requesting a new loan of14, 500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products for her retail store. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Maria Dolly from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living condition of her family.

 About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note:
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

About Group Loans

In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or default.

loans.use: used to purchase additional products for her retail store

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Thy S., 27 years old, owns a small wooden house and a grocery shop, where she sells many items, including cooking ingredient, sweets, soft drink, and meat for cooking. Thy S. retails her inventory to people who are passer-by and are also her neighbors living near her house. To be ensured the entire family has stability financial, her husband plants rice crop on his farmland which comes from his grandparent. This couple now lives with two children who are going to school. Thy S. is taking out her loan to increase her inventory and to buy a cow for her husband to use in farming business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory and to buy a cow for her husband to use in farming business.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem N., 43, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. She sells vegetables, earning an income of USD 6 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 25 on food and USD 40 on other necessary expenses. N. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for family use.

loans.name: Lonh's Group

texts.en:
In the Preaek Hour village in Kandal province there are four people who form this group loan. The members of this group will use their money to support their different purposes.  

Mrs. Lonh P. is a 41-year-old married woman, and she is the group leader who was selected by the other members. She and her husband, Mr. Ouch Thon, earn their living by cultivating mushrooms.  They lack enough money to continue to grow them, so she decided to ask for a loan to purchase mushroom seeds for growing mushrooms. Aside from farming, they also earn their living by selling honey from bees. 

Mrs. Lonh P. is the mother of five children, two of whom are working in a printing house while the others are students in the local school. They also support their parents' businesses.

loans.use: To purchase mushroom seeds for growing mushrooms.

loans.name: Silvia Lorena

texts.es:
La señora C. tiene una pulpería en su casa con más de 10 años de experiencia en esta actividad
Este crédito será utilizado para mejorar su vivienda que es donde tiene el negocio
Este negocio lo comenzó con esfuerzo propio y poco a poco ha logrado salir adelante ya que los productos que vende son granos básicos que son de primera necesidad
Con este préstamo ella lo que quiere es ampliar mas en área donde está la pulpería 
Este es el segundo crédito que trabaja con nuestra institución
texts.en: Ms. C. has a pulpería [small grocery store] in her house. She has more than 10 years of experience running her business. She will use this loan to make improvements to her house, which is also where she runs her business. She started this business through her own effort, and little by little, she has progressed forward. She sells products like basic grains, which are a staple item. She will use this loan to expand the area where she has her pulpería. This is her second loan through CEPRODEL.

loans.use: to expand the area in her home where she runs her store; to buy corrugated metal sheets, stones, and cement

loans.name: Ilario

texts.es: El Sr. Ilario  tiene como actividad la carpintería, el  realiza todo tipo de trabajo que le piden sus clientes como ser roperos juego de dormitorio y otros,  actualmente se encuentra realizando muebles de cocina y puertas, el Sr. Ilario es una persona muy responsable su familia esta compuesta por su esposa  y sus seis hijos tres de ellos son universitarios su esposa también le ayuda en el mantenimiento de su hogar, trabajando junto a el , esta ocasión solicita crédito para la compra de madera para tener un stock de materia prima para enfrentar contratos futuros, tiene el deseo de poder tener un carpintería grande donde pueda brindar trabajo a jóvenes que se están iniciando en este campo, es un apersona muy trabajadora y responsable, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Ilario is a carpenter.  He does all types of work that his customers request.  He makes things like wardrobes, bedroom sets, and others.  He is currently making kitchen furniture and doors.

Ilario is a very responsible person.  His family is comprised of his wife and their six children.  Three of the children are university students.  His wife also helps support the household by working with him.

He is requesting a loan this time to buy wood in order to have raw material in stock to handle future contracts.  He wishes to be able to have a large carpentry shop where he would be able to offer work to young people who are starting out in this field.  He is a very hard-working and responsible person.  He is grateful to the institution for the support they have provided.

loans.use: To buy raw material, wood

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo R. is a married woman. Her husband is a driver. They have two children, aged 17 and ten years old, whom they hope to give a good education, up to the university level. Her business is located in the Mazaoni market in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is in the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many, many tourist attractions, including the Indian Ocean's white beaches.

Mwanakombo sells shawls to the local women. Besides the shawls, she also sells juice and ice cubes, since the area is very hot. She has been in this business for two years now. She says that the business is profitable, but that the major challenge she faces is financial constraints. However, she works hard to keep his business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more shawls to expand her business. She hopes to be a prominent businesswoman in the future, and she describes herself as "Godfearing".

loans.use: to buy more shawls for resale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine M. is 34-year-old married lady with four children all below the age of 18 years. She has been a water vendor for the last seven years now in Marereni area in Malindi and earns a monthly income of about Kshs 21,000/= from her business. She usually uses the money to assist her husband in taking care of their family and educating their children. 

Josephine has been loaned Kshs 40,000/= by KADET LIMITED as her third loan from the company and she intends to use it to purchase a bigger water tank than the one she has now. She would like to be able to serve her ever-growing customer base since no one else conducts the same kind of business in the area. 

She wishes to use the anticipated profits from her business to continue helping look after her family as well as to help grow her business by opening another water selling point in the town.

loans.use: To purchase a new water tank for her business.

loans.name: Maria De La Luz

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Maria De La Luz le está haciendo faltas los acabados del interior así como enjarar  y pintar la casa. Pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejora. 
Es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo y así poder comprar el material que necesita para que su esposo realice la mejora en horario a adicional a su trabajo. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como empleada de limpieza de una casa particular, ya que su esposo el señor Victorino se encargara de los gastos de la casa y escolares de sus tres hijos. 
Desea mejorar el patrimonio de su familia ya que este me mejores condiciones y mas segura.
texts.en:
Maria De La Luz’s house needs finishing touches in the interior, such as stucco for the walls and paint. However, she doesn’t have the money that is necessary to make these improvements. 

For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can buy the materials she needs so that her husband can do the work after his job. 

She plans to repay the loan with the income she earns from her job as a housekeeper; her husband, Victorino, takes care of the household expenses and the school expenses for their three children.

She wants to improve her family’s house so that it will be in better condition and safer.

loans.use: to finish the interior of her house

loans.name: Chek

texts.en:
Mrs. Chek T. is a 54-year-old woman who earns a living feeding pigs in a cage behind her house. She currently lives with her three single children who still study in public school and depend on her income. She has run this business since 1998. 

In addition to her pig-raising trade, Mrs. Chek T. and her husband always make Khmer noodles and sell them in bulk to middlemen who then take the noodles to retail at the busy market. Recently, Chek T. used all of the raw materials from her stock and she wants to resupply by asking for a loan to buy rice to stock up in order to produce more Khmer noodles.

loans.use: to buy rice to produce Khmer noodles for continued sales.

loans.name: Zohrab

texts.en: Zohrab is 44 years old and married. He is a farmer. He has demonstrated that in spite of his youth he can support his family with hard work and dedication.  Zohrab is always in the fields, growing seasonal fruits and looking after his trees.  He wakes up early in the morning to water the fields. This work is satisfying,  but not enough to provide a better quality of life.  Very hard-working, he is requesting for a loan of 1,300 AZN, which he will use to buy fertilizer. The loan will greatly improve Zohrab’s income and his family's living standards. He would like to invest in the purchase of supplies to protect his crops, so as to have a better harvest and sell his crops effectively.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita Laspinas is a 57 year old married woman. She lives in the community of Sta. Josefa Agusan del Sur. Her husband is a farmer in their community.  She and her husband till their small rice farm to be able to raise their children.

With a loan from Community Economic Ventures Inc. Lolita hopes to buy fertilizer, seed and insecticide.

In the future, Lolita hopes to have a bigger farm and more profit for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed, and insecticide

loans.name: Piyalo

texts.fr: En 2004, Piyalo s’est lancée dans le commerce des céréales (mais, haricot, mil). Elle achète à l’intérieur du pays et revend dans un marché de la place. C’est une femme battante qui désire renforcer son activité et ce prêt lui servira à acheter des céréales  pour pouvoir vendre à toutes personnes. Elle a 31ans et est célibataire.
texts.en: In 2004 Piyalo launched into selling cereals (corn, beans, millet). She buys her stock inland and sells it at a local market. She is a fighting woman who wants to strengthen her business, and this loan will be used to buy cereals to sell to all kinds of people. She is 31 years old and single.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn is 40 years old and lives in Maloro, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of four school-age children. Arlyn is a fisherman. She catches fish to earn a living. She supports her family with this activity, which she has been doing for 15 years. She earns an average total of PHP 3,000 each month from this activity. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 from GDMPC to purchase meters of fishing nets. Arlyn has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Arlyn hopes to have a brand new fishing boat and purchase land for a fishpond.

loans.use: To purchase meters of fishing net.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Nancy es natural de Pancan distrito de Jauja, vive con su esposo y su hija de 6 años en su casa que es propia. Desde su niñez sus padres le enseñaron todas las técnicas agrarias y ganaderas, es así que hace 5 años implementó su propio establo en donde cría vacas, asimismo posee una hectárea de terreno, espacio que le dejo sus padres. Ahí cultiva pastos y alfalfa, ya que son forraje para sus animales. Por otro lado, ella y su esposo trabajan  arduamente  para ordeñar la leche de sus vacas y venderlas a una  empresa  local que fabrica productos lácteos,  logrando extraer 35 litros de leche y cuando es escaza hasta 15 litros por día. Le agrada esta actividad porque le pagan por la leche al contado  y juntar poco a poco sus ganancias para afrontar los múltiples gastos de su hogar. Nancy y su esposo se han propuesto aumentar  la cantidad de animales que tiene y adquirir más terrenos de cultivo para seguir teniendo abastecimiento de pastos. Es una de las integrantes fundadoras de su banco comunal, tiene 10 ciclos de trabajo con MFP y con un buen record crediticio dentro de su grupo solidario, cada préstamo que ha recibido lo ha invertido adecuadamente en la mejora de su establo de las cuales hoy esta teniendo sus primeros frutos. Con el dinero que solicita, le servirá para comprar una vaca lechera de raza.
texts.en:
Nancy is from Pancan, Jauja District.  She lives with her husband and 6-year-old daughter in a house that’s hers.  Since childhood her parents taught her all the farming and livestock raising techniques so five years ago she started her own stable where she raises cows.  She also has a hectare of land that her parents left her.  She grows grasses and alfalfa there because they are the forage for her animals.  On the other hand, she and her husband work hard to milk the cows to sell the milk to a local firm that manufactures dairy products.  They manage to get about 35 liters of milk daily and when it’s scarce about 15 liters daily.  She enjoys this work because they pay her cash for the milk and she’s able to little by little save up her profits to meet the multiple expenses she has at home.  Nancy and her husband have proposed to increase their herd size and to acquire more farmland to continue having adequate supplies of pasture.

She is one of the founding members of the communal bank; she’s been working with MFP for ten cycles and has a good credit history within the group.  Each loan she’s gotten she’s invested in stable improvements which are now beginning to bear fruit.  With the money she’s requesting she will buy a pedigree dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco, de 41 años es padre de 3 niños. Vive con ellos en casa propia junto a su esposa y su madre quienes le ayudan en diferentes actividades y quienes quedan con los niños mientras el sale a trabajar.El trabajo de Francisco empieza muy temprano, cuando se dirige a un taller de soldadura que alquilo junto a otros compañeros de trabajo para poder realiza todo tipo de obras en carpintería metálica. Lleva siete años en este negocio y esta contento porque es algo que le gusta hacer. Considera que lo malo es el riesgo que corre pues el trabajo con soldadura en fierro y electricidad es un poco peligroso.Como buen padre siempre llega a la casa con algo en las manos porque con el dinero que gana espera poder seguir dándoles buena educación a sus hijos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Espera poder tener un taller propio y mantener la gran cartera de clientes que logro obtener durante sus siete años de experiencia laboral.Este es el sexto préstamo de Francisco con MFP y espera poder seguir junto a sus compañeros de grupo con quienes se lleva muy bien y es conocido como un hombre responsable en sus pagos.Con el préstamo el comprará materiales y fierros para seguir en su trabajo que hasta el momento le esta dando buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Francisco is 41 years old, and he has three children.  He lives with them in his own house together with his wife and mother.  They help him with different business activities.  They stay at home with the children while he goes to work.

Francisco’s work starts very early when he heads to a soldering shop that he rents together with other work colleagues.  He goes there to be able to do all types of metallic carpentry.  He has been in this business for seven years, and he is happy because it is something that he likes to do.  He feels that the bad part is the risk he runs.  Soldering with iron and electricity is a little dangerous.

As a good father, he always comes home with something in his hands.  He does this because he hopes to be able to continue giving his children a good education and improving his family’s quality of life.  He hopes to be able to have his own workshop and to keep the large customer base that he managed to get during his seven years of work experience.

This is Francisco’s sixth loan with MFP.  He hopes to be able to continue working together with his colleagues in the group.  He gets along very well with them, and he is known as a man who is responsible with his payments.  He will use the loan to buy materials and iron in order to continue with his work.  So far it has been giving him good income.

loans.use: to buy materials and iron in order to continue working.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerardo, tiene la edad 33 de  años, está casado y vive con su esposa y  una hija. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de insumos para la asistencia de su plantación de café. El cuenta con una plantación de café y pretende invertir en insumos como abonos, mano de obra y fungicidas para obtener una mejor cosecha. El quiere implantar una buena plantación para vender un café de calidad. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto de producción café. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Gerardo, aged 33, is married and lives with his wife and one daughter.  With the loan, he is planning on buying supplies to help with his coffee plantation.  He has a coffee plantation, and plans to invest in supplies such as manure, labor, and fungicides in order to get a better harvest.  He wants to have in place a good plantation to sell quality coffee.  He wants to earn a greater quantity of earnings for his well-being and that of his family, and to grow with the goal of coffee production

This is his first loan that he has received through FODECOSUR.  He had not taken other loans previously from the state banks, but FODECOSUR offered him the loan with better terms and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as manure, labor, and fungicides in order to get a better harvest

loans.name: Unurtsetseg

texts.en: Unurtsetseg is a 51-year-old married woman who lives with her husband, daughter and son in a local ger district (felt tent district without basic infrastructure) of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her profession is teacher and her spouse is a driver for the largest local trade company. While Unrtsetseg's children are attending state university and secondary school, she is supporting her family by operating a stationary business she started in 2009. Now she has a stall at the local outer market and she sells pens, school bags, books and notebooks. She usually buys her products from wholesale suppliers and other local markets. Sometimes she imports from Ereen, a border city of China and Mongolia. Unurtsetseg is requesting a 1,900,000 Mongolian tugrik (MNT) loan from Kiva lenders to purchase more school stationary and other related products to meet the demand of upcoming preschool shopping. She is a responsible client of Transcapital who has repaid her previous loan successfully.

loans.use: to purchase more school stationary for upcoming preschool shopping

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy, de 49 años, es una mujer alegre y muy trabajadora, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos quienes ya son mayores. Juntos viven en su casa propia. EL trabajo de Nancy comienza muy temprano, pues ella se dirige al mercado de "Campo Verde" (un distrito de la ciudad) en donde tiene que abrir su puesto muy temprano, en el vende hielo, frutas, plátano, y otros productos regionales, lleva trabajando en esto ya por cuatro años aproximadamente, lo hace sola y es muy conocida por que vende muy buenos productos. Lo que le gusta de trabajo es que tiene tiempo para poder hacer otras actividades, ya que su trabajo en el mercado es solo por las mañanas. Espera mas adelante poder amplair su puesto de venta. Este será el séptimo crédito con MFP, se siente muy cómoda en su grupo por que todos demostraron ser muy responsables, espera poder seguir recibiendo la ayuda brindada ya que dice le es de mucha ayuda para seguir creciendo en su negocio. Con el monto solicitado, comprará productos como plátanos, cítricos para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en: Nancy, 49, is a cheerful, hard-working woman who has a common-law husband and two adult children.  They live in their own house.  Nancy's work begins very early in the morning when she goes to the market in "Campo Verde" (a city district) where she has a stall.  She sells ice, fruit, bananas and other regional products, and has been in business for approximately four years.  She works alone and is well known because of the quality products she sells.  What she enjoys about her work is the fact that it leaves time for her to have other activities.  This is because she only works in the mornings.  Her goal is to get ahead through her sales.  This will be her seventh loan through MFP and she is very comfortable in her group because of how responsible the people are.  She hopes to continue receiving support so she can expand her business.  The loan will be used to buy products such as bananas and citrus fruits.

loans.use: To buy bananas and citrus fruits.

loans.name: Daud

texts.en:
Daud is a 47-year-old man and is married to Nelcy, a 44-year-old lady. From their marriage, they have 6 lovely children named: Mikael, 17 and studying at the first grade of Senior High School; Vivi, 15 and studying at the third grade of Junior High School; Auzinta, 12;  Olita, 10 and  Ademance, 7; three of them are attending Elementary School; and Melinda, 1 year old. 

To support his family, Daud runs a furniture business. He has been running the business for six years. Prior to operating the business, Daud used to work as a construction worker for several years but he decided to quit and tried different work as a carpenter. After working for six months he then tried to initiate his own business. He creates various kinds of furniture such as cupboards, desks, tables, chairs, beds, doors, windows and also coffins. 

Daud also employs six workers to assist him. They produce the furniture based on orders from customers. Currently, Daud has received orders from customers that require him to buy more materials. Unfortunately, Daud does not have enough money to buy them as the customers usually pay him in installments.

Therefore, Daud would like to request a loan of IDR 10,000,000 to purchase some beams of hard wood. Daud is expecting that TLM is willing to assist his business.

loans.use: to purchase some beams of hard wood.

loans.name: Maria Josefa

texts.es:
En el municipio de Quezalguaque departamento de león, la señora Maria, se dedica arduamente  a laborar como maestra, actualmente esta desempeñándose como técnica en educación, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace 16 años, es casada con 3 hijos a los que tiene que proporcionarles  las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen.
Una de las necesidades que la señora María atraviesa hoy en día es de incrementar su inventario de su negocio y aumentar sus ventas, para tener mejores condiciones económicas y poder desarrollar profesionalmente a sus hijos,  lo que le `permitió tomar la decisión sabia de visitar a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de perfumes ya que su línea de negocio es la venta de cosméticos como otra alternativa económica, ya que por medio de esta actividad brindara mejores condiciones de vida y a ella propia . Cabe mencionar la importancia de la actividad en la familia.
texts.en: In the town of Quezalguaque, in Leon deepartment, Señora Maria works hard in her job as a teacher, currently carrying out the role of a school technician. She has dedicated her time to this work over the past 16 years. She is married, with 3 children to support and provide for. One of the day-to-day needs Señora María faces is the need to increase the stock of her business and increase her sales, so as to improve her financial situation and contribute to her children's education. This is what motivated her to visit [the field partner] Ceprodel. She is seeking a loan to buy perfumes because as a second income, she has her line of business selling cosmetics. Thanks to this activity, she will be able to offer a better standard of living to her family, so the business is of great importance to them.

loans.use: To buy perfumes to increase the stock her business carries.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor, de 37 años, es una señora muy amable, responsable y trabajadora, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene un hijo de 7 años, ella vive en casa de su cuñado a lado de su hijo, su pareja y la familia de su cuñado. Trabaja mucho para poder salir adelante y dar lo mejor a su familia. El trabajo de Flor consiste en la venta de comida, ella desde temprano esta muy activa ya que sale a hacer sus compras al mercado y busca lo mejor, para así poder brindar buenos alimentos a sus fieles clientes quienes la buscan siempre por su buena sazón y su trato amable. Luego se dirige al malecón del reloj publico, ahí tiene un puesto y desde ahí vende sus deliciosos alimentos, lleva haciendo este trabajo por veinte años y recibe la ayuda de su madre con quien comparten las responsabilidades del negocio. Le gusta mucho cocinar, creció haciendo esto a lado de su madre y le gusta estar junto a ella, además le da tiempo por las tardes para poder realizar otras actividades. Sus clientes son fieles y siempre la buscan porque reciben buen trato y además es deliciosos los platillos que prepara Flor. Le esta yendo bien y espera poder ampliar su negocio poniendo un puesto estable sin ir muy lejos para así pode conservar sus clientes. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, se siente contenta de trabajar con su grupo ya que son personas muy responsables, espera seguir así y seguir mostrándose responsable como lo hizo hasta ahora. Agradece mucho a la institución pues le es de mucha ayuda los prestamos recibidos. Con el monto solicitado, comprará materiales para seguir con su negocio, pues ella necesita nuevas ollas, más cubiertos y algunas refacciones para su puesto, vende cada plato de comida a 3 soles aproximadamente.
texts.en: Flor, 37 years old, is a very kind, responsible, and hardworking woman. She lives with her partner with whom she has a 7-year old child. She lives in her brother-in-law's home with his family, her son, and her partner. She works a great deal to get ahead and give her family the best. Flor's job consists of selling food. From a young age, she has been active, going to the market and looking for the best of everything in order to be able to provide good food to her loyal customers who always seek her out due to her good cooking and kind service. Afterwards she goes to the street with the clock tower where she has a stall and sells her delicious food. She has been doing this job for twenty years and receives assistance from her mother with whom she shares the responsibilities of the business. She likes to cook a lot; she grew up doing this next to her mom and she enjoy being together with her. Moreover, it gives her time in the afternoon to do other activities. Her customers are loyal and always seek her out because they receive good service and also because Flor's dishes are delicious. She's doing well and hopes her business is able to grow, having a more stable stall without going very far, and in this way be able to keep her customers. This will be her second loan with MFP. She is happy to work with her group as they are very responsible people and she hopes to continue like this and continue showing her responsibility as she's done until now. She greatly thanks the institution as the received loans help a lot. With the amount requested, she will buy materials to continue her business. As such, she needs new pots, more silverware, and to refurbish some parts of her stall. She sells each plate of food for approximately 3 soles.

loans.use: to buy pots, silverware, and to refurbish the area of her food stall.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
As a responsible mother, Elma engages in selling frozen foods in her village to help her husband gain income. They plan to strengthen their sources of income to be able to support the education of their three children. They want the children to finish their studies so that they will find good jobs someday. Despite problems and difficulties they encountered in life, Elma and her husband are striving hard to support their family. 

Elma wants to ask for an additional capital of PHP 9,000 to buy hot dogs, longaniza (pork sausage), tocino, and boneless fish to sell. She mentioned that this loan will be a great help for her to improve her business. She believes that her patience and sacrifices will make her business grow in the future.

loans.use: to buy hot dogs, longaniza (pork sausage), tocino, and boneless fish to sell

location.town: Brgy. Sta. Cruz, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Mitzy

texts.es: Mitzy, de 27 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora. Esta casada con Carlos, vive en compañía de él y de su pequeño hijo de tres años en su casa que lograron comprarla a base de mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Mitzy es la venta de ropa y accesorios femeninos, para lo cual cuenta con una boutique que logró abrir hace dos años, en un espacio que acondiciono en su propia casa. De esta manera  ahorra gastos de alquiler, desde donde atiende muy amablemente a todos sus clientes. Esta actividad la realiza sola y le gusta lo que hace porque gracias a ello es independiente y puede ganar su propio dinero, así también apoya a su esposo en los gastos de su hogar. Por otro lado se da tiempo para atender a su pequeño hijo. Tiene planes de abrir otro local en una zona céntrica de ciudad, y así poder hacer crecer más su negocio. Este seria el cuarto crédito con la institución MFP, se siente contenta de poder contar con el apoyo de la institución. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en su totalidad en la venta de ropa de diversos modelos y accesorios para las fiestas navideñas.
texts.en: Mitzy, age 27, is an enterprising and very hard-working woman. She is married to Carlos, and lives with him and their three-year-old child in a home which they were able to buy after a great deal of hard work. Mitzy sells clothing and women's accessories; she has her own boutique which she opened two years ago in a special area of her home. This way, she does not have to pay rent. She provides very good customer service, and works alone. She enjoys her work because she is independent and can make her own money and support her husband with the household costs. She also has time to take care of her little one. Mitzy plans to open another location in a central area of the city, in order to expand her business more. This will be her fourth loan with MFP, and she is happy to have their support. She will invest all of this loan in the purchase of a large variety of clothing and accessories for the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy more clothing and accessories for Christmas.

loans.name: Xotchil Cristina

texts.es: Originaria de Granada, con 34 años de edad, Xotchil se gana la vida, vendiendo ropa, tiene tres hijos, es casada, ella estudio una carrera técnica de administración de empresas. Inicio vendiendo ambulante ropa  al crédito, recorría toda la ciudad de Granada buscando como vender su mercadería, al morir su papa heredo un terreno el cual vendió y con esa capital comenzó a invertir en compra de ropa de todo estilo y tamaño para vender, después se traslado al mercado de la cuidad alquilo un pequeño tramo donde vende sus piezas de ropa. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar ropa, vestidos de damas, jeans para varón mujer y niños y blusas.  La inversión la ayudara a mejorar su inventario de ropa ofreciendo variedad de estilos para todo tipo de clientes que visite su tienda. Uno de sus sueños es tener su propio local pero por lo pronto su meta próxima es que sus hijos se preparen y tengan una buena educación.
texts.en: 34 years old and a native of Granada, Xotchil makes a living selling clothes. She has 3 children and is married. For a career she studied business administration. She started out selling clothes as a street vendor, on credit, and would travel all over the city of Granada looking for a way to sell her merchandise. When her father died she inherited a plot of land which she sold and used the capital to buy clothes of all styles and sizes to sell. Later. she moved to the city market and rented a small stand where she sells her garments. She needs the loan to buy clothes, ladies' dresses. jeans for men, women and children and blouses. The investment will help improve her clothing inventory, offering a variety of styles for all kinds of customers that might visit her shop. One of her dreams is to have her own premises but for the moment her next goal is that her children be well prepared and have a good education.

loans.use: to buy clothes, dresses, jeans and blouses.

loans.name: Bertha Leonor

texts.es:
Doña Bertha sigue su labor de operador de equipo en el hospital, su esposo sigue trabajando de mecanica y su hijo estudiando english, para un futuro mejor. Para Bertha la economia de su pais, cada dia esta ah altos costos, lo que tiene que equilibrar bien sus gastos para poder balacearce.
Su objetivo es poder hacer mejoras a su casa, con el credito anterior era para hacer baño e inodoro, el cual comenzo pero no termino ya que no ajusto con los materiales,solo logro levantar una pared, la compra del inodoro, tubos para la tuberia, es por eso con este nuevo financiamiento podra hacer la construccion de ambas paredes, e instalar equipos para mejorar su higiene personal y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Bertha continues working as an equipment operator in a hospital. Her husband continues working as a mechanic, and her child studies English to have a better future. 

Everyday expenses are very costly for Bertha due to the economy of the country. She has to carefully budget to be able to keep her expenses in balance. 

Her goal is to be able to make improvements to her house. Her previous loan was to install a bathroom and toilet. She started but did not finish since she did not adjust for the materials. 

She was only able to put up a wall and purchase the toilet and pipes for the plumbing. With the new loan, she will be able to complete the construction for the two walls and install equipment to improve her personal hygiene and that of her family.

loans.use: finalize the installation of a bathroom and toilet and achieve better hygiene for her family

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael de cincuenta años de edad vive con su hijo, el posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad frijoles, pan, leche entre otros, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha más clientela, pues es la tienda mas surtida de la zona y la gente la busca porque siempre encuentran todo lo que necesitan a precios muy accesibles y con productos de muy buena calidad, además el servicio que presta Rafael es inigualable siempre recibe a la gente con una sonrisa en el rostro; él es un hombre trabajador se levanta desde muy temprano a empezar su labor para aprovechar su tiempo, piensa que detrás de alguien con éxito, está una decisión valiente,  el ya tomo su decisión y por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, producto instantáneo, embutidos, lácteos, bebidas, jabones etc. Rafael tiene la confianza que de esta forma logrará darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rafael, 50, lives with his son and runs a grocery store.  He sells essential goods such as beans, bread and milk, among other items.  Lately he has noticed an increase in customers since his store has the widest variety in the area and people can always find what they are looking for at low prices.  Rafael offers very good quality and an unequaled service, since he always receives customers with a smile.  He is a hard worker and gets up early in the morning to get a good start.  He believes that behind a successful person there is a courageous decision.  He took the decision to request a loan through INTEGRAL to buy basic grains, instant products, sausage, dairy products, beverages, soaps, etc.  Rafael is confident this will help him give his family a quality lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, instant products, sausage, dairy products, beverages and soaps.

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.en:
Anatalia is 57 years old and lives in Katipunan, Sinacaban. She is married and has four children. 

Anatalia has a general store that sells variety of goods. Anatalia has had this business for 20 years. Anatalia requested a loan of 14,900 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to purchase additional products such as noodles, canned goods, beverages, etc. 

Anatalia has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Anatalia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as noodles, canned goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Merlinda has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Merlinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Merlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Nanuti

texts.en: Nauti is 38 years-old .  She is Married and has 3 children aged 20, 16 and 12.  In 2000, she established  her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys grocery goods for her business.  In the future, Nauti plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 0 In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buys grocery goods for her business

loans.name: Sophie's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux femmes en caution solidaire. Sophie la responsable est âgée de 30ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02enfants scolarisés. Le plus âgé a 06ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. Sophie vend du maïs, de la farine de blé et de divers depuis un an puis s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son fonds de roulement et de satisfaire les besoins de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès de Finadev. Le revenu supplémentaire généré par ce financement lui permettra de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et d'aider son mari à achever la construction de leur maison. Sophie se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en: This is a group made up of two women with a joint guarantee. Sophie, the leader is 30 years old. She is married and has two children who attend school. The older child is six and the younger three. Sophie has been selling  corn, wheat flour and various other products for one year and buys her stock at one of the markets in Benin. In order to reinforce her working capital and to satisfy her customers’ needs, she has requested a loan from Finadev. The supplementary income generated by this loan will enable her to contribute to her children’s education and help her husband to finish the construction of their house. Sophie is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of corn, 2 boxes of sugar and one sack of flour.

loans.name: Afi Migueille

texts.fr: Âgée de 36 ans, Afi Migueille a fréquenté l’école jusqu'au niveau primaire. Afi Migueille est mariée à un certain Laurent. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Afi Migueille vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure les différentes charges du ménage. Afi Migueille vend des divers produits par la technique de distribution depuis quatorze ans ; ce qui lui permet de contribuer à l'éducation et à l'entretien des enfants. Afi Migueille s'approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. La clientèle de Afi Migueille devient de plus en plus grandissante. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Afi Migueille sollicite une cinquième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des divers produits.

loans.name: Mukami

texts.en:
Mukami is a married woman with one child who attend school. She lives at her own house that has piped water and electricity. She cites  food being her greatly monthly expenses.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbours and people at the market place. She dreams of earning more income and incorporating of hairdressing skills in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Miroslav

texts.en: Miroslav F. lives in Smolian. He is 33 years old and after graduation starts to work as a taxi driver in a taxi company in the town. Miroslav spends three years there and decides to found his own taxi company. At the beguinning he has only one car and now two years later he is an owner of three taxi cars. Miroslav works with his sister, his girlfriend and some of his colleagues from the previous company. Now Miroslav F. wants to purchase and equip one more taxi car and needs $ 2000.

loans.use: To purchase and equip one more taxi car

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen has a store inside her home where she sells school supplies and paper products. She started her business with the help of her sister when she realized there was no such store in her neighborhood. She began by selling notebooks and various other items. Now she continues to sell these items along with candy and toys. Carmen will use the loan to buy products wholesale in order to make a bigger profit. She is 47 years old and a divorced mother of one son but is currently in a relationship. She hopes this loan will improve her family’s quality of life and stabilize the growth of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ari Þór Vilhjálmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

Carmen tiene una tienda en su domicilio donde vende útiles escolares y papelería. Carmen empezó su negocio con la ayuda de una hermana y al darse cuenta que por el sector donde vive no había una tienda. Se inicio vendiendo cuadernos y artículos varios. Ahora ella continúa vendiendo estos mismos productos junto con confitería y juguetes. Carmen usara el préstamo para invertir en mercadería al por mayor y así obtener mejores ingresos. Carmen es madre de un hijo, tiene 47 años separada de su primer matrimonio y actualmente tiene otro compromiso. Ella tiene la esperanza que con este préstamo mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia y le dará estabilidad y crecimiento al negocio.

loans.use: Purchase products wholesale

loans.name: Soo

texts.en: Soo moved to the Samoan village of Samusu to live with her husband’s family.  When deciding how she was going to generate income for her family in this small village, she determined that enough village demand existed to support a simple canteen.  So Soo launched her canteen where she now sells about 150 orders of donuts and chips each week.  This brings in about ST 200 weekly (USD 80) and is a critical supplement to the family finances.  Soo is also very focused on saving some of her income as insurance against future hard times.  She is one of the people in her SPBD Center that consistently contributes to her savings account.

loans.use: Buy ingredients and containers

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 24 years old and has a mini-market in Kirkuk. He has applied to get $1200 to get more goods for his shop. He lives with his mother and father and two small sisters. He is responsible for supporting them and he wants to increase his income and enhance his family's living standard.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase more goods

loans.name: I Putu Danu

texts.id:
The business he is in besides a tenant farmer is also being a pig farmer. Today he raise 1 mother pig with a loan of Rp 1,300,000 (about US$150), then danu bought 4 piglets and a sack of Pollard (local brand) pig feed . Daily expenses could reach Rp10,000 (about $1.10) each day. Feeding was done twice a day, at 8:00 AM, and 4:00PM. His other time was used to work on the fields. Usually 4 piglets were raised for 3 months, then sold to the processor for Rp1,400,000 about (US$154) with a nett profit of Rp500,000 (about $55). From that profit Putu Danu supports a wife and a son who is still in Grade school.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha yang ditekuni selama ini selain sebagai petani juga beternak babi. Saat ini babi yang dipelihara ada 1 ekor calon induk, dengan pinjamam Rp 1.300.000,- kemudian Danu membeli 4 ekor anak babi dan satu karung pakan babi yaitu Pollard. Biaya yang dikeluarkan dalam satu harinya mencapai Rp.10.000,- . pemberian pakan dilakukan sebanyak 2 kali yaitu jam 08.00 wita dan jam 16.00 wita, waktu selebihnya dipakai untuk menggarap sawah ladangnya. Biasanya 4 ekor anak babi hanya dipelihara selama 3 bulan dan kemudian dijual ke penggepul dengan harga Rp.1.400.000,- dengan keuntungan bersih selama 3 bulan Rp.500.000,- dari keuntungan tersebut Putu Danu dapat menghidupi 1 orang istri dan 1 orang anak laki-laki yang sekarang duduk di tingkat Sekolah Dasar.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock and animal feed

Membeli bibit babi dan pakan ternak

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Mrs. Maria A. is 47 years old, married with 5 children. She has been a LAPO client for 6 years. She is from the eastern part of the country but lives in Benin City. Maria deals in clothing and shoes and has been in this business since 1992. She needs the loan amount of $1175 for the purchase of clothes and shoes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more  clothing and shoes

loans.name: Kalala

texts.en: Kalala L. is from the Village of Falelauniu. She sells chips five days a week at a primary school, and manages to earn about $150 WST (US$60) a day. Kalala is one of the oldest members of the programme, and it is the fifth time she is borrowing from it. She plans to use to current loan money to improve her chips business by purchasing more bananas and plastic bags. Kalala's business so far has been going well, and she has been successful in repaying the previous loans.

loans.use: Purchase of plastic bags and bananas for a chips business

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
I have been making plaster sculptures for a living for over five years. This is my family’s source of income. My brother and I work in the business, and we would like to invest in it more without losing profits. We want to buy more material and pottery molds to make a greater variety of figurines. We are requesting a loan of $500.00 USD to buy the materials.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo ya más de 5 años que me dedico a la elaboración de figuras de yeso. Este negocio es le fuente de ingresos de mi familia, en el negocio trabajamos mi hermano y yo queremos invertirle mas al negocio sin descapitalizarnos. Queremos comprar más materia prima y moldes para ser más diferentes figuras. Solicitamos un préstamo de $500.00 Dlls para la compra de materia prima.

loans.use: Purchse of materials for his business

loans.name: Rukayat

texts.en: Rukayat G. is married with a child. She is 25-years-old and lives in Oshodin, in Lagos State. She has been in the business of selling plywood since 2003. She is requesting a loan of $450 to purchase additional inventory for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more plywood for resale

loans.name: Alex

texts.es:
Alex Enrique is 49 years old and has been renting 10 rooms in his home for two years. This activity has brought him notable results and has raised his family’s quality of life. Nevertheless, like all homes, with the passage of time the house needs certain repairs and even more so when the rooms are rented out.
