Agradece la oportunidad que le dieron para poder aumentar su inversión y espera poder seguir trabajando para así progresar. Con el monto solicitado, comprará carne para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Alicia is 40 years old and is a very happy, friendly and hard-working woman.  She lives with her partner with whom she has two children, ages 18 and 14.  Her children as still dependent on her so they can finish their studies.  They live together in her mother's house as they provide her with the companionship and the care she needs.  

Alicia has a very difficult job.  She sells pork at the local market (Bellavista market).  She gets up very early to go to the slaughterhouse, where she had placed her order the day before, and from there she takes the meat to her stand located in the 6th block of the market.  She used to sell fish but since she likes to take on new challenges she started this job.  She works alone and has been doing this job for 8 years.  What she likes about her job is that she always has good and friendly sales partners around her and that they are always keeping an eye on things.  Things are going well with her business and she hopes that in the future she will be able to set up a shop in her house so that her children can help with the household income.  

This will be her twelfth loan with MFP.  She is grateful to the group that she belongs to as they are responsible and always fulfill their obligations.  She is also grateful for the opportunity to be able to increase her investment and hopes to be able to continue working so she can get ahead.  With the amount requested, she will buy meat to stock her business.

loans.use: purchase meat.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a married man with three children, two of whom attend school, while one is still too young for school. He lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, he has operated a tuk-tuk (three-wheeled motor vehicle) business, operating between home and the market. The major challenge he faces is competition from other tuk-tuk operators in the area. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans for resale

loans.name: Veronica Alexandra

texts.es:
Verónica de 31 años, es una mujer trabajadora que hace 10 años empezó su negocio con un préstamo familiar. Con este pequeño capital pudo abrir un pequeño bazar que poco a poco ah ido creciendo.

El negocio inicia a las 6 am y termina a las 8 pm. Su esposo la ayuda en el negocio.

Su dificultad es la delincuencia. Hace dos semanas asaltaron a un carro repartidor de productos que le entregaban a su negocio.

Solicita este préstamo para invertir en su negocio e incrementar los productos que se vende en su negocio como: cuaderno, lápiz, borradores, etc.

Su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda y que sus hijos puedan terminar sus carreras escolares.
texts.en: Verónica, 31, is a hardworking woman who started her business ten years ago with a family loan.  With this small capital she was able to open a small store that has been gradually growing.  She starts work at 6am and finishes at 8pm.  Her husband helps her in the store.  Her difficulty is crime.  Two weeks ago a delivery truck bringing merchandise to her store was held up.  She’s asking for this loan to invest in the business and increase the products she sells there like notebooks, pencils, erasers, etc.  Her dream is to finish building her house and that her children are able to finish their schooling.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Laura Vicenta

texts.es:
Laura de 40 años, vive en una zona suburbana llamada “Durán”.
La actividad de ella es la venta de helados, tiene un local en la parte delantera de su vivienda.
Ella escogió esta actividad porque lo heredo de su padre, ya que también tenía una heladería.
La dificultad de ella es que le sale muy alta las planillas de luz y a veces no tiene como cancelar esa cuota.
Está casada, el esposo trabaja en el municipio, tienen tres hijos uno de 7, 8y 10 años. Los tres estudian en escuelas públicas.
Ella solicita el préstamo para el incremento de su negocio, y para la compra de productos como: conos, servilletas, chocolate, etc.
Su sueño es incrementar su negocio y que sus hijos puedan terminar su carrera escolares.
texts.en: Laura is 40 years old. She lives in a suburban area called “Durán”. Her activity is selling ice cream. She has a locale in the front of her house. She chose this activity because she inherited it from her father, since he also has an ice cream store. Her problem is that her electricity bills are very high and sometimes she can't pay that bill. She is married and her husband works at city call. They have three children, aged 7, 8 and 10. The three of them go to public schools. She is asking for the loan to grow her business and to buy products such as: cones, napkins, chocolate, etc. Her dream is to grow her business and for her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy products such as cones, napkins, chocolate, etc.

loans.name: Ngao

texts.en:
Ngoa is a married man with 6 children, 2 of whom are enrolled in school, 2 have completed their primary school level, and the other 2 are still too young for school. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children.

Ngoa has operated a food stall for the past 6 years. His potential clients are his neighbors and friends. He faces a major challenge of the lack of sales sometimes. He dreams of expanding his business to a wholesale shop.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase wheat flour, beans, sugar, tea leaves and cooking fat for his business. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access financial facilities to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, beans, sugar, tea leaves and cooking fat for his business.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr:
Cliente de 54 ans, veuve avec 5 enfants a sa charge dont l’âge varie entre 17 et 36 ans. Elle se lance dans la vente  de la friperie en 1998  avec une somme de 30.000frs.
Elle est déjà passe par  trois cycles de prêts de Hope, elle est leader, très exemplaire, elle a fait ses remboursements sans défauts de paiements, et elle a des épargnes considérables.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle va acheter des ballots de friperie de sous vêtements non utilises, tel que des soutiens et slips des femmes.
Sa stratégie est de choisir les meilleurs produits et d’offrir une bonne qualité de service à ses clients.
Elle a pour ambition d’ouvrir une boutique de sous vêtements, prendre soin de ses enfants et assuré leur avenir.
texts.en:
This client is 54 years old, widowed, and has five children between the ages of 17 and 36 in her care. She began selling second-hand clothing in 1998 with 30,000 Frs. capital.
She has already gone through three loan cycles with Hope; she is an exemplary leader, has repaid her loans without defaulting, and has built up considerable savings.
With this new loan, she is going to buy bales of second-hand clothing, specifically unused undergarments such as bras and women's slips.
Her strategy is to choose the best products and to offer quality service to her customers.
Her ambitions are to open an undergarments store and to take care of her children and ensure a good future for them.

loans.use: To buy bales of second-hand clothing, specifically unused women's undergarments.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 43-year-old mother who has five sons and one daughter. Her husband works as a taxi driver.

Her third son is Mohammad, a freshman student who registered to study accounting. His mother Hanan has applied for this loan to be able to pay his semester tuition fees so he can continue his studies and work is the accounting field as soon as he finishes. This is what he is planning. 

Because Hanan is a conservative person, her son Mohammad, who is the student this loan was taken for, has agreed to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: To pay her son's semester tuition for college

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a 22-year-old woman living in the town of Asaga.  She is married and has one small child. To make a living, Rosa owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruit and vegetables for sale. Rosa  has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 760 WST a month from these activities.

In 2011, Rosa  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  This is the first time Rosa has requested a loan from SPBD.  She has asked for 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Rosa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her child.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Mrs. Seng is a diligent mother who earns a living by growing rice and vegetable crops in Takhmao town. She is an experienced farmer because she has been engaged in farming for 26 years.  She typically earns in the neighborhood of $4.00 per day through her effort. Currently her two daughters are working in a garment factory as sewing staff to help support the living. 

This loan of $700 will enable Mrs. Seng to buy a piece of land for constructing a shelter for the whole family to live as before she has lived on her neighbor’s land. But soon this piece of land will be sold to another owner. She is very happy and appreciative to all lenders who kindly help her family.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land for constructing a shelter.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila expresses her commitment and full devotion to her business and to her family as well. Laila has operated a small sari-sari (variety) store for four years and six months. The profits earned from her businesses allow her to pay her family's monthly electric bill and to provide their daily needs. 
 
Laila wants to strengthen her business but has insufficient funds, so she is asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, vinegar, and other basic kitchen needs. She wants to stock more items in her store to meet all her customers' requests. In the future, Laila aims to have a large store to earn higher revenue.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, vinegar, and other basic kitchen needs.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 28-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has had a salon in Yei, South Sudan for five years. Grace is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase weaves, gel and hair lotions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase weaves, gel and hair lotions to sell

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Luzviminda has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Luzviminda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Luzviminda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Amulasi

texts.en:
Amulasi is 40 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has five children, who are all currently in school. For the past four years, Amulasi has been working hard to manage her bar, which sells beer and other beverages. 

To help expand her business, Amulasi has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more beer to sell and will help her to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Amulasi hopes that in the future she will be able to own a larger bar and retail shop. 

Amulasi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Amulasi who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more beer to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi  Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKADI III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FALAN, un des villages de BOUGOULA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz, l’arachide et le gombo avec  KOROTOUMOU, 3ème personne debout  de la  droite  vers la  gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  110.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aider  aussi son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

loans.name: Eulalyn

texts.en: Eulalyn resides in San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman with three children aged 2, 3 and 5. Together with her husband, she sells fish in the community of San Miguel. They usually transport their fish using their motorcycle. Her husband helps by being the driver when she sell her fish. Her husband also farms rice. She is asking a loan to buy more fresh fish to sell. An additional capital from loan will allow Eulalyn to take advantage of the fresh catch that she can buy from fishermen and sell in the morning and late in the afternoon. This business will allow her to take care of her children's needs, pay for school fees and give them healthy food.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Lissette

texts.en:
Lissette M. (45 years old), she is married, has 3 children, and works in jewelery sales and her jewelery items are made from Brasilian gold. The loan will allow her to stock jewelery in order to sell them in the businesses she visits daily, thereby improving the livelihood of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer.

Lissette M. (45 años), Maestra de profesión, casada, 3 hijos, se dedica a la venta de prendas confeccionadas con oro brasileño. El crédito le permitirá abastecerse de prendas para colocarlas en las empresas que diariamente visita, mejorando así la economía de su familia.

loans.use: To buy Brasilian gold.

loans.name: Saadat

texts.en:
Saadat is 32 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Ehmedbeyli village. She is single.
You can see in the picture a woman, who is Saadat's sister. She helps Saadat to improve cattle breeding.
Saadat has run this business for 5 years.
In the beginning of her business, she borrowed $400 and bought 2 calves.
Now she needs a loan of $800 to buy 4 calves.
Saadat plans to raise her income level.
She intends to do this by increasing the number of cattle.

loans.use: To buy 4 calves

loans.name: Naoupu

texts.en: Naoupu is a hardworking, thirty nine year old woman.  She is a married mother of six school-age children.  Naoupu also has seven siblings, and the income she brings in from her ice-pop business not only goes to support her children but in typical Samoan fashion, is shared among her siblings and extended family also.  She has used loans from SPBD to build up her ice-pop business.  She says that she is the top seller of ice-pops in her village, and she attributes this to a unique ingredient that she won’t disclose.  Having fully repaid previous loans, Naoupu is eligible for an additional loan, which she will use both to support her business by purchasing bulk supplies but also to make a payment on her children’s fees.

loans.use: Purchase bulk supplies of sugar, cordials, purified water and pay children’s school fees

loans.name: Edorh

texts.en: Edorh H. is a fish seller at the Angré open market (eastside of Abidjan). Born in Nigeria in 1966 and married, she is the mother of three children who are completing their education in Abidjan. She started her fish selling business in September, 1999.  The benefits from her activities have permitted her to help her husband (a taxi driver) to pay for their children's education expenses. She requests a loan from AE&I to purchase fish in bulk in order to satisfy retailers' orders and improves her margin.

loans.use: Edorh Hokinde

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married with one son and has been in the pharmacy business for 5 years. Her business is located in Kayunga Town. She has acquired a plot of land and wants to grow her pharmacy into a wholesale business. She wants to target the market as there is no wholesale drug shop in Kayunga.

In the future she hopes to open up a maternity wing because mothers - especially young ones- suffer a lot with complications during childbirth in Uganda. Expanding her business will enable her not only to help others but also to increase her income and help her support her family.

loans.use: To buy malaria drugs, pain killers, antibiotics and mosquito nets for wholesale trading.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Nghem

texts.en: Mrs. Nghem K., 47, is married and lives with her husband and nine children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband work on a piece of land where they grow and grind rice crops, earning collectively around $4.50/day. Four of her children are employed at a garment factory located in Phnom Penh city, and the other five are enrolled in school. To expand her crops and make job further faster and easier Mrs. Nghem K. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase more seeds and a grinding mill so that she won’t have t o grind her crops manually. This will increase her production, and thus her income.

loans.use: To purchase more rice crops and a grinding mill to faciltate her job.

loans.name: Chek

texts.en:
Mrs. P. Chek (47) and her husband, Tuy Sun have been married since 1988. They have three children, two sons and one daughter. All of their children are studying in a local school. Chek and her family live along national road number one, south of Phnom Penh. She has been in business selling bananas and flowers since 2000. She buys them from farms in her village for reselling at the market in Phnom Penh. Her husband does farming and grows flower on his farm far from home. 

Chek is requesting her third loan from MAXIMA for $1000. She will use this loan to expand her business and to make repairs to her house.

loans.use: To buy bananas for reselling and to make house repairs

loans.name: Funmilayo

texts.en: Funmilayo S. is 55-years-old, married and has three children. Her family lives in Mushin  Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been in business since 1987 selling elubo (dried yam, cassava and plantain). Mrs. S. is requesting a loan amount of $450 to purchase additional product for resale.

loans.use: To purchase elubo (dried yam, cassava and plantain) for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase clothing in bulk for inventory.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is twenty-five years old. She sells body creams, deodorant, hair creams, combs, hair conditioners, shampoos, etc in her community.

She wants to use her loan to buy more products to expand her operations.

Monica is a member of the group called “Awurade Ye” (meaning God is good). Members of the group agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more hair cream, artificial hair, body creams, etc.

loans.name: Erkin

texts.en: Erkin B. lives in the high-mountain region of  Tajikistan where agriculture and livestock is a primary business. Erkin is married and has 3 children. He is a respectable man on the collective farm because he is very hard-working  and a good family man. His wife works as a dressmaker and he works on the collective farm but since it is seasonal work he is engaged in the livestock business as well. Mr. B.  applies to KIVA with a loan request of 2100 TJS for 6 months. The loan will be used to purchase pedigree bulls and increase his flock.

loans.use: To purchase a pedigree bull and increase the flock.

loans.name: Wotsa

texts.fr:
Born into a modest family originally from the village of Keve in Ave Prefecture, Miss Wotsa F. was born on April 12, 1978. She is single. In 2004 she opened a sewing workroom called “Couture aux Elegantes” (Sewing for Elegant Women) in Lomé’s Adidogomé neighborhood. She currently has three apprentice seamstresses. The first loan she obtained enabled her to buy pagnes (colorful African cloth) to re-sell. The loan she is requesting now will enable her to buy an overlock machine and 12 pieces of mid-quality pagne.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Issue d’une famille modeste et originaire du village de KEVE dans la préfecture de l’AVE, Mademoiselle F. Wotsa est née le 12 avril 1978. Elle est célibataire. En 2004 elle a crée son atelier de couture dénommé « COUTURE AUX ELEGANTES » dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Actuellement elle a trois apprenties couturières. Le premier crédit qu’elle avait obtenu lui a permis d’acheter des pagnes et de les revendre. Le crédit actuel qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acquérir une machine à surfilage et 12 pièces de pagne de qualité intermédiaire.

loans.use: To buy an overlock sewing machine and pagnes (African cloth)

loans.name: Suraiya's Group

texts.en:
Suraiya baji is the wife of N. A. and they have been living in the city of Kasur, Pakistan for the last 45 years. She owns a two-room brick house, and she is the mother of three children, one son and two daughters. Both daughters are in 10th standard. Her son is an electrician by profession. Suraiya is not only a housewife, she is also a businesswoman specializing in garment sales. She successfully completed a loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan for her garment business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Saira baji wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw. Sadiqan baji wants a loan for her grocery shop. Maryam baji wants a loan to buy a land on contract. Shamim baji wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw. (Baji is an Urdu term of respect meaning 'elder sister'.)

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses
